story:
Short Summary

Greetings Indiegogo users! We need your help. The Mediterranean Consortium for Nature and Culture is a group of reputable Non-Profit organizations (DiversEarth, WWF North Africa, Doga Dernegi, Med-INA, Society for the Protection of Nature in Lebanon, Trashumancia y Naturaleza) working in the Mediterranean to support ordinary people who make a difference for nature - just by the way they live their lives. 

We are currently trying to help the transhumant shepherds and nomadic pastoralists in the Mediterranean since they hold so many keys to shaping a sustainable future. We first of all want to celebrate them and their extraordinary ecological knowledge through a professional photography exhibition and book that will capture the spirit of their lives. 

Professional photographers from each sub-region (Iberian Peninsula, North Africa, West Asia, Turkey and Greece & Balkans) have been engaged in this exciting project. The exhibition will be shown later in the year, and 2015, in Geneva (Switzerland), Tunis, Istanbul, Beirut and Athens! And our coffee table book will pull it all together.

What We Need & What You Get

We need funding:

- to ensure the highest quality exhibition (which will be launched in some of the most prestigious exhibition centers and museums in the Mediterranean, as well as the celebrated Natural History Museum in Geneva, Switzerland)

- to support On the Move's travel to the various Mediterranean centers

- to produce a beautiful coffee table book, the proceeds of which will go back into the technical projects that will help support this cause

We have organised a number of perks for you, and would appreciate however much you can afford to give. Thank you!

The Impact

Transhumant shepherds and nomadic pastoralists move their domestic herds for miles, adapting to the climate and availability of food and water. This process is a wonderful example of how people really can live in harmony with nature. Yet they are rarely given the recognition they deserve and in most cases they face growing hardship and their lifeways are becoming more and more threatened.

Through this project we aim to reinforce traditional practices, techniques and ways of living such as this, as well as celebrating the ingenuity of people all across the Mediterranean to protect and manage their lands, waters and resources. We hope that you can join us today and contribute to a real revival of such practices so that they remain - or become - robust enough to stand their ground in the 21st century.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't help financially but would like to show your support for this cause, there are always many ways of getting involved. Just get in touch with us through our websites.

DiversEarth: www.diversearth.org

The Mediterranean Consortium for Nature and Culture: www.medconsortium.org

story: N/A

HOWDY!  I'M SARAH GISH, A HOUSTON-BASED ARTIST AND CONNECTOR.  


I created an art project and community campaign called IGNITE YOUR LIFE! (see more about it here:  www.igniteyourownlife.com).  I am very proud of it, slightly obsessed with it, and am totally passionate about how people IGNITE their lives.  You can see the story of the project and more about me on the website (I highly recommend you read that as it's actually a pretty WILD story).

I am asking you to help me IGNITE LIVES.  Since I started this project over a year ago, I have heard amazing stories – the story of a man who wanted to kill himself but didn’t, the story of a woman who was taking a bucket list trip with friends because she was very ill, the story of three women who were traveling the U.S. for the first time on their own, and the story of a girl who ignites her life by weaving tales of magical mermaids.  I got to meet Adrian Belic, director of the wonderful film HAPPY, who ignites his life through passion, travel, meeting new people, playing, and curiosity.  I got to meet Kathleen Keen, a dynamic, focused woman who is married to singer/songwriter Robert Earl Keen and ignites her life through exertion, hiking, and loving herself.  And I got to meet one of my longtime heroes -- surfer/skateboarder Peggy Oki, of the famed California Zephyr skateboarding team (also known as the Z-Boys), who ignites her life by bringing attention to the plight of marine animals in her beloved second home, the ocean.  Please check out the Gallery page to see a few photos, watch some videos, and read a few stories.  I know you'll enjoy my new friends as much as I did.  NOTE:  you cannot see the Gallery page from your phone :( .  

It’s been an AMAZING JOURNEY and I’d love for you to join me! 

HERE’S WHY:  When I interview people about how they ignite their lives, their stories inspire others to ignite their own lives.  And when we set this inspiration in motion, we can change the world.  Imagine a place where everyone lived from their heart!  That’s what happens when you ignite your life. 

Please help me to continue doing my RESEARCH for the project and to continue the inspiration train.  I recently landed an interview with internationally acclaimed writer and thought leader Jerry Jampolsky (www.jerryjampolsky.com), author of the seminal book Love is Letting Go of Fear.  That has ignited me and now I want to do even more interviews!  I also have plans to write a book and to create a gallery show.  And I’ll be partnering with a nonprofit (soon to be announced) to increase the scope of this project even more.  My research takes me here, there, and everywhere but often it's done in my hometown of Houston.  So the bulk of the money you kindly donate to me will actually be put towards the book, the gallery show, and the lovely nonprofit that I partner with. 

Please join me on my travels as I post on my Facebook page (www.facebook.com/igniteyourownlife) about how people IGNITE their lives, what makes their heart sing, and TOGETHER…

 LET'S SET THE WORLD ON FIRE!

ARE YOU READY TO OPEN YOUR POCKETBOOK AND SUPPORT ME?  Then please check out my cool premiums (look on the right and you'll see them) and let's get started on IGNITING LIVES!

From the bottom of my ignited heart, THANK YOU!!!

CAN'T HELP ME WITH YOUR DOLLARS?
Doncha worry, there are other ways you can help.

If you can't help fund this project, please help us IGNITE lives by spreading the word!  Please share this page and also the page for the project itself, www.igniteyourownlife.com.   And, while you're there, sign up for our email list.  I am grateful for ANY help you can give me and I THANK YOU for reading this far!  Let's get it going on and IGNITE THE WORLD!

story: The Erie County Sheriff's Office of Buffalo, New York offers its sympathies for the loved ones of PO Liu and PO Ramos and would like to gather money together to send to their loved ones in order to pay tribute to their life of service.

story:
Hi, I'm Eric David, and the project I am doing is to write a book on the compendium of art teachings as taught by my Teacher,  Jack Richard, which stems from his numerous instructors, including Charles Burchfield, Robert Brackman(of The New York Art Students League),  Aaron Bohrod ( painter of many Time Magazine covers), Yasuo Kuniyoshi,  Ben Shahn, Ben Stahl, and many others,  including, (but not limited to) the  teachings of The Famous Artists' School, The Old Masters, Illustrators, and professional artists working in the field of various art disciplines. I would also like to include a small biography on Jack, as he has led  a very fruitful life filled with great experiences,(and continues to do so, at 89 years of age!), including being commissioned to paint Four Presidents, as well as such notables as Bob Hope, Bing Crosby, and Charles Schulz, to name a few. He has met Presidents Gerald Ford and George Bush Sr., and painted at the time, what was the largest portrait ever made, of Dwight D. Eisenhower, and his wife, which was commissioned by the Tupperware Company, and painted in large sections by Tupperware employees, who had no idea what they were painting until it was erected.

    Jack has also had a great many students who have achieved much in the Art world, including: Charles Pfahl,  who American Artist Magazine proclaimed the best Realist artist in America, (not once but twice, in different decades), Colleen Black, who was commissioned by former  General  Colin Powell  to create bronze sculptures for himself and 7 Congressional Medal of Honor recipients, Andrew Voth,  the former director of the Carnegie Art Museum in California, and John Christopher Heindl,  who was the Art Director for the MGM Grand Lion in Las Vegas,  the largest bronze sculpture in the hemisphere, while he was working with Art Enterprises. Others include:  Mark Giangaspero, who was the first person to receive top award in the Butler Institute of American Arts   National Midyear Show,  two years in a row( from different nationally known judges) and receive the Purchase Award from the Museum those same two years. Former students also include professors of art/ painting, and professional artists at the local and National levels.

The  body of this book will be made up of  instruction on materials, demos , art techniques and history, including the processes involved for painting portraits, landscapes, still life, and abstract,  in a variety of mediums, including acrylic, watercolor, oil, and drawing media, with an emphasis on shape and values, color mixing, edges, design and composition,  color harmony,  posing a subject, using reference photos and much more.

Any funds received from your donations will be used for art supplies, (brushes, canvases, paints, camera batteries, etc.) manuscript packages to be sent out to prospective publishers, travel expenditures that may occur when meeting with interested potential publishers, any transcription fees that may occur from lectures, notes, etc,..basically any expenses that may be involved in the writing process of this book.  I know a couple of authors who have written books, but nothing of this scope or magnitude, so I really have no more than a ballpark idea of what the final cost may be, so I have left the total campaign amount at $5000., Which even if not met, anything at all will be of great assistance to realize this project! And anything extra past that will certainly expedite the writing process, and help to make an even better production. (with any extra, I could possibly make an accompanying DVD of demonstrations, further instruction, something along those lines. 

I also intend to split any profit or royalty stemming from the published book with Jack, himself, as this project certainly could not be undertaken without him.


  Even if I cannot get a publishing company to pick this book up, I will still make an ebook copy available, and consider self publishing,(though, I understand this can run into the tens of thousands of dollars), however, I will try my hardest to make this happen with every resource available to me, including former students, my author friends,..whatever it takes.:) 


 Please help me to make this book a reality, so that I can honor Jack while he is still here! He has given so much to so many, and I would like to be able to return it to him! When I became an Art Teacher, I was told by Jack and Mark Giangaspero to keep it alive by passing it on to others, and this book is an opportunity for me to do that on the largest scale possible that I can think of! Thank you, Sincerely, Eric David

 Perks will be updated as slots fill due to the limited number of paintings performed for the book. I will keep all of you updated regularly as to what new ones available will be, as well as my progress. Thank You!!

About me: I have performed commission work for  the Northeast Ohio University and College of Medicine( Neoucom) for my original paintings, was accepted into the first National Juried Show I ever entered( Viewpoint 2007 at the Cincinnati Arts Club, Juror: David Pyle of the Artist's Magazine), have performed design work at a Cleveland Public pool, and currently Teach Fine Painting and Drawing for the City of Cuyahoga Falls, OH, where I live and work. I was also the top seller at a local Gallery I held a studio at( Red Light Gallery, Akron, Oh), for two years in a row. I have also assisted on restoration of a 268 ft. mural for Canton Timken High School, and have worked for and apprenticed with Jack Richard and Mark Giangaspero for almost ten years.

story:
Heal Through Art (HeArt)

We are forming a coalition of artists from all disciplines to use their talents to facilitate impact investments throughout the world!
 
HeArt was founded to become a community where the proceeds that are generated from artistic innovation can be pooled to make impact investments to solve the world's issues from disease, poverty and war!
 
HeArt will strike partnerships with impact investment funds that have the necessary expertise and infrastructure to best utilize the funds that we raise in the best possible manner.
 
Through art we can all come together to heal the world!
 

HeArt's Executive Director!

HeArt's Executive Director, Il-Ryoung Lee, received her Bachelor's degree in voice at Seoul National University.  She obtained her Master's degree in Music from the graduate school in Sungshin Woman's University.  She subsequently received her Master's degree in Music (M.M.) from The Juilliard School under the tutelage of Mr. Daniel Ferro.  During her studies at Julliard, she was the receipient of the Philo Higley Scholarship and the Phyllis Joan Hoyland Memorial Scholarship.  She conttinued her music studies in the Professional Studies Program at the Mannes College of Music, where she has studied with Ms. Bonnie Hamilton. 

Dedicating her whole life to helping others, Il-Ryoung has held countless concerts for those less unfortunate and wishes to continue to work with artists across the globe to make a sustainable impact on fighting what ails the world.

 

Why Not Give the Funds to Charity?

Charity has been a huge healing hand for many of the underserved communities in the world! However, HeArt believes that impact investing yields much more sustainable results by creating businesses and an underlying community that can grow to learn to heal itself.  HeArt will be there to give the initial boost necessary to get it off the ground!

What Are the Funds For?

We are requesting $50,000 in initial funding which is going to be used for the following tasks:
 
  • Initial coordination with artists and musicians to form the executive community and will coordinate the impact concerts and galleries
  • Coordination with impact funds that are often times located in numerous geographic areas requiring a certain amount of travel
  • Marketing material generation
  • Website creation in multiple languages
  • Holding initial set of galleries and concerts to kick off the HeArt launch!

HeArt is for Everyone

HeArt is not only for artists: it is literally for everyone.  While we often try to devise ways of trying to give back to the community, art is what brings us together and touches our most human connection.  HeArt is connecting this beauty to heal the world by funneling impact investments from individuals like you.
 
So whether you are an artist or not, we hope that you'll join us in our campaign to help fight poverty, war and disease throughout the world!

story:
MY STORY:

Hi.  My name is Steve Snell and I am an artist, video maker, and pseudo-adventurer.  I am also an Artist-in-Residence at the HUB-BUB here in Spartanburg for about 3 more days.  The goal of this campaign is to raise money in order for me to remain in area for the summer and complete my newest and greatest adventure-art project, THE EPIC SPARTANBURG.

 

IMPACT:

THE EPIC SPARTANBURG is and will be an experience built upon the collective, collaborative creativity and adventures of people from the Spartanburg community. Basically, this project invites the public to bring their ideas of adventure to me.  I will in turn accompany participants on these journeys into the unknown, while making them appear very heroic and epic in video while doing so.  The final product will be short video piece of each adventure, which will then be played on the local Spartanburg City Channel as well as part of a larger premier at the HUB-BUB Showroom.  The impact of this project will be profound on the individual level, providing people with new experiences and challenging them to take on the unknown. It will also build a visual experience of Spartanburg for the entire world to see by watching this series of video shorts via the internet.  It will make Spartanburg look EPIC, I promise.

 

WHAT I NEED & WHAT YOU GET:

All donations will be used to buy equipment in order to record this adventure project in the most epic way possible.  That means things like bike and car mounts for cameras, batteries, and microphones.  Donations will also go towards subsidizing my rent in Spartanburg for the summer, so that I can remain in the area.  Basically, I’m trying to fund my own residency since my time at HUB-BUB is now over.

  

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:

Spread the word about THE EPIC SPARTANBURG and share the video.   If you aren’t into donating or buying art, hire me for odd jobs and work!  If you know someone who might be interested in participating, tell them about this opportunity for adventure!  Here is a link to the original commercial: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OUExkawibGI&...

All donations will be used to buy equipment in order to record this adventure project in the most epic way possible.  That means things like bike and car mounts for cameras, batteries, and microphones.  Donations will also go towards subsidizing my rent in Spartanburg for the summer, so that I can remain in the area.  Basically, I’m trying to fund my own residency since my time at HUB-BUB is now over.
  
OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP:
Spread the word about THE EPIC SPARTANBURG and share the video.   If you aren’t into donating or buying art, hire me for odd jobs and work!  If you know someone who might be interested in participating, tell them about this opportunity for adventure!  Here is a link to the original commercial: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=OUExkawibGI&...

story:
My Story

My name is Kristina. I am an artist, out to prove my parents WRONG! Ever since I could hold a pencil, I have been doodling on every possible surface. My passions for art run deep. A few years back, I attended a Eckerd college- on my way to graduating with a degree in Fine Art. Hmmmmm, but that was not good enough for the parentals. All I ever heard was, "so what? You just want to be a starving artist?" UGH I HATE THOSE WORDS!

or I would get the old, "Do you know how few people can make it as a painter? Talent does not matter." 

 

SO, I dropped out of my painting classes, and moved from Florida to Los Angeles in pursuit of more "important" things. Journalism, business, economics, politics, WAITRESSING! blah. This was not for me. I always fell back on my art to get me through. (and funny enough, my parents started singing a different tune, as that degree fell further and further away. Now it became: "It doesn't matter what it is in, just get A DEGREE already!!! Basket weave for all we care."  Yea, right. I was sick of wasting time, passion, and talent.

The Impact

Recently I began to realize this overwhelming desire to help young woman. To encourage and inspire. To be the mentor I wished for as a teenager...just trying to fulfill my dreams, and have someone, anyone on my side.

I quickly had a light bulb go off, and have already begun to form an online community for young girls to come talk about fashion, art, hopes, fears, and service. It is a FUN place where I imagine these young ladies can grow.

www.RyukoTV.com was formed in August. In that same month, I was up for a $50k grant from Pepsi to fund a back-to-school project for underprivileged girls, but the votes did not come in fast enough. :(

http://www.ryuko.tv/watch.php  (this is a video of said project, to give you an idea of how I want to HELP)

 

During development of that website, I realized I had a knack for graphic design; a form of art I had never even considered before! and up popped www.MakeMeGraphic.com  (Basic premise: You upload a photo, and I turn you into a one-of-a-kind piece of graphic art, by hand.)

 

I truly think I am on the verge of something here. I found a way to BE AN ARTIST and HELP PEOPLE all at the same time. These projects can rocket me into a life, dedicated to beauty and service. Then, most importantly, I can say to mom and dad (and various skeptics---you KNOW who you are!), "TOLD YA SO!"

 

What I Need & What You Get

So, here is where YOU come in.

 

I am SO CLOSE to being able to do this right. I have the time and talent, and a wonderful web-developer......... but I do not have the money to purchase the proper equipment I need to complete the web-sites!

 

1. First of all, for the Graphic business, I need the capacity to create HUGE files, so that when you order a piece of art, I can have them printed onto a VERY large canvas, for optimum enjoyment in your home. That is how a new computer can change my life....

 

2. Printing! That's another thing. I need a means to have prints made. Expensive stuff.

 

3. Ryuko- needs to be completed. Lots of loose ends, and I need money to copywrite my designs! Any advancement and money I make on this website will be given back ten-fold.

 

I know I can turn your combined donations of just $5,000 into a thriving business.

If somehow I am crazy-blessed by this wonderful new way of contribution, and exceed my goal, I will have the time to work less on the day-to-day grind, and more on making a difference....  and on creating ART!

Possibilities are endless.

 

When you make a contribution, I will send you a personal thank you card and kiss your face all over if/when I ever run into you! ha! Donate a fat hunk 'o' dough, and you will get a one-of-a-kind graphic portrait of yourself, on the house! Listen, I realize what a sacrifice it is to give to someone who, might not be in dire need, (I mean I am not homeless or starving)...but give to someone who knows her dreams are worth reaching for....and has no problem asking for a little help.

 

Also, don't get me wrong. My parents love me and wish to see me succeed, but doubt is in the air people!

 

NOTE to mom and dad----- if you do indeed believe I can do this, feel free to donate and spread the word using the share tools. This way I can give you the chance to say, "told ya so" back at me!

 

Other Ways You Can Help

'Do It With Others'   Get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. I know not everybody can give money to a campaign, but everyone has a voice and can spread the word. THANK YOU so much for your help! I can't wait to show you what I am capable of. Let's do some good together :) Let's make something beautiful. Let's have some FUN! and most importantly, give back.

 

Consider this paying it forward. You give me $10, and I will pay it forward. Cross my heart.

 

with Love,

Kristina Ortega

story:
I am a self taught artist/ Special FX artist whose work tends to center around horror, fantasy and science fiction. I work mostly in traditional means (ie: Acrylics, watercolor and sculpture) but have also worked with digital art as well.

I want to get my artwork out there and be able to sell it at some of the bigger conventions, that are slightly out of my reach. If I can raise the money it will send me me on my way to buy tables at some of the bigger conventions that I have not been able to afford as of yet, as well as pay for hotel room, gas and materials to make my art with.

I am looking to raise about $2000, which will cover the table cost at the local Arizona conventions that I want to go to. It will also enable me to get hotel rooms and pay for gas to get to the conventions out of Tucson city limits (which is where I am located).

Now, you may ask, "What do I get out of this?" For one thing you would be supporting an Artist who will be eternally grateful for your help. Also I will give you stuff. You will recive original Artwork, buttons and sticks as well, made by me! Also again, Eternal Gratitude.

But really here's what you gut:

$5 Level Your Choice of 3 Buttons

You may choose any 3 from a selection of the buttons I have available. Below are what I gots.

 

$10 Level Custom Art Card


I will make you a custom 2.5 x 3.5 card drawn on cardstock. For examples of my work and style go here: http://zombierodentproductions.daportfolio.com/

 

$20 Level Custom Digital Art

You will get a 8.5 x 11 piece of digital art, made by me, on card stock. Go here to see examples: http://zombierodentproductions.daportfolio.com/gallery/258324

 

$25 Level Custom Painted Tie

I will paint for you a custom tie. You will get to choose from an arotments of ties and I shall paint things on there for you. Here are some examples.

 

$40 Level Hand Colored Print

I will create for you a custom 8.5 x 11 watercolored piece. Lucky you! Look at links above for examples.

 

$50 Level Custom Card Game Mat

You will be made a one of a kind card game mat (but you can use it as a really big mouse pad) painted by me! Done with Mixed media and love. Because love is important.

 

$100 Level Original Canvas

You have shown your true awesomness and I will be painting for you a 20 x 15.5 Canvas. Done with Acrylic and Love. Lots and lots of love, plus a helping of eternal gratitude.

story:
What's happening:

SALT is currently making plans for an evangelism campaign here in Orlando. The goal is to proclaim the gospel of Jesus Christ to the people of the Greater Orlando area through various ways (home bible studies, distribution of study bibles, evangelism event series, health expos, etc.

The beginning of this year, our organization joined up with a worldwide young people's organization known as Generation of Youth for Christ, and on Friday, in a span of 4 hours, we sent close to 3,000 young people in the community to canvass the book The Great Controversy, as well as promotions for our upcoming evangelism campaign.

  • 22,622 doors were knocked on

  • 15,517 GLOW tracts were handed out

  • 2,089 people accepted prayer

  • 216 bible study requests

  • 2,238 Great Controversies were distributed


The need:

Part of our partnership with them was to help follow up with these contacts, we also will be spreading the word to our community through various ways of advertising. Orlando rarely sees evangelistic series and we have high hopes for the outcome of this one. We pray that you are moved to give whatever you can to help this goal to be reached. The dates had to be moved to April or early May because we need your help to make it happen!

The funds we raise will go to expenses that include:

  • Speaker (Flight, Lodging, and Food)

  • Venue (Movie Theatre for 12 nights)

  • Special Website

  • Flyers/Mail Outs/Bible Workers

  • Bible Study Material

  • Andrew Study Bibles

  • Prize Giveaways

  • Print outs

  • Sowing events (Health Ministry)


The impact:

Your financial help will greatly support the mission in bringing more souls to Christ through the distribution of Bible study materials, organizing evangelism events, and establishing and creating relationships with people.

Whether your only able to give a dollar, 5 dollars, 10 dollars, 20 dollars, or more, even a little will help!Your contribution will help us greatly in God's cause to reach out to the people of Orlando. Your monetary contribution can change someone's life.

Thank you for even considering standing with us as we undertake this responsible mission that God has entrusted to us.

story:
WE BELIEVE THAT CREATIVE HUB WORCESTER WILL PROVIDE ARTISTS AND CREATIVES FROM DIVERSE BACKGROUNDS A PLACE TO CO-EXIST AND WORK TOGETHER, WHICH WILL STRENGTHEN, REVITALIZE, AND PROPAGATE THE EXISTING CULTURAL COMMUNITY HERE IN CENTRAL MASSACHUSETTS!

What We Need

Our goal is to renovate and reactivate the former Ionic Ave Boys Club of Worcester and develop a flourishing ecosystem of artists, musicians, dancers, and supporters of the arts all co existing in the same space! We need to raise 2 million dollars to do this.

Why Do We Need This Money?

We've built a business plan and concept to help transform the arts community of Worcester, Massachusetts. The former Boys Club of Worcester was built in the 1920's, and it was set to be demolished  before the Worcester Historical Commission, as well as the current property owner, stepped in to help save this beautiful landmark. Your support will provide the funding needed to build-out this space for Creative Hub Worcester, including new HVAC systems, electric, plumbing, ADA accessible facilities, and more. 

EACH AND EVERY DONATION, NO MATTER THE AMOUNT, HELPS US GET CLOSER TO OUR GOAL OF SAVING AND REVITALIZING THIS HISTORICAL LANDMARK.

Creative Hub Worcester is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Creative Hub Worcester must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

Creative Hub Worcester is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non‐‑profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of Creative Hub Worcester must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. The value of campaign perks is $50-$150. Any contribution above that amount is tax‐deductible to the extent permitted by law.

Beyond Money— We Need Your Help Spreading The Word!

At its heart, Creative Hub Worcester is a grassroots organization driven by the passion of artists and art educators Laura Marotta and Stacy Lord. Whether you donate to our campaign or not, you can still help make history by spreading the word about who we are and what we are trying to do.

Ways You Can Help:

  • Share our donation page on Facebook or Twitter!
  • Have old art supplies or arts equipment that you want to donate? Email us at info@creativehubworcester.org 
  • Stay connected. Follow Creative Hub Worcester on Facebook or www.creativehubworcester.org to stay up-to-date on our events and progress.

Our Supporters:

Creative Hub Worcester in the Press:

Worcester Magazine: Creative Hub Worcester makes former Ionic Ave. space shine

Telegram: Bottom Line: Teachers pursue their vision for Worcester arts center at former Boys & Girls Club

Worcester Business Journal: Maker space coming to Worcester's Ionic Ave. Boys and Girls Club

Go Local Worcester: Construction Under Way on New Creative Hub Worcester

LEARN MORE ABOUT CREATIVE HUB WORCESTER AT

www.creativehubworcester.org

OR VISIT US ON FACEBOOK AT 

www.facebook.com/creativehubworcester

story:
Our Family Studio

We are a small family but we have big ideas. This Studio was formed so we can take our ideas and our craft to the next level.  Let me take a moment and introduce you to our Team

  • Julian Norton - Husband - Father - Owner, CEO, Lead Design. I graduated with a Masters in Architecture from Kent State University. I provide the design and engineering background for the projects we undertake at Cleveland Design Studio. I love the process that goes into designing and building tangible objects from idea to hand it’s an amazing journey
  • Yhosila - Wife - Business Management, Design. I have a Bachelor in Business Administration from Kent State University.  I was born and raised in Indonesia. I received a Fulbright Scholarship and earned the opportunity to study here in the United States. I am currently finishing my Masters of Business Administration at Cleveland State University. I bring the business background and pricing information help that is needed to ensure our studio is able to stay self-sustaining. I love creative problem solving it’s a joy to successfully overcome an issue.
  • Trixie - Daughter - Idea Generator. I am the youngest member of CDS at 10 years old. While young my passion is equal to any fortune 500 CEO. I assist around the studio doing inventory and coming up with "Out of the Box" ideas that stem from my incredibly imaginative mind. 

 Why Start a Design Studio? (Our Story)

  • Designing has been a passion of Julian's since he was young. The ability to create what we dream is truly incredible. Design for him was an outlet to make a difference in his community and his daily life. With every item created life seemed to get little bit nicer. But quickly life seemed to get in the way and design took a backseat in his busy schedule. That all changed when he met his wife Yhosila. In Yhosila he knew he had found the missing part of his life. Yhosila is the kind of person who does what she says and would move a mountain if it was in her way (when they met he was in the way of the food table - she quickly sorted him out). She does not accept anything but the best in people because that is what she gives to everyone. Our family grew when we adopted her sister Trixie. Trixie is a girl who has more courage than a lion and a bigger heart than an elephant. She helps ground us morally as she is the type of person who would gladly share her food even if it meant she would go without.  As we became a family we incurred expense after expense between legal and immigration issues, education expenses and student loans we were unable to make ends meet through a traditional 8-5. While brainstorming we thought of everything we could do to try to cut expenses and generate income. Sitting at our kitchen table we realized the answers were all around us; hanging on every wall and in every corner of our home. The old relics of the designs we had experimented with would become the vehicle for the support we desperately needed, thus Cleveland Design Studio was created. Our family and our studio is determined to make a difference. Not only improving our lives but to help our community as they have helped us. We know that without our family, friends, and the kindness of strangers our studio will just be a dream. We are offering samples of our work to anyone who is able to help support our cause with a donation as a thank you for believing in us.

End Goal

  • With the starting capital we hope to raise here we know we can produce not only creative designs and art but also give back to the community and the people who need it most. Since 2016 we have set up scholarships at the local city level to help student with educational expenses. One of the major goals of this Studio is to help supplement our family's expenses and to increase the amount of scholarships we can offer. We hope to be able to set aside a percentage of every sale we make in the first 10 years of operation to finance the creation of a marker space for local children and young adults. Here they will learn how design and their creative abilities can lead to a better everyday life. By creating rather than destroying local youth and dreamers can positively change the world they live in. Every person will be able to market their designs through our web portal and help raise funds for themselves and their goals and to expand and improve the studio.

Breakdown of What Your Funds are Going To

  • Our essential fund raising goal is $8,500 dollars. With that money we will be able to expand and purchase a laser cutter. This will allow the creation of designs and products that can be sold on an industrial scale. The breakdown of our funds will go as follows:
    • $8,200 is the actual cost of the 80W laser and the cooling system that it will need. 
    • $300 is the cost for shipping the machine to our studio in Cleveland.

If we are able to raise any additional funds we plan to do the following;

  • An additional $400 will allow us to purchase a rotary tool that will help us create objects that are cylindrical like personalized bats and glassware.
  • An additional $4000 will allow the rotary tool plus use an upgraded 150W laser head. This upgraded laser will allow us to cut Hardwoods such as Cherry, Teak, and Hickory.
  • Any additional money after $12,000 total will be used to upgrade the materials we can offer and help purchase additional tools for our studio such as: clamps, a band-saw, a shop vacuum system, an additional power upgrade to the studio, and for the creation of our own website.
  • Any additional money after $15,000 total raised will allow us to break into additional markets and Medias with the purchase of a screen printing machine for T shirt design and 3d printer for quick prototyping.  We hope to purchase a robotic CNC machine for carving 1/2" and 1" plywood quickly and a ceramic studio for making pottery. 

PERKS!

  • All of our Perks that are offered on this page are items we will also be selling to the market once we purchase our first laser cutter. Each item is unique and cannot be found in traditional stores. With each level of donation you will receive a personal gift created by us that you helped directly finance

What Will Happen if We Don't Reach Our Goal

If we are unable to reach at least 85% of our goal we will be unable to finance our studio. If we are unable to find capital investors we will return all money given in this campaign. 

Risks & Challenges

We understand that running a new businesses is difficult but for us this is not a hobby endeavor, this is for our family's survival. Our family has overcome insurmountable odds to stay together through deaths, immigration difficulty, guardianship battles, and adoption rulings, throughout it all we have stuck together and always pulled through. It is this spirit of determination that will allow us to succeed even when faced with difficulties. We will not let you, our supporters down.

Other Ways You Can Help!

We need your help to get the word out if you are moved by our story or wish to help us out even more here is how you can:

  • Tell your family - mom/dad, siblings, cousins, grandma, grandpa, second uncles and aunts help share this campaign with them all. 
  • Like our Facebook and share the link with your friends to help get the word out. We will be communicating through our page to keep you up to date with the behind the scenes work.
  • Once you receive a piece or artwork from us show it off. Tell everyone about where you got it from when they give you a compliment. Word of mouth and recommendations help us grow our brand and create a solid base of quality products.
  • If you would like to donate but do not feel comfortable giving out credit card information on the internet please email us or message us on Facebook for alternative donations. 
  • Email us ideas or if you have old tools you think we could use or implement. All comments and help are welcome. Our email is clevelanddesignstudio@gmail.com
story_txt:
Our Family StudioWe are a small family but we have big ideas. This Studio was formed so we can take our ideas and our craft to the next level.  Let me take a moment and introduce you to our Team

Julian Norton - Husband - Father - Owner, CEO, Lead Design. I graduated with a Masters in Architecture from Kent State University. I provide the design and engineering background for the projects we undertake at Cleveland Design Studio. I love the process that goes into designing and building tangible objects from idea to hand it’s an amazing journey

Yhosila - Wife - Business Management, Design. I have a Bachelor in Business Administration from Kent State University.  I was born and raised in Indonesia. I received a Fulbright Scholarship and earned the opportunity to study here in the United States. I am currently finishing my Masters of Business Administration at Cleveland State University. I bring the business background and pricing information help that is needed to ensure our studio is able to stay self-sustaining. I love creative problem solving it’s a joy to successfully overcome an issue.

Trixie - Daughter - Idea Generator. I am the youngest member of CDS at 10 years old. While young my passion is equal to any fortune 500 CEO. I assist around the studio doing inventory and coming up with "Out of the Box" ideas that stem from my incredibly imaginative mind. 
 Why Start a Design Studio? (Our Story)Designing has been a passion of Julian's since he was young. The ability to create what we dream is truly incredible. Design for him was an outlet to make a difference in his community and his daily life. With every item created life seemed to get little bit nicer. But quickly life seemed to get in the way and design took a backseat in his busy schedule. That all changed when he met his wife Yhosila. In Yhosila he knew he had found the missing part of his life. Yhosila is the kind of person who does what she says and would move a mountain if it was in her way (when they met he was in the way of the food table - she quickly sorted him out). She does not accept anything but the best in people because that is what she gives to everyone. Our family grew when we adopted her sister Trixie. Trixie is a girl who has more courage than a lion and a bigger heart than an elephant. She helps ground us morally as she is the type of person who would gladly share her food even if it meant she would go without.  As we became a family we incurred expense after expense between legal and immigration issues, education expenses and student loans we were unable to make ends meet through a traditional 8-5. While brainstorming we thought of everything we could do to try to cut expenses and generate income. Sitting at our kitchen table we realized the answers were all around us; hanging on every wall and in every corner of our home. The old relics of the designs we had experimented with would become the vehicle for the support we desperately needed, thus Cleveland Design Studio was created. Our family and our studio is determined to make a difference. Not only improving our lives but to help our community as they have helped us. We know that without our family, friends, and the kindness of strangers our studio will just be a dream. We are offering samples of our work to anyone who is able to help support our cause with a donation as a thank you for believing in us.End GoalWith the starting capital we hope to raise here we know we can produce not only creative designs and art but also give back to the community and the people who need it most. Since 2016 we have set up scholarships at the local city level to help student with educational expenses. One of the major goals of this Studio is to help supplement our family's expenses and to increase the amount of scholarships we can offer. We hope to be able to set aside a percentage of every sale we make in the first 10 years of operation to finance the creation of a marker space for local children and young adults. Here they will learn how design and their creative abilities can lead to a better everyday life. By creating rather than destroying local youth and dreamers can positively change the world they live in. Every person will be able to market their designs through our web portal and help raise funds for themselves and their goals and to expand and improve the studio.Breakdown of What Your Funds are Going ToOur essential fund raising goal is $8,500 dollars. With that money we will be able to expand and purchase a laser cutter. This will allow the creation of designs and products that can be sold on an industrial scale. The breakdown of our funds will go as follows:
$8,200 is the actual cost of the 80W laser and the cooling system that it will need. 
$300 is the cost for shipping the machine to our studio in Cleveland.

If we are able to raise any additional funds we plan to do the following;
An additional $400 will allow us to purchase a rotary tool that will help us create objects that are cylindrical like personalized bats and glassware.
An additional $4000 will allow the rotary tool plus use an upgraded 150W laser head. This upgraded laser will allow us to cut Hardwoods such as Cherry, Teak, and Hickory.
Any additional money after $12,000 total will be used to upgrade the materials we can offer and help purchase additional tools for our studio such as: clamps, a band-saw, a shop vacuum system, an additional power upgrade to the studio, and for the creation of our own website.
Any additional money after $15,000 total raised will allow us to break into additional markets and Medias with the purchase of a screen printing machine for T shirt design and 3d printer for quick prototyping.  We hope to purchase a robotic CNC machine for carving 1/2" and 1" plywood quickly and a ceramic studio for making pottery. 
PERKS!All of our Perks that are offered on this page are items we will also be selling to the market once we purchase our first laser cutter. Each item is unique and cannot be found in traditional stores. With each level of donation you will receive a personal gift created by us that you helped directly financeWhat Will Happen if We Don't Reach Our GoalIf we are unable to reach at least 85% of our goal we will be unable to finance our studio. If we are unable to find capital investors we will return all money given in this campaign. Risks & ChallengesWe understand that running a new businesses is difficult but for us this is not a hobby endeavor, this is for our family's survival. Our family has overcome insurmountable odds to stay together through deaths, immigration difficulty, guardianship battles, and adoption rulings, throughout it all we have stuck together and always pulled through. It is this spirit of determination that will allow us to succeed even when faced with difficulties. We will not let you, our supporters down.Other Ways You Can Help!We need your help to get the word out if you are moved by our story or wish to help us out even more here is how you can:
Tell your family - mom/dad, siblings, cousins, grandma, grandpa, second uncles and aunts help share this campaign with them all. 
Like our Facebook and share the link with your friends to help get the word out. We will be communicating through our page to keep you up to date with the behind the scenes work.
Once you receive a piece or artwork from us show it off. Tell everyone about where you got it from when they give you a compliment. Word of mouth and recommendations help us grow our brand and create a solid base of quality products.
If you would like to donate but do not feel comfortable giving out credit card information on the internet please email us or message us on Facebook for alternative donations. 
Email us ideas or if you have old tools you think we could use or implement. All comments and help are welcome. Our email is clevelanddesignstudio@gmail.com

story:
We are a group of friends, artists, and people experienced with Burning Man culture. Through a large scale art project, known as The Journey, we are looking to build upon our joint playa histories of collaboration to create a reflective, interactive experience for Burning Man 2017. This campaign provides the money we need to get this project up and running. Through your contribution we will be able to buy materials, rent work space and get us to Burning Man.

This art piece is a large project with a budget just under $67k. We have applied for a BM Honoraria but we don’t anticipate our entire project to be funded by BM. Whether you go to Burning Man or not, we will gift each and every donation with a little bit of playa experience by means of our perks. Regardless of how much money is raised all funds will go directly to production of The Journey. The better we do at raising funds for the project, the more immersive experience we will provide at Burning Man. If we are not able to raise the entire budget, we will scale back the project and maybe provide fewer lights or interactive opportunities, that would really suck. So make it a reality.

What started as a scale model in April 2016, quickly led to a full scale proof of concept by this past fall. In October we took The Journey Run, a proof of concept piece, to YOUtopia, a Burning Man regional event in San Diego and Palm Springs PRIDE. Both events were wildly successful engaging communities and providing unique and memorable experiences for festival goers. People so loved The Journey Run experience, we started seeing profile pictures popping up all over Facebook taken at the nighttime sculpture.

Our two largest challenges, other than funding of course, are finding the programmatic technical expertise and space for storage and production. In both of these areas we have been reaching out to the larger Burning Man community in Southern California and have been met with responsive support. We are confident that our community will be able to rally around us and support us in these areas. That just leaves your role to help us raise the funds to get this project to Burning Man 2017. If you are not able to donate today, please by all means spread the word about our project. Share the link on your favorite social media site.

It is the end of the year, many people are looking for worthy donations to make as tax writeoffs. While Burning Man may seem like a long way off, we need to start working on this project immediately. We need your financial support so we can start working to bring The Journey to Burning Man 2017. Donate now!

The Journey is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non­profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of The Journey must be made payable to “Fractured Atlas” only. Any contribution above the value of the goods and services received by the donor is tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

story:
SCROLL DOWN FOR ENGLISH

Hvor fantastisk ville det være, hvis dette kunstværk hang over Istedgade under COVID-nedlukning.

 

Sammen kan vi få et kunstværk til at lyse til opmuntring og sammenhold på Istedgade og Vesterbro under den nuværende COVID-nedlukning.

 

Istedgade er kendt for meget, - ikke mindst for sammenhold!
lige nu, i denne periode, hvor nedlukningen fortsætter, vil det give så meget mening at installere Nina Wengels lysværk KEEP UP GOOD SPIRIT over legendariske Istedgade! 

Istedgade, der er berømt - og berygtet - over hele landet, som gaden, der sprudler dag og nat. Istedgade, der er kendt for fantastiske restauranter, barer og natteliv. Og Istedgade, der er gaden, som aldrig overgiver sig!

Mere end nogen anden gade er Istedgade indbegrebet af Vesterbro; en historisk gade, som alle i bydelen - hvis ikke alle i København - har et medejerskab til. Hvis gader kunne tale ...!

Hvor fantastisk ville værket se ud over Istedgade, men vi venter på, at Vesterbro åbner rigtigt? 

Kunstner Nina Wengel skabte værket i 2012, som et lysende opråb i mørket, henvendt til alle, om at holde ud, ikke miste modet. Værket er tidligere blevet vist på Roskilde Festival og tværs over Amagerbrogade.


Crowdfunding til installering

Siden den første nedlukning har jeg med varierende energi forsøgt at få kunstværket installeret over Istedgade, en overraskende udfordrende opgave, men jeg har 'kept up good spirit' og ikke givet op! Kommunen er meget positiv og der er givet tilladelse fra boligforeninger mellem Dannebrogsgade og Saxogade til at værket må hænge mellem dem. 

Prisen er 22.000 kr. ex. moms for at udstille værket i en måned. 
Dertil skal Indiegogo have 5%, hvorfor målet er 23.100 kr. 

Prisen dækker leje af to bemandede lifte, ansvarsforsikring, montering og afmontering ved certificerede el-entreprenører.

Håbet er, at vi sammen kan rejse midler til at få værket installeret! - Jeg har selv lagt de første 5.000 kr. Og derfor mangler vi 18.100 kr. 

ALLE bidrag tæller - fra en fem'er til ....18.100 kr. 

Alle bidrag tælller.

Og alle bidrag refunderes automatisk, hvis målet ikke nås

Mvh

Ane Bülow

/13. år på Istedgade

---

English

KEEP UP GOOD SPIRIT - art work to bring light, encouragement and unity to Istedgade during COVID lockdown

How great would this art work look across Istedgade? 

In the current time of continued lockdown it would make so much sense, to install this piece over legendary Istedgade, known to all for its numerous restuarants, bars, and lively nightlife. And known for never surrendering! COVID is exhausting but Istedgade and Vesterbro will always KEEP UP GOOD SPIRIT!

The work is created by Danish artist Nina Wengel to lift mood and courage whereever needed. The work has previously been shown at Roskilde Festival and across Amagerbrogade.

How great would it look across Istedgade? - More than any other street Istedgade is the epitome of Vesterbro; a historic street to which eveyone in the neighbourhood - if not the entire city -  feels a sense of belonging. If streets could talk...!

Since first lockdown I've been trying to get the art work installed, a surprisingly challeging task, but keeping up good spirit, I haven't gived up!

The price is 22,000 DKK ex VAT, to exhibit the work for one month.
Price covers rent of two manned lifts, third-party insurance, mounting and de-mounting by certified electrical contractors.

Hope together we can make this happen! - I'll chip in the first 5,000 DKK.

story:
The Team

Often called the dynamic duo, renowned artists Karen Y. Buster and Larry Poncho Brown are teaming up to expand their sorority product lines. Both artists have exhibited in sorority national conventions over the past two decades and have created many popular sorority works. Both artists are celebrating over 40 years in the art business and have amassed legions of followers and collectors.

Our Goal & Your Benefit

With your help we will be able to take new creations into production like calendars, sculptures, new prints releases, and much more!  Our perks contain many of the popular works of both artists created exclusively for sororities. Why not give a gift of art to your sorority sisters?

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

The Risks

Both artists have stellar reputations in the art world, so the risks and challenges are non-existant. Both artists have have experience shipping artwork internationally, so your perks will arrive in safe keeping. Timelines for delivery could be effected if response to our campaign is overwhelming.

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help. Please pass the words to anyone that could benefit from the perks being offered. Help us get the word out and make some noise about our campaign. You can also share it in your social networks too. We appreciate all of your support!


 

A SPECIAL THANK YOU TO OUR 26 BACKERS...
Ife A Robinson, Shawn Livers, Lauren Ishmael, Yeshiyah B. Israel, Dr. Sheila Wright, Dawn Simon-Matthews, Lester Buster, Cheryl Nathaniel, Carren Clarke-Mcadoo, Marcella A. Copes, Julia Ficklin, Mary Parker Marcus,

Jon B. White, Kenzel Graham, Alfay Manning, Jr., Charles Covington & Cyril Jones, Lloyd Marcus, Perry Sweeper,

Rene Brown, Eric Diggs, Donna Gardner, Alethia Alford,

Dee & Patrick McGuire, and Joseph Ford.

story:
Short Summary

Hi! I'm Malik Nashad Sharpe, a choreographer and video artist based between New York City, and London, UK. I am currently finishing the development of my newest work "SAD KING," which is a meditation around Black, Queer joyousness and choreographic form. A collaboration between myself as marikiscrycrycry (solo performance alias), The Hague-based musician, yEs!yEs, and under the mentorship New York City choreographer Tere O'Connor, "SAD KING" has been developed over the last year as a way to give another material voice to a fraught, yet visionary experience.

 

After the success of my last work "A S S I M I L A T I O N," including its international tour, which is still ongoing, there has been immense interest in showing "SAD KING" and it has secured premieres at the Brooklyn Arts Exchange, and FiveMyles Gallery in November, at the Hackney Showroom, London, UK in January 2017,  at the Black Box Teater in Oslo, Norway in February 2017, and at AKC Medika in March/April 2017. 

Your generous donation would ensure that I can feasibly tour this work by contributing to travel costs, honorarium for my collaborators, and general miscellaneous expenses that include makeup, glitter, and other materials. Most importantly, your support will help me bring my work to a variety of audiences across the globe, to revel in my research around Black, Queer identity!

What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $1700USD (Although you don't have to donate in USD if you are located in Europe, Canada, or elsewhere!) to help fray the cost of flights (London-->NYC, NYC-->London, London-->Oslo, Oslo-->Zagreb, Zagreb-->London), and accommodation as I plan the touring of this work,  to pay my collaborators what they deserve for contributing massively to the creation of "SAD KIND", and for miscellaneous materials that I will need for the continuance of this work. This is only a fraction of the total cost of touring this work, and your contribution would have immense impacts! Anything will help.

And there are perks! There are a series of gifts (photos, interviews, writings, posters, tickets, videos, amongst other things that I can offer as a thank you for your generosity)

The Impact

Without your support for my work, it wouldn't be possible to share my research with a wider audience. After I performed my last work "A S S I M I L A T I O N" in Zagreb, a little Croatian girl, maybe 2-3 years old, came to me with her Father after the performance to say that she thought I was beautiful and special, and it gave me hope that my work can reach far and wide, despite its political focus and radicality, even to young children who do not have active discourse on Black or Queer issues/experiences!

 

As I continue to make work, my urge to share grows even larger and I want to reach people, especially during this tough time where we are living through immensely fraught times, from impending climate disaster, to the ruthless spectacle of Black death, from the advent of Brexit, to the rise of Donald Trump. I want to speak to people's subconscious about how these times act  honestly upon the Black, Queer experience without dogmatism. 

Risks & Challenges

The funding for my work at this particular time is extremely difficult as there is little to no funding for the kind of work that I am making, and due to my recent relocation to London, where I do not have legal rights or recourse to public funding for the arts. While I am being supported in a myriad of ways that work well with my situation, funding is needed to show, sustain, market, and land my work. I work incessantly, and I spend hundreds of hours making material, researching, and experimenting so that I can share something with an audience. Your generous support will go far in helping me reach my goals and land my work in all of the interested places, venues, countries, and cultures. 

Thank you so much for your continued support and consideration! Without your help, making choreographic work of this calibur wouldn't be possible.

I am currently finishing the development of my newest work "SAD KING," which is a meditation around Black, Queer joyousness and choreographic form. A collaboration between myself as marikiscrycrycry (solo performance alias), The Hague-based musician, yEs!yEs, and under the mentorship New York City choreographer Tere O'Connor, "SAD KING" has been developed over the last year as a way to give another material voice to a fraught, yet visionary experience.
 
After the success of my last work "A S S I M I L A T I O N," including its international tour, which is still ongoing, there has been immense interest in showing "SAD KING" and it has secured premieres at the Brooklyn Arts Exchange, and FiveMyles Gallery in November, at the Hackney Showroom, London, UK in January 2017,  at the Black Box Teater in Oslo, Norway in February 2017, and at AKC Medika in March/April 2017. 
Your generous donation would ensure that I can feasibly tour this work by contributing to travel costs, honorarium for my collaborators, and general miscellaneous expenses that include makeup, glitter, and other materials. Most importantly, your support will help me bring my work to a variety of audiences across the globe, to revel in my research around Black, Queer identity!
What We Need & What You Get

I am asking for $1700USD (Although you don't have to donate in USD if you are located in Europe, Canada, or elsewhere!) to help fray the cost of flights (London-->NYC, NYC-->London, London-->Oslo, Oslo-->Zagreb, Zagreb-->London), and accommodation as I plan the touring of this work,  to pay my collaborators what they deserve for contributing massively to the creation of "SAD KIND", and for miscellaneous materials that I will need for the continuance of this work. This is only a fraction of the total cost of touring this work, and your contribution would have immense impacts! Anything will help.
And there are perks! There are a series of gifts (photos, interviews, writings, posters, tickets, videos, amongst other things that I can offer as a thank you for your generosity)
The Impact

Without your support for my work, it wouldn't be possible to share my research with a wider audience. After I performed my last work "A S S I M I L A T I O N" in Zagreb, a little Croatian girl, maybe 2-3 years old, came to me with her Father after the performance to say that she thought I was beautiful and special, and it gave me hope that my work can reach far and wide, despite its political focus and radicality, even to young children who do not have active discourse on Black or Queer issues/experiences!
 
As I continue to make work, my urge to share grows even larger and I want to reach people, especially during this tough time where we are living through immensely fraught times, from impending climate disaster, to the ruthless spectacle of Black death, from the advent of Brexit, to the rise of Donald Trump. I want to speak to people's subconscious about how these times act  honestly upon the Black, Queer experience without dogmatism. 

Risks & Challenges
The funding for my work at this particular time is extremely difficult as there is little to no funding for the kind of work that I am making, and due to my recent relocation to London, where I do not have legal rights or recourse to public funding for the arts. While I am being supported in a myriad of ways that work well with my situation, funding is needed to show, sustain, market, and land my work. I work incessantly, and I spend hundreds of hours making material, researching, and experimenting so that I can share something with an audience. Your generous support will go far in helping me reach my goals and land my work in all of the interested places, venues, countries, and cultures. 
Thank you so much for your continued support and consideration! Without your help, making choreographic work of this calibur wouldn't be possible.

story:
This campaign will raise the funds needed to travel to New York City for an art opening that includes my work.  I will travel by train and stay in the city for three nights.  This is my first show in New York City.

Having my art selected by an esteemed member of the New York art world is a thrill and validation for all my hard work.  All those invisible hours spent in the studio struggling and pushing through have not been in vain!  I do have a place at the table of the bigger art world!

Like most of my work "Listening For What Wasn't Said" (24" x 24", 2016) was made from family snapshots that have been scanned, cut apart and sewn back together with journal pages from my notebook.  This piece is from a series entitled "Heirlooms."  It is one of five works that were assembled from quilt patterns for that series.  All together they tell the story of the year I turned twelve, a year that signaled the end of my childhood and a shifting of youthful allegiances.  My mother was losing her position as the center of my universe and she didn't let go willingly.  Visit my website to see the entire series as well as my other works michellesaffran.com.

Your support will allow me to participate in this incredible professional networking opportunity and to see my work in the company of other artists' work. 

Your support helps beyond measure and will make this trip possible.  Thank you in advance for your contribution and belief in me.

Budget

I have a budget of $870, which breaks down in the following way:

Train from Vermont to New York and back:  $120.

Hotel for 3 nights:  $420.

Meals:  $280.

Taxi from train station to hotel and return:  $50.

Any additional funds raised will be used to offset the cost of museum entrance fees, subway travel, gratuities for services provided and to cover fees associated with the campaign.

story:
Dancers and musicians don't often get the chance to collaborate together, let alone perform. TREES offers these artists the opportunity to practice their craft and find their own artistic voice in a professional space. Your valuable donation will fund the following:

  • Artist Compensation: Every artist SHOULD and WILL be paid for every performance.
  • Technical Team: Our company proudly employs passionate freelance sound designers, videographers & photographers. 
  • Marketing & Advertising:  Promoting our performance through both traditional and digital means.
  • The Future of TREES: Your donation ensures that TREES will continue to unite artists across a variety of mediums. 

You help us create the movement, the music, the moments that raise the vibrations-that raise the rhythm all around us. Thank you!

story:
Les finissants du programme de Photographie du Cégep du Vieux Montréal organisent une exposition afin de souligner les connaissances acquises et le travail accompli au cours de leurs trois années d’études. L’exposition se tiendra le 6 juin prochain, à l’Espace Infopresse.

Nous avons étés approchés par Infopresse, véritable plaque tournante dans la diffusion des arts visuels au Québec, afin d’offrir une grande visibilité aux finissants désireux de lancer leur carrière en photographie. Chaque année, cette exposition est un événement couru et unique qui attire nombreux acteurs de l’industrie. La diversité des œuvres et des styles présentés attirera différents publics.

Afin de les aider à financer une partie de leur exposition, les finissants espèrent votre contribution pour mener à bien ce projet afin qu’il soit couronné de succès et permette de lancer la carrière de plusieurs jeunes artistes prometteurs. C’est pourquoi nous sollicitons. Votre apport ferait une grande différence dans la poursuite de nos objectifs et aiderait à promouvoir et encourager la relève en photographie au Québec. 

 

Ceci est une aide supplémentaire à nos activités de financements actuelles afin d'atteindre notre but dans les délais prescrits. 

 

L'argent récolté servira à amortir les frais suivants : 

 

- Location de la salle

- Les impressions d'affiches & la publicité 

- Envoyer les invitations 

- Impressions de présentation 

- Offrir un cocktail lors de la soirée

- Céder un fond pour la cohorte suivante 

- Un DJ 

- Photomaton

 

 

The graduating students at Cégep du Vieux Montréal are organizing an exhibit to present their finest work produced during their three years studying Photography. The vernissage will be held on June 6th, at Espace Infopresse.

To finance this project, we need YOUR contribution to help us make this event successful, notably lauching our professional careers as young artists. Every donation contributes in the promotion and the support of this year's new photographers on the market.

Donations will notably finance the room, promotional posters, invitations, final prints for the exhibit, the cocktail, and entertainment during the vernissage.

story:
Why Do I Want to Stab You in the Face?

Hi! I'm Fizz. If you know me on the internet, you probably know me as Relsqui. Maybe you're here because you appreciate my community moderation, my public writing, or my friendship, and you'd like to support my personal project. Maybe you're here because you think I'm a terrible person and you want to stab me in the face. Either way, this campaign has you covered.

Why Do You Want to Get Stabbed in the Face?

So far I've been stabbed in the face (including ears) seven times:

  • three times in my earlobes (two left, one right)
  • once in the eyebrow
  • twice in the cartilege of my right ear
  • once through my nostril

In each case, the stabbing was done with a sterile needle and appropriate safety precautions by either a licensed professional or a student with professional oversight, and surgical-steel jewelry was inserted.

I get pierced for a few reasons. Altering my body makes it more my body, giving me creative control over the physical structure that houses my mind and represents me to the world. It sends a very general signal to other people about who I am and what I value, inviting similar people to talk to me and sparing me the attention of those who don't approve of my choices. They feel nice (and sound nice, in the case of the two rings clicking together in one earlobe). And, of course, I love the way they look. Especially a lot of them all together.

So What's Stopping You? Why the Campaign?

In a nutshell, I'm poor. I can house and (usually) feed myself, but I can't really do anything else. Even if I were able to put that much money away, I can't justify spending it on aesthetic body modifications rather than something practical (food, transit, medical needs, or saving for future calamities).

But that doesn't mean it's not important. Especially now, when lack of money and lack of time leave me feeling like I have little control over my life, getting to do something just because it feels good is a rare luxury. The funding campaign creates a pool of money which I can only use for this purpose--no excuses, no guilt, no justification. It will remind me of the control I do have, make me stand a little straighter, and put a smile on my face whenever I look in the mirror.

How Does the Funding Goal Break Down?

This is a flexible funding campaign, which means that all donations will go into the fund whether or not the funding goal is met. That's because the minimum funding that would allow me to meet my goals is around $100, my intended target (after doing some arithmetic) is $300, and the smallest goal IndieGoGo supports is $500. I would be delighted to reach any of those numbers. Here's what happens if we do*:

  • With $100, I can get one facial or ear piercing, tip my piercer, send perks to the donors, and pay IndieGoGo's and Paypal's fees.
  • With $175, I can get two facial/ear piercings, tip my piercer, etc.
  • With $240, I can get three facial/ear piercings, etc. and
  • With $300 I can get four.

*(These numbers have changed slightly since the campaign was originally posted; I'm adjusting for Paypal fees and leaving myself some wiggle room for aftercare supplies and other unforeseen but related expenses.)

After $300 is where it really starts to get interesting.

  • If we meet the funding goal of $500, along with the above, I can branch out from face-stabbing and get stabbed in the chest. On both sides.
  • At $750, I can go even further and get stabbed in the junk. Yep, below the belt. Don't worry about me chickening out of this one; I've done it before and have been planning the next one ever since.
  • If you generous folks double the funding goal and reach $1000, something really amazing happens: not only am I going to get stabbed a whole lot of times, I'll have at least part of the work done at Fakir's teaching workshop in San Francisco by well-trained student piercers. I will also have high-quality photographs of the finished work taken.

... and wouldn't that be phenomenal? I get stabbed like a pincushion, some students get to practice on an experienced volunteer, and you all get some really nice pictures of the result.

Which Parts of Your Face Will Get Stabbed? Who Will Actually Do the Stabbing?

There are a number of specific piercings I want to get, in addition to the ones I have now:

  • an industrial piercing
  • a third helix piercing
  • at least one eyebrow piercing, replacing one I already had and removed because it wasn't healing properly
  • at least one lip piercing
  • a nipple piercing on each side
  • at least two more genital piercings

The exact layout is not set in stone. Every time I get a new piercing, my appearance changes slightly, and I adjust my ideas to fit. (If you want to contribute your ideas, check out the Erudite Stabber donor tier.) Suffice it to say that ever since I got the first one I've had at least one or two in mind that I was ready to get next.

There are a number of high-quality piercing shops where I live, two of which I've visited and one of which I've had work done at before. I'll definitely revisit that last, but may take the opportunity to try another as well--and if we meet our stretchiest stretch goal, at least some of the stabbing will happen at Fakir's teaching workshop in San Francisco. In any case, I'll absolutely be posting links and recommendations after the campaign ends, but while I'm still raising funds I don't want this page to be associated with a specific business which hasn't chosen to participate in it.

What's In It For Me?

Everyone who donates to this campaign will receive one very special perk, which has perhaps never been offered by a crowdfunding campaign before: the ability to truthfully say for the rest of your life,

"I donated money on the internet to have someone stabbed in the face!"

If that alone isn't enough to entice you ... you and I are dissimilar. But, well, if that alone isn't enough to entice you, here are a selection of other perks:

  • First of all, everyone who donates at least $5 will get pictures of all the finished piercings. This is kind of a no-brainer! They're body art, and meant to be shown off. Note that, stretch goals notwithstanding, by default I will only be sharing pictures of above-the-neck piercings.
  • Everyone who donates at least $20 will get a handwritten thank-you note from me. When was the last time you got a handwritten letter in the mail, much less a fancy thank-you card? Wouldn't that be a nice change of pace from bills and junk mail?
  • When I go to get stabbed, if the piercer permits, I will take photos or video of the work in progress, and send them to everyone who donates at least $40.
  • Donors at the $70 tier and above get to participate in the decisions of what piercings to get before I get them, and also watch the work get done on a live hangout.
  • For everyone who donates at least $100, I will write a custom, original Shakespearean sonnet about you and how great you are. If you're on the fence about this one, keep an eye on the campaign--I'll post an example partway through to help you make up your mind.
  • At $150 things start to get silly. To best ensure my new piercings are visible to be admired, for every donor at this level I will keep my head shaved for at least one month.

Last, but not least:

  • For the deeply passionate stabbing aficionado who donates at the $250 level, I will go further in two ways than for any donor at a previous tier: I will keep my head shaved for at least one year, ensuring that everyone I meet can appreciate the results of your generosity. I will also make a video in which I do a dramatic reading of your personal sonnet and post it on the internet. You will be the most famous stab-funder in history.

Thank you for reading, and happy stabbing!
