story:
Hi! I’m Manuela Reyes, a graduate student from the Masters of Arts in Curatorial Practice at the School of Visual Arts...thank you for coming :) This is a crowdfunding campaign for my thesis exhibition and curatorial long term project. If you haven’t watched the video, please do! 

The Ocean We Inhabit will be the inaugural exhibition of PlanetArt Fund, a non-profit organization that I am currently creating to advocate environmental awareness and change. The exhibition will consist of a multisensory experience at the National Aquarium in Baltimore featuring a video art projection by the pioneer of performance and video art, Joan Jonas, the U.S Representative of the 56th Venice Biennale, 2015.  Socially engaged Mexican artist Pablo Helguera will create a narrative performance and Portuguese composer Bernardo Rosa will create a sound piece.  Colombian-Italian dance therapist and architect Martha Raquel Herrera will lead a dance workshop for the children of Baltimore.

PlanetArt Fund is currently in talks with other surprise artists who will also be participating in the exhibition...I know, it all seems  impossible. Almost everybody thought the same just a few months ago when I first introduced my idea, and here we are. The exhibition will be documented and with your generous support will tour internationally to other aquariums and museum venues sharing Baltimore’s inaugural experience.  

PlanetArt Fund is a sponsored project of Fractured Atlas, a non-profit arts service organization. Contributions for the charitable purposes of PlanetArt Fund must be made payable to Fractured Atlas only and are tax-deductible to the extent permitted by law.

WHY YOU SHOULD HELP

Our world is going through a transformational process. Being aware of the harm we have created to the planet, we understand that there has come a time to act. We must start changing the way we interact and relate to the planet’s environment.  In developing situations were people can sense new ways to understand nature, we can enhance this dialogue through carefully thought interdisciplinary projects, creating situations where humans, art, and nature coexist.

PlanetArt Fund will be a non-profit organization that creates multidisciplinary, collective exhibitions that create  environmental awareness. Creating transformations through experiential exhibitions, PlanetArt Fund embraces projects that create a reflection on contemporary consciousness through art. The foundation will express an aim to support artistic productions that deal with nature, combining the visual arts, design, performative arts, film, and sound arts.  PlanetArt Fund will create awareness to the international community uniting art, society and nature.

Through PlanetArt Fund's projects, people will become aware and mindful of the impact they have with the environment, contributing to create positive transformations in our society. 

Join us on April 28th, 2016 at The National Aquarium in Baltimore!

We have the venue, we have amazing artists, we have a solid marketing and social media team, now we need the money to close the deal. Help us reach this final and  crucial goal!

WHAT WE NEED

Our  goal is to raise $77,000  which will cover the basic expenses to make The Ocean We Inhabit a reality… ambitious, right? But hey, this is a major, relevant experience that will help transform society and raise awareness of the ocean. I know it sounds super impossible, but believe me, it’s not! Watch the video if you haven’t, check out my website so you can have a taste of my background and join us on the 28th of April, 2016 at the National Aquarium in Baltimore :)

Materials and expenses for installation, workshop, video/sound/narrative performances: $12,000

Venue rental and staff fee: $8,000

PlanetArt Fund's staff fee: $3,000

Artists fee's, travel and accommodation expenses: $17,500

PlanetArt Fund online branding and presence: $2,000

PlanetArt Fund's registration, fees, and accountability: $8,500

Crowdfunding consultants’ fee, contingency of the project, insurance and extras: $25,000

Perks’ handling and shipping: $1,000


WHAT COMES NEXT AFTER REACHING OUR GOAL

Our next goal is to raise $25,000 more to be able to shoot the documentary of the exhibition and to make PlanetArt Fund a sustainable project for the future. 

In my view, film is a form of art that involves people with knowledge, skills and resources in order to make it proper. Our idea is to make the documentary of The Ocean We Inhabit as vivid, beautiful, and intimate as possible in order to reproduce the experiential exhibition. This documentary is a very important part of this project. It will be our ID for all the upcoming projects and alliances asThe Ocean We Inhabit will travel to other museums, aquariums, and other venues. Hence, it will be the cornerstone of our future sustainability. 

PlanetArt Fund will be a New York-based non-profit organization that will continue producing art events and will also provide environmental grants­ for students on a long term. PlanetArt Fund will enhance the possibility of creating situations and encounters with role models of the environment, educating children about the correct decisions for taking care of our planet.  It will continue creating symposiums, conferences, and workshops to reflect upon environmental concerns, art, and their connectivity. PlanetArt Fund will collaborate and ally with other foundations and institutions, gaining a higher impact within our projects’ outreach. The foundation will continue creating multisensory, collective and out of the ordinary projects around the world. 

Why this experience will be so incredibly exciting? Because it will be in the hands of talented, honest, wholehearted artists in a mind-blowing venue. Here is some information about them…

Pablo Helguera (b. Mexico City, 1971) is a socially engaged multidisciplinary artist, curator, and Director of Adult and Academic Programs at the Museum of Modern Art. He will create a literary workshop with the local people of Baltimore where he as well as other writers will alter Edgar Allan Poe’s poem "The City in the Sea." The result of the workshop--a constrained writing piece-- will later be performed in the exhibition at The National Aquarium.  

Joan Jonas (b. New York, 1936) is a pioneer of performance and video art. Jonas was commissioned for the U.S Pavilion of the 56th Venice Biennale 2015. The exhibition will consist of projecting one of Jonas video art pieces fromThey Come to Us Without a Word inside the architectural walls of Blue Wonders space in the National Aquarium.

Martha Raquel Herrera (b. Bogotá, 1963) is a dance therapist and architect. Her daily work in Italy involves the stimulation of people's creativity in order for them to create their own extemporaneous choreographies. Herrera will lead a workshop where the children of Baltimore will create their own extemporaneous dance using materials that symbolize the elements of the ocean. The objective is to make them aware that we are an essential part of the ocean life​.

Bernardo Rosa (b. Lisbon, 1989) is a pianist/composer studying at Manhattan School of Music in New York City. He has lived and studied in several places such as  Russia, Belgium and Portugal were he has written a varied array of works influenced by jazz, classical and ambient music. Rosa will create a sound piece for The Ocean We Inhabit  uniting nature and humans, inviting the audience to a meditative inner experience to connect with the ocean's environment. 


CHECK OUT OUR GALLERY TO SEE THE EXHIBITION'S RENDER AND OTHER SNEAK PICKS!

THE DEAL WITH THE AQUARIUM

PlanetArt Fund will create an alliance with the National Aquarium of Baltimore, adhering to the aquarium’s mission of inspiring the conservation of the world’s aquatic treasures. The aquarium attracts 1.4 million visitors each year and gathers 20,000 fish, varieties of birds, amphibians, reptiles and marine mammals.”[1]


[1] http://www.aqua.org

[attach pictures and videos of aquarium]

WHAT PERKS YOU GET FOR YOUR GENEROUS CONTRIBUTION

$27 Get 1 entrance to the experience in Baltimore

$54 Get 1 and donate 1 

$300 Framed digital print of one of Manuela Reyes' paintings

$2,700 Original painting by Manuela Reyes in mixed media, acrylic, glitter, sequins, and beads on canvas. 39.4 x 39.4 inches (100 x 100 cm)

$5,000 documentary producer credit

$7,000 Presenting Sponsor Credit
A credit of Presenting Sponsor in the exhibition and in the documentary


Deep Love, 2013. Mixed media: acrylic, glitter, sequins, and beads on canvas.
39.4 x 39.4 inches (100 x 100 cm)


Elevation, 2010, Mixed media: acrylic, glitter, sequins, and beads on canvas.
39.4 x 39.4 inches (100 x 100 cm)
*Bigger and smaller sizes are available. Details will be arranged with the donor.


Pleyades, 2005, Framed digital print, 15.7 x 15.7 inches (40 x 40 cm)

Honey Love, 2015, Framed digital print, 15.7 x 15.7 inches (40 x 40 cm)
There are more of this works available in different models. Details will be arranged with the donor.

Let’s connect through Facebook, Twitter and Instagram and join me in this journey of making the impossible happen.

If you know someone who you think would relate and/or enjoy  #BeatTheImpossible please share!

Thank you for reading.

[attach pictures and videos of aquarium]WHAT PERKS YOU GET FOR YOUR GENEROUS CONTRIBUTION$27 Get 1 entrance to the experience in Baltimore$54 Get 1 and donate 1 $300 Framed digital print of one of Manuela Reyes' paintings$2,700 Original painting by Manuela Reyes in mixed media, acrylic, glitter, sequins, and beads on canvas. 39.4 x 39.4 inches (100 x 100 cm)$5,000 documentary producer credit$7,000 Presenting Sponsor CreditA credit of Presenting Sponsor in the exhibition and in the documentaryDeep Love, 2013. Mixed media: acrylic, glitter, sequins, and beads on canvas.39.4 x 39.4 inches (100 x 100 cm)Elevation, 2010, Mixed media: acrylic, glitter, sequins, and beads on canvas.39.4 x 39.4 inches (100 x 100 cm)*Bigger and smaller sizes are available. Details will be arranged with the donor.






Pleyades, 2005, Framed digital print, 15.7 x 15.7 inches (40 x 40 cm)





Honey Love, 2015, Framed digital print, 15.7 x 15.7 inches (40 x 40 cm)
There are more of this works available in different models. Details will be arranged with the donor.

Let’s connect through Facebook, Twitter and Instagram and join me in this journey of making the impossible happen.

If you know someone who you think would relate and/or enjoy  #BeatTheImpossible please share!Thank you for reading.

story:
I'm excited to report that I have been awarded a month long artist residency at the Studios at MASS MoCA. Out of 323 applications, I was chosen to be one of the approximately 50 artists to attend this season. The residency includes a private studio, lodging, one meal a day, free admission to the museum, free access to the resources at the Makers' Mill in North Adams and one-on-one business and financial coaching with Assets for Artists.

Although they have offered me a reduction in the overall fee, I still need to pay $1,600 to attend. It just isn't possible for me to pay this amount of money and to lose income for the entire month. But the opportunity to spend a month focused on my artwork at MASS MoCA and take advantage of the various benefits of this program is too important to pass up. Additionally, a month in North Adams would give me a chance to reconnect to an area of personal significance: I spent the last two years of high school in neighboring Williamstown. Receiving a scholarship to attend Buxton School was a pivotal moment for me as a struggling teenager. I would love to spend the month steeping in this place of risk and transformation.

My goal is to raise $2,400 in the next month. This will cover the cost of the residency plus $800 for materials and the cost of living. Any money raised over $2,400 will help cover lost income for the month.

If you choose to help me reach this goal I would love to thank you by offering the following perks:

$5 - A thank you postcard from scenic North Adams, Massachusetts. Twenty available.

$10 - "Conception Notes" A 14 page book of images and text. Black and white images are of recent work, text consists of artwork titles, notes and conceptual writings compiled while creating each piece. Seven available.

$25 - Twenty five sheets of handmade paper that could be used for drawing, collage, wrapping etc. Some made by me, some made by others. A variety of colors. Each sheet approx. 7" x 5". Ten available.

$30 - A trio of paper husk pendulums. Art objects and/or talismans. You choose. From my "Calibrating, Pivoting" piece. Sizes vary from 3" - 5" tall. Ten available.

$50 - A handmade paper box with flap holding sheets of white paper for drawing, notes etc. Black box with a variety of designs on the front. Approx. 5" x 5". Twelve available.

$75 - Photopolymer print. Each unique, each a detail of a fiber sculpture. Approx. 10" x 10" each. Ten available.

$100- A black and white paper collage suitable for framing. Made of thin strips of black paper on a white paper backdrop. Approx. 6" x 6". Three available.

$200 - A one of a kind paper sculpture from the "Fundamental Restlessness" series. Sizes range from 6"x 6" x 6" to 12" x 8" x 8". Five available.

$300 - "Enclosure", a handmade paper box that opens and closes with a white paper pendulum husk affixed inside. Approx. 8" wide when opened. One available.


Since graduating from the School of the Art Institute of Chicago in May, I have been vigilantly expanding my studio practice and pursuing a variety of teaching jobs, grants, artist residencies and exhibition opportunities. So far in 2016 I have hung two solo exhibits, I have four more scheduled in the next 10 months and two group shows. I have also been awarded two local cultural council grants to help pay for materials. Check out my website to see my latest work. A major reason why I was able to accomplish these things was because of a month long residency like the one I have been offered at MASS MoCA. Having the time and space to be able to explore new materials and processes, focus on applying for grants and strategizing for upcoming shows proved to be a critical ingredient of my successes. I plan to use my month long residency at MASS MoCA in a similar way - exploring new work and laying the groundwork for future opportunities. 

Thanks so much for considering supporting my fundraising campaign, passing it on to friends and being the generally supportive bunch that you are. 

THANKS!

story:
Our Project

FLOCONS is a dynamic and evolving series of large-scale ornament-like sculptures, imagined and built by a collective of artists. Each piece starts with an 8-foot tall circular metal hanger equipped with a swivel-hinge hook where an ornament, no larger than 4x4x6 feet in size, is suspended. As participants approach the series, they will find a collection of large free-floating sculptures, each as unique as the artists who created them:

AeolianFyre by Joshua Rooker & Chloe Veneneux

Alpha, Beta & Wings by Anna-Gaelle Lucy Marshall

Dreaming of Trees by Francis Kanach

Momotombo by Rachel Babenar

Fly Fast by Casey Bage

Planet Janet by Elizabeth & Mel Adams

Smoke Cloud by Kevan Christiaens

Snow Crystal by Sara Sebby

Fabrication by Seth Byrnes

with support from Hedron Makerspace.

FLOCONS is a shared creative experience in participatory art that displays the beauty of human collaboration and communal effort. Each Flocon is a window into the artist’s creativity, but each sculpture is only a small part of the whole. Not only will each piece be a reflection of an artist, the collaboration of artists in creating a larger work makes the whole larger than its parts. )'(


Why We Need Your Help

FLOCONS received art grants for display at Critical Northwest in June and the Oregon Country Fair in July. 6 Flocons have already been completed and we expect to have 10 (or more...) on display in Black Rock City. While we always intended to run an online fundraiser for help with transportation costs to Burning Man, we did not foresee our rental truck for Critical/OCF being the victim of a hit and run, leaving us with a $1,000 out-of-pocket deductible. Your assistance in covering this unexpected cost is most welcome!

 

What We Need 

  • $1,000 - Deductible incurred after our rental truck for Critical/OCF was the victim of a hit and run.
  • $1,800 -  Transportation to Burning Man: Portland to BRC and back again.
  • Stretch Goal - $1600: To add 2 more FLOCONS to our garden!

What we have to gift you for your generosity

  • Shout out on Social Media
  • Polaroid from the Playa
  • Commemorative laser cut project Pendant

  • Miniature Flocons: choose between AeolianFyre, Alpha, Beta and Wings




  • One of our Hangers (must pick up in Portland)
  • One of our completed FLOCONS: AeolianFyre or Snow Crystal (must pick up in Portland)

Thank you for supporting FLOCONS!

We would also like to thank Burning Man Arts, Ignition Northwest and the Oregon Country Fair for the generous Art Grants that have brought this project to life. 
A project by Dusty Visions -  supporting Burner inspired and community driven participatory arts, education and events.

story:
Dear friends! The Shandy Bisqwuits (formerly Sandy Biscuits) barrio is returning to Nowhere, this year with an art project we want you to enter, explore and enjoy. We will build House of Senses - and we need your help to make it happen:

House of Senses is an audiovisual experience. Set at the borders of Nowhere, House of Senses is a spiral structure of haystacks, forming a sound- and windproof room where tech responds to whomever enters it. Constantly scanning for body heat, body movement, and ambient light, House of Senses will adapt to the conditions inside this room in the desert, in light and sound, in sound and vision.

Behind the project are members of the Shandy Bisqwuits barrio, amongst others artist and engineer Michael Ang, who will create the main attraction at House of Senses: A star shaped light installation hovering above the hay structure. House of Senses will be built in the Spanish desert pre-festival, making it ready for your indulgence day and night during Nowhere. 

Nowhere has generously contributed to the project via art grants, but we are now looking to our friends and community to fundraise the final 700€ needed. The project is completely non profit, and if we should be lucky enough to raise more than 700€, the remaining funds will go to our new storage container, securing the barrio's future in the years ahead.

We have a few perks for our contributors - you can find them on the list to the right. Thanks for your love! We look forward to sharing magical experiences in House of Senses with you.

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
Hello!

Our names are Haley Lauw and Erik Pedersen.
We’re both printmakers, sculptors, and writers based in Tallahassee, FL.
We also teach printmaking classes in Florida State University’s rather damp Kellogg Research Building basement!

You can find us and our work at:
Haley — www.haley-olivia.com, @haleyohlivia on instagram
Erik — www.basementlivin.com, @basementlivin on instagram

We were recently invited to participate in a two-month residency and exhibition at The Pajama Factory in Williamsport, Pennsylvania!

During our stay, we will:

  • share a communal studio space and living quarters with four other artists!
  • run printmaking workshops for the community!
  • present guest lectures at local universities!
  • take some much-needed time to strengthen our individual studio practices!
  • participate in a group exhibition with the other PJ Factory summer residents!
 

Why the PJ Factory?

We’re big on history.

Originally built between 1883 and 1919, The Pajama Factory has a storied past involving a lot of rubber goods, Keds shoes, pajamas, short shorts, line dancing, wilderness outfitters, and at least one nightclub.

In 1951, it briefly became the largest pajama factory in the world.

It’s been owned by the Lycoming Rubber Company, the Weldon Pajama Company, and a guy named Ray, who renamed the facility RAYTOWN in the 1980s. Really.
 

Something about the present.

Today, The Pajama Factory is home to a diverse creative community—established and emerging artists, small businesses and entrepreneurs, craftspeople, and community organizations—working in close proximity to each other and engaging the greater Williamsport community.

Between the rich industrial and social histories of Williamsport and the surrounding area, we’ll have the perfect fodder for constructing new prints, sculptures, and narratives.

During our residency, we’ll have the opportunity to meet artists from around the region, participate in studio visits, and present guest lectures at local universities.

These opportunities are invaluable to us as emerging artists and arts educators!
 

There and back again!
 

Your donations will help us in more ways than one!
Donations will be put toward:

  • travel expenses - Our round-trip journey will be a little over 2,000 miles! With the art hubs of Philadelphia, Pittsburgh, and New York City just 3.5 hours away, we may work in some professional field trips during the residency. That’s a lot of gas, tolls, and inevitable wear-and-tear on Erik’s car.
  • living expenses - While the residency is one of few that does not have fees and provides housing, we still need sustenance! Donations will offset the cost of groceries and day-to-day expenses!
  • material expenses - We both make prints and objects, so this portion of the budget will go toward stacks of paper, tubs of ink, assorted building materials, tools, and hardware.


The world is strange and money is tight!

We understand that many of you are already throwing money behind worthy causes in these turbulent times! We do the same when we can! Times are tough!

In lieu of heartfelt letters of appreciation and very warm hugs, we’re offering some sweet perks to those that are able to help us on our way out of the damp basement and into the PJ Factory! Rest assured that each perk is made with love.
 

Can’t afford to throw money at us?
That’s okay! Really! We totally get it!

It’s true!
Few of us are free of reminders from our student loans, our creditors, and the like. We can absolutely understand being strapped for cash — it would mean the world to us if you could share our campaign on social media!

Tell your friends!

Tell your folks!

Many thanks for your time and generosity!

Haley Lauw & Erik Pedersen

story:
Hello! We are Pete and Jamy Carreno,  for those that don’t know us, we have been together for 12 years and have been creating different mediums of art since the day we met. We are very excited to have a new opportunity relatively fall into our laps recently.  The chances of this opportunity becoming a reality are becoming increasingly positive but we do need your help! The idea is for a 2500 square-foot creative space which will be used to host private tattooing as well as live music, educational seminars from the worlds top tattoo artists, and introducing interesting and influential people in different mediums such as burlesque performers. We are part of a small group in our community that is pushing to expand our newly discovered Arts District here in downtown Prescott.   We were relatively unprepared for this venture, and so this is where we ask you to help us bring this to life.  While we appreciate your donations, we are also offering perks that will accommodate different levels of contributions. Amongst these perks are Merch such as pins and  stickers, exclusive prints and original artworks that are only available for this project, deep discounts on future appointments for your tattoo services with us, tickets to some of our upcoming educational seminars with artists such as Joshua Carlton and Zac “Lefty” Colbert, as well as  savings on our BnB experiences we offer! There’s really something for everyone. 

 Jamy has a long history with Prescott and would like to bring a youthful and vibrant, creative area for future generations to come. This is a vision that much of our community shares and we are looking to build upon this and create a solid foundation. Anything you can do to help will be greatly appreciated and we would love to hear any suggestions or ideas you may have as well.   We will be sharing pictures and ideas for this project as time goes on, so you can be part of the process with us!

  Our location is absolutely beautiful, it’s  the second oldest building in Prescott located just a block from our town square. It has a ton of character and a lot of history which we can’t wait to share with you. Most of our funds we already had went towards getting into the space, and our initial buildout as well as our liquor license. We still need things such as furniture, building a stage area for our guests and for tattooing, as well as all the necessary supplies needed to be able to stock a bar and tattoo shop.  We are also excited to record podcasts with each of our guests that we have come through so we will need to get some recording and sound equipment for this part as well.  Some of these things can be prioritized if we are unable to reach our goal but we are looking to do it correctly so all support is immensely appreciated.

 

The Impact

We feel Prescott needs this change and we’re happy to be part of this movement. If you’ve ever visited, you know how much it’s history means to us locals. By contributing to this fundraiser, you’ll be part of allowing a younger generation to create their own history here. Our surroundings are beautiful but much of our younger crowd tends to visit other nearby areas in their free time.  We want to show Prescott can be a destination city where you can explore ( and maybe be a guest at our tattoo BnB) and enjoy all it has to offer.  Beautiful trails, rock climbing, kayaking, lakes, casinos, stargazing in the clear night sky, just to name a few! We want to help offer something different and unique, something we’ve always strived to do. By bringing educational seminars for tattooing techniques, world famous pinstripers, internationally recognized oil painters, burlesque performers, passionate chefs, we are bringing in different crowds to see just how amazing our town is.  All while providing growth and new opportunities for those wanting to learn!

 Need a space for a wedding or graduation party? Are you a musician that is excited to perform in an intimate and elevated space? Have a fundraiser to host? Maybe you just want to go dance to some rad music from our vast vinyl record collection? All of these ideas are a reality at The Attic, help us to make it come to life!

 

Risks & Challenges

 

This is a huge opportunity for us, so it’s not immune to it’s serious risks and challenges. To be able to juggle what we’re wanting to bring will be difficult to say the least!  Private, appointment only tattooing during the day, then opening up to a music venue/bar in the evenings. We know you can drink anywhere, but we want to share our life experiences with you. Pete and Jamy have traveled the world, tattooing,  creating art, making friends and memories, seeing live music, so our dream is to incorporate these experiences into The Attic. A space where like minded people can join together and aspire to their dreams and ideas. With the support of our friends and community, we can all work together to make something amazing happen. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

 

We understand that times are tough and you can’t help everyone that needs it, so we thank you for reading about our project because your time is valuable!  If you are able to share or use some of the helpful Indiegogo tools, we would sincerely appreciate it. Thanks again and we hope to make art and memories with you at The Attic!
story_txt:
Hello! We are Pete and Jamy Carreno,  for those that don’t know us, we have been together for 12 years and have been creating different mediums of art since the day we met. We are very excited to have a new opportunity relatively fall into our laps recently.  The chances of this opportunity becoming a reality are becoming increasingly positive but we do need your help! The idea is for a 2500 square-foot creative space which will be used to host private tattooing as well as live music, educational seminars from the worlds top tattoo artists, and introducing interesting and influential people in different mediums such as burlesque performers. We are part of a small group in our community that is pushing to expand our newly discovered Arts District here in downtown Prescott.   We were relatively unprepared for this venture, and so this is where we ask you to help us bring this to life.  While we appreciate your donations, we are also offering perks that will accommodate different levels of contributions. Amongst these perks are Merch such as pins and  stickers, exclusive prints and original artworks that are only available for this project, deep discounts on future appointments for your tattoo services with us, tickets to some of our upcoming educational seminars with artists such as Joshua Carlton and Zac “Lefty” Colbert, as well as  savings on our BnB experiences we offer! There’s really something for everyone. 
 Jamy has a long history with Prescott and would like to bring a youthful and vibrant, creative area for future generations to come. This is a vision that much of our community shares and we are looking to build upon this and create a solid foundation. Anything you can do to help will be greatly appreciated and we would love to hear any suggestions or ideas you may have as well.   We will be sharing pictures and ideas for this project as time goes on, so you can be part of the process with us!
  Our location is absolutely beautiful, it’s  the second oldest building in Prescott located just a block from our town square. It has a ton of character and a lot of history which we can’t wait to share with you. Most of our funds we already had went towards getting into the space, and our initial buildout as well as our liquor license. We still need things such as furniture, building a stage area for our guests and for tattooing, as well as all the necessary supplies needed to be able to stock a bar and tattoo shop.  We are also excited to record podcasts with each of our guests that we have come through so we will need to get some recording and sound equipment for this part as well.  Some of these things can be prioritized if we are unable to reach our goal but we are looking to do it correctly so all support is immensely appreciated.
 
The Impact
We feel Prescott needs this change and we’re happy to be part of this movement. If you’ve ever visited, you know how much it’s history means to us locals. By contributing to this fundraiser, you’ll be part of allowing a younger generation to create their own history here. Our surroundings are beautiful but much of our younger crowd tends to visit other nearby areas in their free time.  We want to show Prescott can be a destination city where you can explore ( and maybe be a guest at our tattoo BnB) and enjoy all it has to offer.  Beautiful trails, rock climbing, kayaking, lakes, casinos, stargazing in the clear night sky, just to name a few! We want to help offer something different and unique, something we’ve always strived to do. By bringing educational seminars for tattooing techniques, world famous pinstripers, internationally recognized oil painters, burlesque performers, passionate chefs, we are bringing in different crowds to see just how amazing our town is.  All while providing growth and new opportunities for those wanting to learn!
 Need a space for a wedding or graduation party? Are you a musician that is excited to perform in an intimate and elevated space? Have a fundraiser to host? Maybe you just want to go dance to some rad music from our vast vinyl record collection? All of these ideas are a reality at The Attic, help us to make it come to life!
 
Risks & Challenges
 
This is a huge opportunity for us, so it’s not immune to it’s serious risks and challenges. To be able to juggle what we’re wanting to bring will be difficult to say the least!  Private, appointment only tattooing during the day, then opening up to a music venue/bar in the evenings. We know you can drink anywhere, but we want to share our life experiences with you. Pete and Jamy have traveled the world, tattooing,  creating art, making friends and memories, seeing live music, so our dream is to incorporate these experiences into The Attic. A space where like minded people can join together and aspire to their dreams and ideas. With the support of our friends and community, we can all work together to make something amazing happen. 
 
Other Ways You Can Help
 
We understand that times are tough and you can’t help everyone that needs it, so we thank you for reading about our project because your time is valuable!  If you are able to share or use some of the helpful Indiegogo tools, we would sincerely appreciate it. Thanks again and we hope to make art and memories with you at The Attic!

story:
Nocturnes: The Great American Cities Project  is a visual celebration of the urban experience after dark. My subject is light: traffic, dazzling neon, an iconic building seen from the street. I love the pulse and vibrancy of the city at night and I try to capture it in my work.

                               

                            

With your support, I will  travel to the great American cities of New York, Chicago, San Francisco and Los Angeles followed by time in my studio to create this new series of fire drawings. 

Two non-profit art venues have committed to  exhibitions of Nocturnes: The Great American Cities Project in June and October of 2015. As a life long volunteer and contributor to helping the hungry, I will donate 15% of the sales from these exhibitions to local food banks.

I have offered a number of levels through which supporters and serious collectors can participate and receive my unique imagery in return for their contribution.

Beginning in October, join me on my adventure: Nocturnes: The Great American Cities Project  by following my blog. For more information: paulchojnowski.com

story:
Hello friends and thank you for checking out my project!

Who I am: 

Current and favorite incarnation so far: circus artist, although I have been onstage most of my life in different manifestations from opera singer, to ballet dancer, to musician, to pole dancer even! I feel that my lifetime body of work informs my visions in specific and unique ways; what has been inspiring to me the last few years is creating big, grand, transcendent performance pieces (whose visions are often grander than my wallet :) because hey, more is more.....

Our group is composed of some of Seattle's finest and most venerated aerial performers whose unique artistic skill sets will allow us to combine many elements of physical performance into this piece.  

For this project, we are intending to create an illuminated forest grotto space rigged with 7 steel poles that support performances both physical and vocal with  subtle undertones towards the recent upriver mudslide.  Our site is 20' back from the Stillaguamish and about 10 miles downstream from where the Oso disaster occurred.  How the land and the community has been affected will inform our performances as well.

Our multi-genre installation this year stems from the idea of creating “Human Windchimes”; using an aerial apparatus (suspended dance pole) to not only support performance physical but also musical in nature.  The apparatus will be cut to length as per a specific mathematical formula to create tones on the traditional major musical scale.

L0/(1.25)1/2 = 26.8 cm., where 1.25 represents the number used to calculate the next note on a major third scale.  More info and chart here.

With extra steel pipe, we are creating suspended luminaries that awaken the space around us with dancing light.  To do this we are drilling many holes and outfitting them with LEDs during our residency period on the farm June 23-29th.  This is very much a hands on project for the artists; not only will we be creating the apparatus on site, we'll be writing music, learning vocal harmonies, choreography, and making costumes that fit this theme.

Disclaimer: we are rigging from a very specific sturdy tree with help from someone knowledgeable in tree anatomy and rigging.  It is not our common practice nor advised that one uses trees to support body weight.

By your contribution, you will help us bring an inspiring group of artists together to see this vision into fruition at the Lo Fi Arts Festival 2014 and beyond.  We would love to perform this in Seattle in the 2014/15 season as opportunities arise.

What we need:

$300 - steel tubing

$150 - cable for rigging attachment

$80 - drill bits

$20 - 7 pairs of leather work gloves

$150 -  sheer white or off white fabric for costuming

$150 -  LEDs for internal apparatus lighting

$150 - labor for welding/rigging attachment by certified rigger

$350 - professional videographer/editing for documentation/promotion

$130 - gas stipend for transportation of crew/materials (3-5 vehicles)

$80 - new car battery to power additional lighting

$70 - misc. supplies (extension cords, power strips, sewing supplies)

$190 - fees to cover funding website charge

-----------------

$1,800.00


If we do not make our funding goal, the funds we do raise will go towards raw materials and documentation.  Any extra funds over our goal will be donated to the Oso Mudslide Relief Fund (http://www.osomudsliderelief.org)


What you get:

Perks include: handmade thank you cards, daily residency updates plus behind the scenes creation photos and team shenanigans, a cd or video link to our performance on Sept. 6 plus special footage, a suspended pole lesson, a customized matching costume, and 2 tickets to the Lo Fi performance Sept. 6 plus special artist dinner Sept. 5, not open to the public.


The Team: 

Tanya Brno


Adrienne Jack-Sands 


Kari J. Hunter


Lara Paxton

Sara Sparrow


Jill Marissa

Oliver Parkinson



The Impact

With this project, we are hoping to combine our multiple artistic talents into a seamless and transcendent performance piece that activates and honors the unique space and community surrounding us.

Specific Experience:

I have two successful unique sculptural performance installations under my belt:

-creation of the aerial spiral (Oct. 2011)

-creation of Tangyo (Smoke Farm Lo Fi Festival in collaboration with renowned lighting artist Yuri Kinoshita - Aug 2013) for which we received a 2013 4 Culture grant.


I am convinced this will be a powerful and inspiring project that I hope to present within Seattle at a later date, but I can't do it alone.  If you are not able to help financially, we would love a donation of any goods above you might have, or help spreading the word on your social networks.

Thank you!

-Tanya and the Lo Fi 2014 team

story:
Hello!

My name is Zoli, I am an artist from Budapest. In this year something fantastic happened,  I suddenly started to paint very passionately. Art was always important to me, but in this year it became my life. I give credit to yoga for showing me my way. This year I had 3 exhibition in Budapest and I've got a possibility to show some of my pictures in Lisbon in MeetingART Gallery at LICE /Lisbon International Contemporary Exhibition/.  To take part I have to pay fee.  Any help you can give means a lot to me. This is my life, to share my art and my awakening by painting and by yoga. If you are passionate about art like I am, I'm offering great perks at good prices.

LICE:                           https://www.facebook.com/lisboninternationalcontemporaryexhibition?fref=ts



ABOUT MY ART:

“GARBAGE” & “NATURE” ARE MY PAPER.

IT IS A MEDITATION ON EACH IMAGE FROM MOMENTS OF THE ROADOF AWAKENING. BASICALLY MY WORKS ARE CHARACTERIZEDBY RECYCLING, AS IF WE LOOKED THE USUAL STUFF THROUGHANOTHER DIMENSION. THE OLD ONE GETS NEW MEANING.I MAKE HANDMADE PAPER FROM OLD & BORING BOOKS, STUPID FLYERS & NEWSPAPERS. CANVASES ARE STRECHED FROMSHEET TO BE EJECTED ON. REBUILDING THE COLLAPSED SHELVES IS UNNECESSARY ­ PAINTS FLOW ON THEM.                                                               ACTUALLY I COLOUR­WASH EVERYTHING ON MY ROAD.

IT IS THE REINCARNATION OF THE THINGS ALIGNED WITH THE CHANGE OF MY OWN. AWAKENING BY COLOURS AND BODY.

MY LAST EXHIBITION:

ROAD3 // TIEMPO Y SILENCIO

The topic of the second stage on my road was the human body as a means of my transformation and of my liberation. Body has gained more and more ground in my life in the form of yoga. Conducting a life with a strong body awareness has drawn my attention to the importance of painting. In turn, painting has strengthened the necessity of yoga. Energy has started to flow there and back on its way inside and around me.

Following Body – road2 exhibition, I threw myself deeper and deeper into my own soul and body. This process has eventually faced me with the idea of passing away. Immediately, body as a topic has transformed from one day to another. I didn’t even have to look for how to visually express passing away, as Cesária Évora's songs have turned up passionately. There was no doubt about the theme of my paintings to come. This has created a marked contrast between my new body paintings and Cesária: body as the expression of a physical presence and a physical force pervaded by soul, emotions on the one hand, and Cesária Évora as a “body-­no­-more” on the other, leaving behind to us her deep and

honestly clear emotions, and her selfless, timeless love.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xVSwojC0rKo&feature=youtu.be


ROAD2 // BODY

I collaborated with the ZERO BALETT /Contemporary Balett Company/                We made an opening performance. You can see it on this links:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=pi4-aNA7xGk

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=mL6gqBxo_OQ

And you can visit my website to discover my art.

http://herczegzoli.wix.com/minimal

THAN YOU!

Zoli

story:
A BIG THANK YOU FOR ALL THE DONORS!!



Our society’s exploitation of the environment must end. We convey this vital message through society’s most decadent advertising channel: billboards.

Dear Art Collectors, Friends and Followers

Dear Art lovers from New York and the 5 boroughs

Dear neighbors from New Rochelle-

You loved the last billboard painted on Division Street?

Some great news, and a little help…

I am very happy to show you the 400 square foot mural done last year with your help!  

Lets make all together round number 2

We recently launched the INDIEGOGO campaign to fund " BILLBOARD SCALE 1 LIVE #4"

Thank you to all of you in advance for your pledge. We are very grateful.

We have the experience to paint large surfaces for years now, We have the experience to paint beautiful skies and nice "Trompe l'Oeil" (trick the eyes) technique. BUT this one will be possible because of YOUR help. Only your funding can make this happen and happen now. :)

This time the billboard is HUGE.  We will transform the building's two ugly facades into an amazing, beautiful double mural.  Each will be approximately six yards/meters wide by more than four stories high (over 1200 square feet/ 120 square meters)! All painted by hand, in Trompe l'Oeil technique.

Here is the photo before:

Once the painting is done, it will be very close to looking like this:

The idea this time is to make it look like old, charming, "back in the day" billboards- when there were still pieces of paper glued, side by side, to make a full large image. But, here, no paper will be used! It will be only a "trick for the eyes". All being painted as if they are paper leaves- some not perfectly glued, others even flying away.

The left part of the mural will have the fake scaffolding hanging from the roof top, in Trompe l'Oeil technique (trick the eyes).


This time, the surface to paint is enormous. We expect to do it in less than five weeks. As in NOW, before the winter comes. The work, though, has been in preparation for months.  One example being last October, when  we were licensed to be crane/lift pilots.  80 feet is rather high.

Billlboard Live Scale #3 we did last year when you already helped us:


This is a part of a larger project that will soon take place in New York City:


We are already working hard on all the sketches and Mockup for the New York City part of the project:


THE BILLBOARDS HACKER PUBLIC ART PROJECT

THE BILLBOARDS HACKER PUBLIC ART PROJECT

Our society’s exploitation of the environment must end.  The limits of our fragile environment are readily apparent:  oil wells are running dry; drinkable water is evaporating; trade wars have erupted over rare earth metals; the polar ice caps are melting; hurricanes routinely ravage our cities.  This vital message of impending environmental disaster must be addressed before it is too late!

Billboards Hacker seeks to convey this vital message through society’s most decadent advertising channel: gigantic billboards.  These billboards that once programmed us to buy, use, consume, and discard our limited resources have now been reprogrammed by Billboards Hacker to display a new message: “What have I done today to end Climate Change?”

Through his paintings, videos, and photographs depicting the city and sky, Billboards Hacker uses his years of research and observation of light to exhibit peaceful visuals while displaying a message about climate change.  By seeing the city and sky—together with his message of climate change—Billboards Hacker seeks to remind everyone of our duty to preserve our fragile planet.

Not only has this message of climate change become an integral part of his artwork, but this message will also leap from the canvas to the real thing as part of a public art project in New York City.  While still in its nascent stages, Billboards Hacker plans to display the same message of climate change on actual billboards throughout the city, from Times Square to other iconic places.  The money from sales of his artwork, along with private and public sponsors, will help make this historic public exhibit possible.

By forcing everyone to realize the negative effects we have on the environment, and that we must act daily to address them before it is too late, Billboards Hacker hopes that we can move past our foolishness and leave a beautiful planet to our children.

---------------

For this wall project, we need support to fund rental of the crane/lift for 5 weeks, paint, and different materials. (Permits are going to be issued soon and we already have the agreement of the owner of the building).

The Art piece will be a permanent installation.

If  you give, you will also receive. We’ve put together some great rewards. If you contribute you can have one of them. 

We will again be filming the whole project with GoPro equipment. The footage will soon be posted on BillboardsHacker.com. You can also subscribe to our channel on YouTube or follow us on instagram #BillboardsHacker or Twitter @billboardhacker or like our Facebook page.

Take a look at the right hand column to find the one that is right for you. 

If you just want to give money to the project, that's great too, but we are happy to pass on some of Billboards Hacker work in exchange.

If you have not backed this important project yet, we hope you will consider doing so. We have only 12 days :)

If you cannot give, you can still help the project and get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. You can even use Indiegogo share tools!
We have the experience to paint large surfaces for years now, We have the experience to paint beautiful skies and nice "Trompe l'Oeil" (trick the eyes) technique. BUT this one will be possible because of YOUR help. Only your funding can make this happen and happen now :)
With just $15.000 we are able to make a double permanent billboard. When in NYC we would need over $100.000 to rent for a short time a even smaller billboard. This is a great opportunity for all of us.
A big part of the funding will go in the rental of the crane/lift. Of course a lot will go to the quantity of paint we need for such a surface. But some part of the funds will go also to special tools that will make us able to make it happen in under 5 weeks and be able to still show you the progress on here, on youtube and on the Artist Website BillboardsHacker.com.
We need your funding.  Every donation matters. All kinds of participation is very helpful. We have some very unique perks and be sure we will make you feel a part of this exciting project that embellishes our city! Your contribution will make a huge impact in many ways. New Rochelle is having more and more murals come up on the walls of the city in the Art DIstrict. These double painted billboards are not only big by its size, but also amazing because of the "trick the eyes" technique. It will be right in the middle of Huguenot Street, one of the major streets of New Rochelle- where thousands of people drive by everyday. This is a tremendous impact in our everyday life and shows concern about the Climate Change and the way we behave regarding our beautiful planet.
Last October we raised over $2000 dollars. Just a few friends and art collectors made it possible (see the past campaign). But everybody now loves the result and the mural on Division Street. We hope to get many more people involved this time. 
This T-Shirt is just one example of the many fun perks you can choose to help:



This indiegogo campaign is the biggest part of the funding for the project, but there are other ways to contribute.  You are welcome to buy an art piece from Billboardhacker.com, proceeds from which will be put towards the project. Together we can do this.
story_txt:
A BIG THANK YOU FOR ALL THE DONORS!!


Our society’s exploitation of the environment must end. We convey this vital message through society’s most decadent advertising channel: billboards.


Dear Art Collectors, Friends and Followers
Dear Art lovers from New York and the 5 boroughs
Dear neighbors from New Rochelle-
You loved the last billboard painted on Division Street?

Some great news, and a little help…
I am very happy to show you the 400 square foot mural done last year with your help!  
Lets make all together round number 2
We recently launched the INDIEGOGO campaign to fund " BILLBOARD SCALE 1 LIVE #4"
Thank you to all of you in advance for your pledge. We are very grateful.We have the experience to paint large surfaces for years now, We have the experience to paint beautiful skies and nice "Trompe l'Oeil" (trick the eyes) technique. BUT this one will be possible because of YOUR help. Only your funding can make this happen and happen now. :)

This time the billboard is HUGE.  We will transform the building's two ugly facades into an amazing, beautiful double mural.  Each will be approximately six yards/meters wide by more than four stories high (over 1200 square feet/ 120 square meters)! All painted by hand, in Trompe l'Oeil technique.
Here is the photo before:

Once the painting is done, it will be very close to looking like this: 
The idea this time is to make it look like old, charming, "back in the day" billboards- when there were still pieces of paper glued, side by side, to make a full large image. But, here, no paper will be used! It will be only a "trick for the eyes". All being painted as if they are paper leaves- some not perfectly glued, others even flying away.

The left part of the mural will have the fake scaffolding hanging from the roof top, in Trompe l'Oeil technique (trick the eyes).



This time, the surface to paint is enormous. We expect to do it in less than five weeks. As in NOW, before the winter comes. The work, though, has been in preparation for months.  One example being last October, when  we were licensed to be crane/lift pilots.  80 feet is rather high.

Billlboard Live Scale #3 we did last year when you already helped us:

This is a part of a larger project that will soon take place in New York City:

We are already working hard on all the sketches and Mockup for the New York City part of the project:


THE BILLBOARDS HACKER PUBLIC ART PROJECT
THE BILLBOARDS HACKER PUBLIC ART PROJECT
Our society’s exploitation of the environment must end.  The limits of our fragile environment are readily apparent:  oil wells are running dry; drinkable water is evaporating; trade wars have erupted over rare earth metals; the polar ice caps are melting; hurricanes routinely ravage our cities.  This vital message of impending environmental disaster must be addressed before it is too late!
Billboards Hacker seeks to convey this vital message through society’s most decadent advertising channel: gigantic billboards.  These billboards that once programmed us to buy, use, consume, and discard our limited resources have now been reprogrammed by Billboards Hacker to display a new message: “What have I done today to end Climate Change?”
Through his paintings, videos, and photographs depicting the city and sky, Billboards Hacker uses his years of research and observation of light to exhibit peaceful visuals while displaying a message about climate change.  By seeing the city and sky—together with his message of climate change—Billboards Hacker seeks to remind everyone of our duty to preserve our fragile planet.
Not only has this message of climate change become an integral part of his artwork, but this message will also leap from the canvas to the real thing as part of a public art project in New York City.  While still in its nascent stages, Billboards Hacker plans to display the same message of climate change on actual billboards throughout the city, from Times Square to other iconic places.  The money from sales of his artwork, along with private and public sponsors, will help make this historic public exhibit possible.
By forcing everyone to realize the negative effects we have on the environment, and that we must act daily to address them before it is too late, Billboards Hacker hopes that we can move past our foolishness and leave a beautiful planet to our children.
---------------
For this wall project, we need support to fund rental of the crane/lift for 5 weeks, paint, and different materials. (Permits are going to be issued soon and we already have the agreement of the owner of the building).The Art piece will be a permanent installation.If  you give, you will also receive. We’ve put together some great rewards. If you contribute you can have one of them. 


We will again be filming the whole project with GoPro equipment. The footage will soon be posted on BillboardsHacker.com. You can also subscribe to our channel on YouTube or follow us on instagram #BillboardsHacker or Twitter @billboardhacker or like our Facebook page.
Take a look at the right hand column to find the one that is right for you. 
If you just want to give money to the project, that's great too, but we are happy to pass on some of Billboards Hacker work in exchange.
If you have not backed this important project yet, we hope you will consider doing so. We have only 12 days :)If you cannot give, you can still help the project and get the word out and make some noise about this campaign. You can even use Indiegogo share tools!
We have the experience to paint large surfaces for years now, We have the experience to paint beautiful skies and nice "Trompe l'Oeil" (trick the eyes) technique. BUT this one will be possible because of YOUR help. Only your funding can make this happen and happen now :)
With just $15.000 we are able to make a double permanent billboard. When in NYC we would need over $100.000 to rent for a short time a even smaller billboard. This is a great opportunity for all of us.
A big part of the funding will go in the rental of the crane/lift. Of course a lot will go to the quantity of paint we need for such a surface. But some part of the funds will go also to special tools that will make us able to make it happen in under 5 weeks and be able to still show you the progress on here, on youtube and on the Artist Website BillboardsHacker.com.
We need your funding.  Every donation matters. All kinds of participation is very helpful. We have some very unique perks and be sure we will make you feel a part of this exciting project that embellishes our city! Your contribution will make a huge impact in many ways. New Rochelle is having more and more murals come up on the walls of the city in the Art DIstrict. These double painted billboards are not only big by its size, but also amazing because of the "trick the eyes" technique. It will be right in the middle of Huguenot Street, one of the major streets of New Rochelle- where thousands of people drive by everyday. This is a tremendous impact in our everyday life and shows concern about the Climate Change and the way we behave regarding our beautiful planet.Last October we raised over $2000 dollars. Just a few friends and art collectors made it possible (see the past campaign). But everybody now loves the result and the mural on Division Street. We hope to get many more people involved this time. This T-Shirt is just one example of the many fun perks you can choose to help:

This indiegogo campaign is the biggest part of the funding for the project, but there are other ways to contribute.  You are welcome to buy an art piece from Billboardhacker.com, proceeds from which will be put towards the project. Together we can do this.

story:
The acquisition of SEVEN is a sign of the PMA’s commitment and dedication to downtown Portland and critical to the revitalization of Congress Square. This work of art will become a monument to the community and be a clear identifier of the Portland Museum of Art and the PMA’s address, Seven Congress Square.

With this campaign, the Contemporaries can define, for a new generation, what it means to give. It doesn’t matter how much you contribute, rather that you choose to help put your mark on the museum’s future. The Steering Committee and other Contemporaries leaders have already raised $18,000 for SEVEN, and we’re asking the whole Contemporaries group to help us raise the final $7,000. This is your time and your museum—help us get there!

The PMA thanks the Contemporaries Steering Committee for their tireless leadership and for demonstrating through this video how the PMA brings us all together.

Contemporaries Steering Committee
Bree LaCasse (Co-Chair)
Molly Meyer (Co-Chair)
Kyo Bannai
Tony Cox
Celine Frueh
MaryBeth Lorenz
Alec Porteous
Mika Reynolds
Sean Wilkinson

story:
Betty's cookie(s) around the world

deutsch
Mein Name ist Betty und vor kurzem ist mir etwas ganz zauberhaftes passiert.
Die, die mich kennen, wissen ich bin eine ganz "süße" Burlesquetänzerin … ich backe für meine Auftritte kleine Schlemmereien für mein Publikum. Und wie ich gestern so meine Kekse aus dem Ofen holen wollte, lag da ein riesiger Herz-Keks und strahlte mich fröhlich an. Ich war sofort verliebt, adoptierte dieses zuckersüße Herzchen gab ihr den Namen Cream E. Cookie.

Da ich vor ein paar Wochen den deutschen Burlypicks-Vorentscheid in Berlin gewonnen habe und nun am Finale in Los Angeles teilnehmen werde, stellt sich jetzt die Frage: Was soll nun aus Cream E. werden? Denn zuhause lassen, kann ich sie nicht. Leider hat mein Bulldog Jack Cream E. zum Fressen gerne und wenn ich nicht da bin, um auf sie aufzupassen …

Da kommt ihr ins Spiel, liebe Freunde. Wir brauchen ein bisschen Startkapital für Cream E.´s Flugticket, da sie natürlich auch alles sehen, erleben und mitmachen will, was L.A. zu bieten hat.
Damit auch ihr etwas davon habt, wenn ihr uns unterstützt, hat Cream E. eine ganz tolle Idee: Wir werden während unserer Reise Postkarten von Cream E. und allen Sehenswürdigkeiten L.A.´s und Kaliforniens an euch schicken. Auch wird mein kleiner Knusperkeks einen Reisebericht nur für euch schreiben, damit ihr alles über unser Abenteuer erfahrt.

Wir würden uns auch riesig freuen, wenn ihr uns dabei helft eine Backmöglichkeit in L.A. zu finden, damit meine kleinen Schlemmereien die Westküste erobern können.

Küsschen
Betty und die zuckersüße Cream E. Cookie

english

My name is Betty and recently something quite magical has happened to me.
Those who know me are aware that I am a very "sweet" burlesqueperformer ... I love to bake cookies for my audience. And just as I was about to get my cookies out of the oven yesterday, I suddenly found a huge heart biscuit that smiled at me cheerfully. I fell in love immediately, adopted this sugary little heart and gave her the name Cream E. Cookie.

A few weeks ago I won the Burlypicks regional in Berlin and will now take part in the Los Angeles finals. But the question arises: What will happen to of Cream E.? I just can´t leave her at home - because my Bulldog Jack really likes to nibble on Cream E. when I'm not there to protect her.

That´s why I need your help, my dear friends. We need a bit of money to afford Cream E. 's ticket to L.A.. If you support us you shall not go empty-handed! Cream E. came up with a really great idea: during our trip we will send postcards of Cream E. and all the sights of L.A. and California to you. In addition this sweet little biscuit will write a travelog for you, so you´ll learn everything about our adventure.

I would also very delighted if you may help me to find a place where I can bake in L.A.! So my little delicacies can conquer the west coast.

XOXOXO
Betty and her sugar-sweet Cream E. Cookie

story:
It’s time for the Bachelor of Fine Arts annual senior show!

Each year, all of the graduating art seniors receive the opportunity to exhibit their final undergraduate works in Willimantic. This year’s show, on April 16th, will be a fabulous night of friends, marvelous food, and most importantly ART from forty-eight different artists. There will be many media represented, from metal sculptures to art books to film photography.

Due to some flooding in the exhibition space, we are in need of rebuilding several podiums used to display 3D artwork. Funds beyond our podium rebuilding costs will go to the students in the form of the Student’s Choice Award. This award is typically given to one student each year, and is funded by donations from fellow art students. We would love to give out a larger award, or perhaps several awards, instead of the single small award. If you would like to support your friends and family at UConn Art, please consider donating to our BFA night. You even have the opportunity to choose your own creative name of an award! Thank you! And we hope to see you on April 16th! 

Rewards for Donation:

$5+ Purple Sponsor

Thank you for your contribution, anything helps! We will feature your name under the ‘Purple Sponsor’ section at the bottom of our fabulous thank you poster, displayed at the BFA show opening night.

$20+ Bronze Sponsor

Thank you so much for helping! We will feature your name in the ‘Bronze Sponsor’ section of our thank you poster, right above the Purple Sponsors. Your name will be displayed in a slightly bigger font, how fancy.

$50+ Silver Sponsor

Wow, thank you! You are featured almost at the top of our thank you poster. What a fabulous spot for your name to be in.

$120+ Gold Sponsor

If you dare to cross into Gold Sponsor territory, not only will your name be displayed at the top of our poster, but you have the opportunity to name an award! Name it after yourself, or concoct any creative (appropriate) name of your liking.

story:
Meet Mohammed from Al-Aroub refugee camp

Mohammed is from Al Aroub refugee camp in the West Bank. Even though there is no art education in the camp Mohammed has taught himself to draw, paint and even to play violin. Mohammed's dream is to one day visit Paris to learn more about art and to use this experience to teach and inspire the children in Al Aroub.

I asked Mohammed why art is so important to him? 

''In the camp there is not much to do. After school most children just hang out on the streets. We don’t have art or music in school. We learn a little bit of drawing but it’s nothing serious. When I draw I’m alone with my imagination and that makes me feel free. Free from the situation we are dealing with here. I want the children in the camp to be able to experience the same thing.''

The dream

Even though Mohammed has never been outside of his region his big dream is to visit Paris one day. All the painters he has been reading about have either studied or lived in Paris. The trip would be a combination between visiting museums and art schools. We are hoping to arrange a course with prestigious art school. 

Buy art and make a difference

By contributing to this campaign you can purchase one of Mohammed's artworks and at same time contribute to Mohammed's dream. If we don't reach our target goal the contributions will be put into a fund, which Mohammed can use for purchasing art supplies and to attend a course at a local art school.

Of course if you can't contribute you can still help us by sharing Mohammed's story. You can help us spread the message about this campaign through your community and social media channels.

Please keep in mind that..

After the Indiegogo campaign ends the prints will be distributed. This could take up to the end of July 2015. Due to the limited resources of this project, it will not be possible to track your order. Thanks, for understanding.

For any questions, remarks or just a friendly conversation please drop a line at: mohammedsartventure@gmail.com

FAQ - Questions you might have

When will the perks be delivered?

We start delivering perks and give more information and details on the delivery after the campaign. As soon as the artworks are scanned/printed/created they are ready for take off. Because most of the artworks will be prints we will wait until the campaign ends so we can do the printing all in one time. Those who ordered an original artwork have to wait until Mohammed has made them.

How will the funders be kept informed during and after the campaign?

We will be sending all of our supporters updates through our Indiegogo page and via email to the email address you have provided when signing up to the Indiegogo site. We will also post updates on our Facebook page.

I purchased a copy of one of Mohammed’s artwork. How can I tell you which artwork I would like to have? 

We will contact everyone during/after the campaign and ask which artwork you would like to receive.

I purchased a personal made artwork. How can I tell you my story? 

The idea behind this perk is that you send a personal story to us. Mohammed will make you something inspired by your own story. It’s important that you send your story to mohammedsartventure@gmail.com. Make sure to also send your name and address with it so we can send it to you after the campaign is done.

If the project doesn't reach it’s funding goal, do I get my money back?

If we manage to raise our target goal we are going to try to arrange a trip for Mohammed together with his brother Marwan to Paris. We want to combine this trip with visiting art schools, museums and drinking coffee in a real French café. If we don’t reach our target goal the money will be invested in Mohammed’s art education in a local art school. Mohammed will also be able to use the funding to buy himself art supplies.

story:
Who Am I

Hi there! I am a graphic design student currently enrolled in my final year and putting together my Design Thesis in order to graduate, and quite frankly, I need your help. Printing is expensive, not to mention the merchandise fees. If you could help in any way that would be fantastic!

Short Summary

There is a hypocrisy towards female nipples in North America, that is caused by over-sexualization, which needs to be solved through an online campaign that educates the viewer on the unfairness of the censoring. 

It is now 2015, and yet a nipple attached to a female form is considered a taboo. This is especially obvious in social media. When a male is topless in a photo, on facebook or instagram, it goes unnoticed. However, once a female is topless in a photo on social media, it causes an uproar of anger and slut-shaming. This is unacceptable and hypocritical in our modern times. 

For my thesis project, I will be creating a campaign focusing on ending the stigma surrounding female nipples.


What I Need / What You Get

For me to reach my goals with this project, I will need some help from you guys! 

I hope to raise $500 to cover the costs of T-shirts, Buttons, Stickers, Model Fees, and Lighting Equipment. But honestly, any amount will help a lot! 

~~

If you donated you can get some of these awesome perks bellow! 

The Impact

In 1930 two men were arrested for being topless on Coney Island, Canada. They fought for their cause and rights to be topless and in 1936 their words were heard. The men’s bare chests were accepted in society. It is now our turn to fight for the women’s rights on social media to bare their chests and we will be one step closer to equality. 

With my thesis, I hope to help this movement towards equality.

Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, no worries! You can still help my sharing this page with your friends and help me get one step closer to creating this thesis project!

But honestly, any amount will help a lot! ~~If you donated you can get some of these awesome perks bellow! 





    The Impact 









In 1930 two men were arrested for being
topless on Coney Island, Canada. They fought
for their cause and rights to be topless and in
1936 their words were heard. The men’s bare
chests were accepted in society. It is now our
turn to fight for the women’s rights on social
media to bare their chests and we will be one
step closer to equality. 



With my thesis, I hope to help this movement towards equality.

   
Other Ways You Can Help

 If you are unable to donate, no worries! You can still help my sharing this page with your friends and help me get one step closer to creating this thesis project!

story:
Short Summary

So with all the great things going on in life I might be a little financially embarrassed to be able to make our homeowner dreams come true. With the removal of a tree that cast quite the shadow on our backyard view having to be removed I couldn't find a better replacement than a deck to bring our property to life.

What We Need & What You Get

We need nothing in life...we want a deck. Building this deck will facilitate more back yard gathering, campfires, and general frivolity.

The Impact

Impact...people who have decks have more deck parties. People who have more parties have more friends who get to go to back yard parties and...I mean come on, isn't this beautiful cycle of reciprocation self evident?

Other Ways You Can Help

Do or do not, there is no try. If this is good enough for Yoda, it's good enough for me.
