story:
Bref résumé

Nos demandes sont simples et raisonnables : un salaire décent pour une vie décente en échange de notre travail, et des congés maladie pour palier aux imprévus de la vie. Nous pensons que ce sont deux éléments de base qui devraient être communs à l'ensemble des travailleurs et travailleuses.

Nous sommes en grève depuis le 27 mai pour ces deux demandes. Depuis cette date, l'employeur reste inflexible et préfère tenter de briser la grève plutôt que d'assurer des conditions décentes à ses employé-e-s.  L'objectif principal de cette campagne de financement est de créer un fonds d'aide pour les familles parmi nos membres en grève, qui vivent sur la même allocation de grève que les autres et ont besoin de plus de soutien à ce stade.

Contribuer à notre grève, c'est contribuer à une lutte historique pour l'établissement d'un salaire minimum juste et décent pour l'ensemble des travailleurs et travailleuses. La lutte pour un salaire minimum à 15$ a déjà fait des gains aux États-Unis et ailleurs au Canada, il est maintenant temps d'ajouter des victoires québécoises à cette cause. 

 

 Ce dont nous avons besoin et ce que vous obtenez

 Les fonds amassés iront principalement dans notre fonds d'aide aux familles, mais aussi dans d'autres fonds nécessaires à la continuité de la grève. Cet argent sera redistribué parmi nos membres pour alléger le poids de la grève et nous permettre de continuer encore plus forts vers nos demandes.

Dans une moindre mesure, si le financement dépasse nos attentes, nous pourrons aussi financer des activités de grève régulières avec cet argent - un local de grève, du matériel, etc. Mais la priorité sera en tout temps le fonds d'aide aux familles et ses activités connexes (comité bouffe, vêtements, etc).

 

 L'impact

Le fonds d'aide aux familles se concrétisera par une allocation hebdomadaire par enfant par membre. Ainsi, un-e gréviste qui a quatre enfants ou un-e gréviste qui en deux se verront accorder une allocation en conséquence. Le montant de l'allocation dépendra de la somme amassée.

Les autres dépenses seront pour acheter de la nourriture pour notre cuisine collective, qui peut ensuite redistribuer sa production parmi nos membres. Des moyens de visibilité comme des dossards ajoutés par-dessus les manteaux pour le froid qui arrive seront produits aussi partiellement avec l'argent amassé si le montant est suffisamment élevé pour répondre aux deux demandes précédentes (les familles et la nourriture).

 

 D'autres façons d'aider

 Si vous ne pouvez pas nous aider financièrement, plusieurs autres moyens vous sont proposés : 

- Vous pouvez contacter votre syndicat, votre association étudiante ou autre regroupement pour ce que ce regroupement nous fasse un don (contactez nous pour faire des dons par chèque sans problème)

- Vous pouvez diffuser notre appel au financement dans votre entourage et dans vos milieux

- Vous pouvez partager et respecter notre appel au boycott du site du Vieux-Port et de ses installations

Et enfin, un énorme merci à toutes et à tous de la part de l'ensemble des membres du Syndicat des employé-e-s du Vieux-Port du Montréal!

story:
We need your support!

This page represents UWE (Bristol) Illustration students. Every year students hold an exhibition in London, this year in The Old Truman Brewery. This final exhibition is a key point in our careers, putting our work in the spotlight and drawing in art directors, editors and other professionals who have the power to give graduates a valuable start in a very competitive and challenging industry. We have all individually pooled as much of our own money as we can, however to rent the space we need to raise £7000!  Our indie go go target is a lot smaller but is a very significant chunk .In contributing to the campaign to rent the space you are helping to give young, creative people the platform they need to start their careers and pursue their dreams.

What We Need & What You Get

100% of the money raised on Indie go go will contribute towards renting the space.

In order to show our gratitude we have a number of unique rewards available!

£8- You get a UWE illustration Cocklendar (yes- a cock themed calendar!) delivered straight to your door. Featuring 12 full colour illustrations from UWE students, you will be the envy of your friends and family!

£20- A Cocklendar PLUS an original signed print from a UWE illustration student

£50- You get to commission a UWE illustration student of your choice (after seeing example images) to produce whatever image you want from them! You know that drawing of the cyborg baby riding a giant snail through Tokyo you always wanted? Well... here is your chance.

£70-Wow! You get it all baby! You get a Cocklender AND 2 original prints AND a commissioned work!

Again- We are extremely grateful for anything you might be able to contribute- Thank you from all UWE Illustration Students.

Please share this page if you can!
story_txt: We need your support! This page represents UWE (Bristol) Illustration students. Every year students hold an exhibition in London, this year in The Old Truman Brewery. This final exhibition is a key point in our careers, putting our work in the spotlight and drawing in art directors, editors and other professionals who have the power to give graduates a valuable start in a very competitive and challenging industry. We have all individually pooled as much of our own money as we can, however to rent the space we need to raise £7000!  Our indie go go target is a lot smaller but is a very significant chunk .In contributing to the campaign to rent the space you are helping to give young, creative people the platform they need to start their careers and pursue their dreams.   What We Need & What You Get 100% of the money raised on Indie go go will contribute towards renting the space.In order to show our gratitude we have a number of unique rewards available!£8- You get a UWE illustration Cocklendar (yes- a cock themed calendar!) delivered straight to your door. Featuring 12 full colour illustrations from UWE students, you will be the envy of your friends and family!£20- A Cocklendar PLUS an original signed print from a UWE illustration student£50- You get to commission a UWE illustration student of your choice (after seeing example images) to produce whatever image you want from them! You know that drawing of the cyborg baby riding a giant snail through Tokyo you always wanted? Well... here is your chance.£70-Wow! You get it all baby! You get a Cocklender AND 2 original prints AND a commissioned work!   Again- We are extremely grateful for anything you might be able to contribute- Thank you from all UWE Illustration Students.Please share this page if you can!

story:
Our Story

MysteryBox is a project created to fulfill the dreams of all bookworms, book lovers, nerds or any newcomers who are willing to join the adventurous world of reading. 


Why is reading important?

"The reading of all good books is like a conversation with the finest minds of past centuries" ~ Rene Descartes

  • Boosts imagination and creativity
  • Leads to self-improvement and develops empathy
  • Relaxes the body and calms the mind
  • Helps you gain experience with other people
  • Reading is a great form of entertainment (it's completely OK to fall in love with a fictional character :))
  • Reading can be done at any age and in any place


How MysteryBox works?


Glad that you asked!

Each month a theme will be picked by the creators of the MysteryBox. Possible themes could be: Anime, Friendship, Steampunk, etc.
People can see the theme on the MysteryBox website, Instagram, Facebook or any other social media. Every person who subscribes to the box for the month will receive a special box containing a book on the theme and hand-made goodies surrounding the book that will help making the experience even more exciting. Nothing of the box content will be shared publicly before the month ends so that all subscribers will reveal the mystery on their own. After the month ends, the box will be shown to the world in a blog post describing the purpose of each item in it.

Give me a sample!

Although a wizard never reveals his magic ...

Here's what the MysteryBox would contain for the theme: Mystery
1, The book - 1q84 by Haruki Murakami

2. Beautiful handmade book cover

3. Phoenix bookmark encrusted with crystals

4. Handmade cup for tea or your favorite cappuccino 

5. Japanese Kokeshi doll - Yoshiko

Make sure to see the Gallery on top of the campaign for more images :)

FAQ

1. What makes the items in the book unique?

The so called "goodies" are hand-made items made with love from people and you cannot find them in the shops.

2. How I will know that I don't have the book already?

In time MysteryBox will load books that are completely fresh and came not longer than 45 days after they are published. The chance to have the book already is slightly possible.

3. What is the age target for the books?

Books are coming from a variety of genres. Twice a year, we will launch a theme that is specially for children which will be marked in social media and the website.

4. How much a MysteryBox will cost if the goal succeeds?

MysteryBox will be sold with special plans:

- month-to-month plan will cost 29.99$ (including shipping)

- 3 months plan - 89.99$ (including shipping)

- 6 months - 169$ (including shipping)

5. In which languages will the book in the box be?

Two equal boxes on two languages will be prepared fro each theme:
one in Bulgarian and one in English.


How we'll use the funds?


Here's a rough estimate of where your money will go:

10% website launch - Luckily we are web developers who know how to create a website but yet there are taxes for designers, domain, hosting etc.

10% storе taxes - All books and goodies around them need to be in a store. We'll use 10% of the amount collected for store fees for an year.

50% Backer Rewards - This will be weighted more heavily if we get more money

10% Delivery fees - To make sure that you receive all your perks worldwide. 

10% Indiegogo and Processing Fees - Bank fees, transfer fees, credit card fees...seriously. It's a fee-pocalyse.

10% Marketing - We are going to create sponsored ads in Facebook,and other places. The philosophy is Spend money to make money.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you cannot contribute to the project but you really like the idea, please shout out loud on the social media so that more people can find it!

*Images on the campaign are retrieved from Pinterest and have all copyrights

story:
Who are The Doodlists?

We are a group of artists who employ doodling as a focus for our creative output. This doodle-oriented exhibition was conceived by Richmond, VA artist Dana Frostick, creator of "Elaborate Doodles."

The aim of "The Doodlists" is to raise awareness of the use of doodling in the creation of artwork and to promote the idea that doodling is not a waste of time, but a valuable resource for artists and the public at large. Doodling helps you gain focus, it helps you retain information and it helps you find creative solutions to problems.

Featured artists include Duane Cregger, Dana Frostick, Dee Glazer, Shannon Gilbert Leo Heinzel, Tracy Herman, Matt Lively, Ja Mes, Susan Singer, Henry Stindt, Rob Ryder and Roman Zelgatas.

"The Doodlists" will be a presentation of the state of the doodle particularly in regard to its use in fine arts. The exhibit is scheduled to run from April 24 - May 17, 2015, at artspace gallery in Richmond, VA.

At least two of "The Doodlists" will give workshops during the exhibit. Susan Singer will be teaching Zendoodles and Dana Frostick will be teaching Elaborate Doodles. These workshops will help us explore the differences and similarities between various doodling techniques.

Contributions to "The Doodlists" will pay for the cost of the exhibition, publicity and workshops.

Grab some doodly perks

All contributors of $5 or more will receive an invitation to our Preview Party where they may meet the artists and have the opportunity to purchase original art before the show opens to the public.

Items:

We are offering "The Doodlists" logo on coffee cups ($25) and black t-shirts ($35).

Images of work by "The Doodlists" are available on white t-shirts ($75) or a postcard ($10). We have calendars ($35) with work by all twelve featured artists.

You can get a Limited Edition Duane Cregger print of ("Carousel I" 13.15x17 inch image area, #6 of 25) on bamboo paper for $250

Receive a set of Triangle Play Large Triangles by Susan Singer for $199 (limit 2).

You can also get a 18x24 inch ($90) or 24x36 inch ($125) poster print and an 8x10 inch ($150) or 12x12 inch ($200) gallery wrapped canvas of images represented in our Gallery Tab by "The Doodlists."  See our Gallery Tab for available images.

Services:
Susan Singer is offering tuition for one of her Zendoodles Classes for $75.

Dana Frostick is offering 2 hours of private instruction on how to make Elaborate Doodles in her studio for $100 and demonstrations of her creative process at schools local to the Richmond, VA area, per classroom ($25) or in assembly ($50).

Updated December 1, 2014:

Brand New Perks:

Signed book by Dana Frostick for $25. Get a signed Copy of Dana Frostick's book, "Elaborate Doodles, The Artwork of Dana Frostick." 34 pgs, soft cover, 6.5x6.75 inches. Preview: http://www.blurb.com/books/3905922-elaborate-doodles

Original Doodle Painting 8x10 inches by Tracy Herman for $30. 4 more available!

Framed Drawing by Dana Frostick for $45. Choose one from a selection of 6 framed original Elaborate Doodles in sharpie on 11x9.5 inch paper. Frame 14x11 inches. Selection is available first come, first served, from the following pieces found on this webpage: http://danafrostick.com/artwork/sharpie_on_paper.htm
http://danafrostick.com/artwork/2007/drawings06_07/drawing13.htm
http://danafrostick.com/artwork/2007/drawings06_07/drawing2.htm
http://danafrostick.com/artwork/2007/drawings06_07/drawing8.htm
http://danafrostick.com/artwork/2007/drawings06_07/scan0003.htm
http://danafrostick.com/artwork/2008/new_drawings/drawing5.htm
http://danafrostick.com/artwork/2007/drawings06_07/drawing3.htm

Changes for Cyber Monday and #GivingTuesday!
Dana Frostick has changed the Local Classroom Demonstration Perk in two ways: #1 - it is now available to private groups and #2 - the perk has been reduced to $20!
Also, our 2nd Time Donation T-shirt perk is now available to anyone who has previously given to The Doodlists Campaign!!



Our artists need help to cover the cost of this exhibition


Our bare minimum costs of $1,850 include:
$600 Exhibition Fee
$250  Postcard Fee
$360  Food for Preview and Opening Reception
$340  Brochure
$300  Materials for workshops

A budget expanded by $2,200 would help fund:
$300  Logo Design Fee
$600  Misc. display costs (lights, Frames, Hardware, Magnets)
$480  Shipping w/insurance for out-of-town art to get to gallery
$480  Travel costs for out-of-town artists
$360  Lodging for out-of-town artists

Anything beyond the $4,050 listed above would go towards booking a speaker like Sunni Brown or other doodle experts, as available. If successful, this could become a regular event that could feature many other artists' work and the exhibition could travel throughout the United States, spreading the love for doodles everywhere.

Support the Doodle Revolution!

According to well-known doodle advocate, Sunni Brown, "We think doodling is something you do when you lose focus but in reality it is a preemptive measure to stop you from losing focus."  Sunni believes that the real definition of doodling is "to make spontaneous marks to help yourself think."

In her TED talk Sunni Brown: Doodlers, unite! , Sunni expounds on her admiration for doodling, saying "under no circumstances should doodling be eradicated from a classroom or a boardroom or even the war room. On the contrary, doodling should be leveraged in precisely those situations where information density is very high and the need for processing that information is very high." She also says, "Because doodling is so universally accessible and it is not intimidating as an art form, it can be leveraged as a portal through which we move people into higher levels of visual literacy."

The act of doodling frees our minds from straining too hard for answers. It relaxes our thoughts, opening our minds to receive ideas or content from the our environment -- both locally and universally. Frequently, these ideas will provide answers to questions that we may have been struggling to solve.

It's time to stop the denigration of doodling and embrace it for the helpful tool and creative inspiration it is. Please support "The Doodlists" art exhibition!

Please visit "The Doodlists" website for more information about the art, the artists and the exhibition: thedoodlists.com


Explore more about doodling with these links:

David Robson, BBC Future's feature writer
Are we hard-wired to doodle?

Lee Cowan of CBS explores the discipline of "Doodle-ology"
The higher purpose of doodling

From U.S. New and World Report, HEALTH
Take Note: Doodling Can Help Memory

More fine art doodling from Smashing Yolo
40 Mind Blowing Doodle Art Examples

Photo credits:
Dana Frostick, Roman Zelgatas and Dee Glazer by Nic De Santis. Rob Ryder by Dan Mouer. Susan Singer by  Kim Brundage. Henry Stindt by Patrick Keough. Matt Lively by Nick Mastro. Shannon Gilbert by Chris Wilkerson. Tracy Herman by Amanda Powell.

story:
Cardistry-Con is an interactive conference centered around the art of cardistry, where cardists from all over the world can gather and explore the limitless expressive potential of an ordinary deck of playing cards.



As a blossoming art form gaining rapid popularity, we want to provide a platform where cardists around the world can gather to push the art forward: a place to share ideas and be inspired, learn from one another and collaborate, and have an absolute blast together.


By gathering the community, we believe cardistry will flourish like never before.


The event will take place in in Brooklyn, New York, from April 10th-12th, and will feature some of the best cardists in the world. Events will include talks, panel discussions, live performances, exclusive video screenings, Q&As, workshops, contests, giveaways, and more.


WHY WE NEED YOUR HELP

Last year, we hosted a small gathering for cardists to gauge interest for an event of this nature. Here's a quick look at just how awesome it was:


It only lasted one afternoon, but that was enough to leave a strong impression on all those who attended. And ever since, we've continually been asked, "When will the next Cardistry-Con happen?"

While it has been our intention to hold another Cardistry-Con, it is the ongoing support and interest in the event from the community that has inspired us to make this year's Cardistry-Con much, much, bigger.

This year's conference will span an entire three-day weekend with 14 of the best cardists in the world headlining the event. But that's not all...

We want this year's Cardistry-Con to involve as much of the community as possible, so we'll also be live-streaming the conference online. This means that regardless of where you are in the world, you'll be able to watch and interact with all your favorite cardists at the conference.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

Of course, we can only do so much on our own: things like renting out a venue, securing headliners, multi-camera setups, and live broadcasting software all cost a fair bit of money. But with your contributions, we'll have the ability to make this year's event as epic as possible. 

The more this project gets funded, the greater the experience will be for both those attending in person and those watching online.

It's up to you to make Cardistry-Con as awesome as you want it to be!


THE LINE-UP // FEATURED CARDISTS

We've reached out to some of the most talented and creative figures in today's cardistry scene to headline this year's event. So in addition to the eight cardists from our organizing team, we'll also be featuring six other influential cardists from around the world.

Not only will you be able to see them perform live, but you'll also be able to gain insight into their creative processes, learn a few of their signature moves, ask them any questions you have about the art, and most importantly, session with some of the best cardists in the world for an entire weekend. How awesome is that?

The identities of the other six cardists are enshrouded in mystery for now, but we will be revealing a new name from the line-up every three days right here on our IndieGoGo page.


EVENT REGISTRATION // $125

YOUR PASS TO ATTEND CARDISTRY-CON IN BROOKLYN

As the event space is limited and several spots have already been reserved for organizers and headliners, only 52 event registrations are being offered up for grabs.

Registration is $125, and includes full access to the three days' events, as well as a Swag Pack featuring several exclusive decks from our sponsors and an assortment of other cardistry accessories.


LIVE STREAMING // $30

ALL ACCESS TO OUR LIVE FEED COVERING THE EVENT

We're excited to announce that Cardistry-Con will also be streamed live across the web for anyone with an online pass to view. We'll be setting up a camera to capture the entirety of the events throughout the weekend and have selected LiveStream.com as our content provider to deliver the highest quality video possible.

The Live Streaming pass is $30, and includes unlimited access to a high definition video stream of all three days' events. Watch it live as it's happening or stream it later.

And depending on how much funding we raise, we may be able to set up multiple cameras, giving the viewer a choice to switch between them.

- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -

In addition, anyone with an online pass will be able to engage with everyone attending the event in Brooklyn. There will be a comments stream below the video for you to ask questions, make requests, or have a discussion. These comments will be projected onto a wall at the event for everyone present to see and interact with.

This is a great opportunity for cardists not attending the event to be a part of the conference. And even if your schedule doesn't allow you to watch the event live, you’ll still be able to stream the broadcast any time.


PREMIUM TUTORIALS // $20

EXCLUSIVE TUTORIALS FROM OUR HEADLINERS

To make the most of this year's gathering, we'll be recording tutorials by the featured artists in our line-up. Each cardist will be contributing one of their original creations, and these tutorials will be compiled and made available as an on-demand digital download which you can pre-order as one of our pledge options.

Also featured in the bundle will be a mini-documentary chronicling the lead-up to the con, as well as some footage of the actual con itself. The estimated release date for both the tutorials and the documentary is May 2015.


THE VENUE // GOWANUS LOFT

AN EPIC SPACE TO EXPLORE AND EXPRESS OUR ART

We're really excited about the location for this year's event. We chose New York because it's conveniently located right in between the west coast of the United States and Europe. We hope this aids in less expensive travel (overall) for many our our attendees.

For the space, we wanted an environment that would both reflect our culture and also complement the art. A hotel ballroom simply wouldn't cut it for us, so we searched and searched and found the perfect spot. It's a giant open loft in Brooklyn with white walls, wood floors, and lots of light.


ABOUT THE ORGANIZERS

To cater our event to the community as much as possible, we've been collaborating with some of the top minds (and hands) in cardistry to help organize this year's Cardistry-Con.


FUNDING GOALS //

A LOOK AT WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL GO TOWARD

$8,000 – Covers the cost of renting the Gowanus Loft for the weekend (including audio/visual gear to play sound and project videos), furniture, and event staff to ensure that everything runs smoothly.

$10,000 – Will also cover the cost of setting up our live stream technology to broadcast the video to all our online pass holders.

$14,000 – Will allow us to provide accommodation for all our headliners, which we would love to be able to do for them.

$16,000 – Gives us to ability to add another camera and broadcast two video feeds simultaneously, giving anyone with an online pass the option to choose from multiple feeds for the best angle of what’s going on.

$20,000  – If we can raise this much, we will be able to contribute towards helping some of our organisers and headliners with travel expenses. Most of them have already agreed to come on their own dime, but as airfare can be pretty expensive, we want to help out our fellow cardists as much as we can.

As a not-for-profit organization, anything exceeding these goals will go towards making the event much more awesome, as well as contribute to the development and funding for the next Cardistry-Con.


RISKS AND CHALLENGES

With four years of experience organizing a much larger conference, Magic-Con, we're very familiar with the risks and challenges of producing an event like Cardistry-Con. And although Cardistry-Con is a much smaller conference, we have not taken this for granted and are dedicating just as much attention and resources towards organizing it.

If this campaign is not successful, meaning we do not reach our funding goal by the deadline, Cardistry-Con 2015 will still happen. It is important for us that you understand that. However, with your support, we know it will be above and beyond what we can do on our own.


FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONS

Will Cardistry-Con still happen if this project doesn’t get fully funded?

  • Regardless of whether this Kickstarter project reaches its funding goals, Cardistry-Con 2015 will still be happening at the same date and times at the Gowanus Loft in Brooklyn. However, as the actual experience of the conference itself is directly correlated to the amount of contributions this campaign receives, we would love as much of your help as we can get so that we can make this year’s Cardistry-Con an unforgettable event for everyone involved.

I’ve signed up for Live Streaming but might not be able to watch the event live — will I still be able to watch the event footage at a later date?

  • Yes. You can stream the event footage for viewing at a later date, and we will also be making the conference footage available for download for Online Pass holders eventually.

I'd like to upgrade my perk! How do I do this?

  • Say you originally got the Premium Tutorials perk, but you would like to upgrade it to the Livestream + Premium Tutorials Bundle. Since the difference between the two is $20, simply enter $20 (or more) into the entry form on the right-hand side of the page, then click 'Contribute Now' to send in the amount. Once you've done so, simply forward us the e-mail from IndieGoGo to us at cardistrycon@gmail.com, and we will take note of the upgrade for you. 
  • If you're upgrading from the Live Streaming perk to the Livestream + Premium Tutorials Bundle, just repeat the steps above, but with $10 or more.

Is there an age limit for Cardistry-Con?

  • There is no age limit for Cardistry-Con. That being said, if you are a minor and are traveling to New York with a parent, rest assured that since the event is taking place at a single location, your parent(s) can drop you off at the venue during conference hours (11am—7pm) and there will be plenty of adult supervision throughout the day.
Event registrations are sold out, but I would still like to attend to the conference. What do I do now?
  • Unfortunately we are only able to offer 52 registration spots as the event venue size is limited. However, if you would like to be added to our waiting list in case any spots open up, then please contact us at cardistrycon@gmail.com with the subject title ‘Waiting List’ and we will keep you updated should places become available.
story_txt:
Cardistry-Con is an interactive conference centered around the art of cardistry, where cardists from all over the world can gather and explore the limitless expressive potential of an ordinary deck of playing cards.



As a blossoming art form gaining rapid popularity, we want to provide a platform where cardists around the world can gather to push the art forward: a place to share ideas and be inspired, learn from one another and collaborate, and have an absolute blast together.
By gathering the community, we believe cardistry will flourish like never before.The event will take place in in Brooklyn, New York, from April 10th-12th, and will feature some of the best cardists in the world. Events will include talks, panel discussions, live performances, exclusive video screenings, Q&As, workshops, contests, giveaways, and more.WHY WE NEED YOUR HELPLast year, we hosted a small gathering for cardists to gauge interest for an event of this nature. Here's a quick look at just how awesome it was:It only lasted one afternoon, but that was enough to leave a strong impression on all those who attended. And ever since, we've continually been asked, "When will the next Cardistry-Con happen?"While it has been our intention to hold another Cardistry-Con, it is the ongoing support and interest in the event from the community that has inspired us to make this year's Cardistry-Con much, much, bigger.This year's conference will span an entire three-day weekend with 14 of the best cardists in the world headlining the event. But that's not all...We want this year's Cardistry-Con to involve as much of the community as possible, so we'll also be live-streaming the conference online. This means that regardless of where you are in the world, you'll be able to watch and interact with all your favorite cardists at the conference.- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -Of course, we can only do so much on our own: things like renting out a venue, securing headliners, multi-camera setups, and live broadcasting software all cost a fair bit of money. But with your contributions, we'll have the ability to make this year's event as epic as possible. The more this project gets funded, the greater the experience will be for both those attending in person and those watching online.It's up to you to make Cardistry-Con as awesome as you want it to be!THE LINE-UP // FEATURED CARDISTSWe've reached out to some of the most talented and creative figures in today's cardistry scene to headline this year's event. So in addition to the eight cardists from our organizing team, we'll also be featuring six other influential cardists from around the world.Not only will you be able to see them perform live, but you'll also be able to gain insight into their creative processes, learn a few of their signature moves, ask them any questions you have about the art, and most importantly, session with some of the best cardists in the world for an entire weekend. How awesome is that?The identities of the other six cardists are enshrouded in mystery for now, but we will be revealing a new name from the line-up every three days right here on our IndieGoGo page.EVENT REGISTRATION // $125YOUR PASS TO ATTEND CARDISTRY-CON IN BROOKLYNAs the event space is limited and several spots have already been reserved for organizers and headliners, only 52 event registrations are being offered up for grabs.Registration is $125, and includes full access to the three days' events, as well as a Swag Pack featuring several exclusive decks from our sponsors and an assortment of other cardistry accessories.LIVE STREAMING // $30ALL ACCESS TO OUR LIVE FEED COVERING THE EVENT
We're excited to announce that Cardistry-Con will also be streamed live across the web for anyone with an online pass to view. We'll be setting up a camera to capture the entirety of the events throughout the weekend and have selected LiveStream.com as our content provider to deliver the highest quality video possible.



The Live Streaming pass is $30, and includes unlimited access to a high definition video stream of all three days' events. Watch it live as it's happening or stream it later.
And depending on how much funding we raise, we may be able to set up multiple cameras, giving the viewer a choice to switch between them.


- - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - - -
In addition, anyone with an online pass will be able to engage with everyone attending the event in Brooklyn. There will be a comments stream below the video for you to ask questions, make requests, or have a discussion. These comments will be projected onto a wall at the event for everyone present to see and interact with.
This is a great opportunity for cardists not attending the event to be a part of the conference. And even if your schedule doesn't allow you to watch the event live, you’ll still be able to stream the broadcast any time.

PREMIUM TUTORIALS // $20
EXCLUSIVE TUTORIALS FROM OUR HEADLINERS
To make the most of this year's gathering, we'll be recording tutorials by the featured artists in our line-up. Each cardist will be contributing one of their original creations, and these tutorials will be compiled and made available as an on-demand digital download which you can pre-order as one of our pledge options.
Also featured in the bundle will be a mini-documentary chronicling the lead-up to the con, as well as some footage of the actual con itself. The estimated release date for both the tutorials and the documentary is May 2015.

THE VENUE // GOWANUS LOFT
AN EPIC SPACE TO EXPLORE AND EXPRESS OUR ART
We're really excited about the location for this year's event. We chose New York because it's conveniently located right in between the west coast of the United States and Europe. We hope this aids in less expensive travel (overall) for many our our attendees.
For the space, we wanted an environment that would both reflect our culture and also complement the art. A hotel ballroom simply wouldn't cut it for us, so we searched and searched and found the perfect spot. It's a giant open loft in Brooklyn with white walls, wood floors, and lots of light.


What's great about this location is that it's right below a subway station, making transportation to and from the event a breeze. It's in the Gowanus district with plenty of places to eat and hang out before and after each day's events.

 Since our event space is not a hotel, you're welcome to seek accommodation wherever you like. New York is full of options, and if you want to stay close by, we recommend rooming up with another attendee and seeking a place on Airbnb to stay.

ABOUT THE ORGANIZERS
To cater our event to the community as much as possible, we've been collaborating with some of the top minds (and hands) in cardistry to help organize this year's Cardistry-Con.

This year's organizing team includes Dan and Dave Buck (Dan & Dave), Zach Mueller (Fontaine Cards), Kevin Ho, Huron Low & Daren Yeow (The Virts), and Oliver Søgård & Tobias Levin (Dealers Grip).
FUNDING GOALS //
A LOOK AT WHAT YOUR CONTRIBUTIONS WILL GO TOWARD
$8,000 – Covers the cost of renting the Gowanus Loft for the weekend (including audio/visual gear to play sound and project videos), furniture, and event staff to ensure that everything runs smoothly.


$10,000 – Will also cover the cost of setting up our live stream technology to broadcast the video to all our online pass holders.
$14,000 – Will allow us to provide accommodation for all our headliners, which we would love to be able to do for them.
$16,000 – Gives us to ability to add another camera and broadcast two video feeds simultaneously, giving anyone with an online pass the option to choose from multiple feeds for the best angle of what’s going on.

$20,000  – If we can raise this much, we will be able to contribute towards helping some of our organisers and headliners with travel expenses. Most of them have already agreed to come on their own dime, but as airfare can be pretty expensive, we want to help out our fellow cardists as much as we can.
As a not-for-profit organization, anything exceeding these goals will go towards making the event much more awesome, as well as contribute to the development and funding for the next Cardistry-Con.

RISKS AND CHALLENGESWith four years of experience organizing a much larger conference, Magic-Con, we're very familiar with the risks and challenges of producing an event like Cardistry-Con. And although Cardistry-Con is a much smaller conference, we have not taken this for granted and are dedicating just as much attention and resources towards organizing it.If this campaign is not successful, meaning we do not reach our funding goal by the deadline, Cardistry-Con 2015 will still happen. It is important for us that you understand that. However, with your support, we know it will be above and beyond what we can do on our own.FREQUENTLY ASKED QUESTIONSWill Cardistry-Con still happen if this project doesn’t get fully funded?
Regardless of whether this Kickstarter project reaches its funding goals, Cardistry-Con 2015 will still be happening at the same date and times at the Gowanus Loft in Brooklyn. However, as the actual experience of the conference itself is directly correlated to the amount of contributions this campaign receives, we would love as much of your help as we can get so that we can make this year’s Cardistry-Con an unforgettable event for everyone involved.

Yes. You can stream the event footage for viewing at a later date, and we will also be making the conference footage available for download for Online Pass holders eventually.
I'd like to upgrade my perk! How do I do this?

Say you originally got the Premium Tutorials perk, but you would like to upgrade it to the Livestream + Premium Tutorials Bundle. Since the difference between the two is $20, simply enter $20 (or more) into the entry form on the right-hand side of the page, then click 'Contribute Now' to send in the amount. Once you've done so, simply forward us the e-mail from IndieGoGo to us at cardistrycon@gmail.com, and we will take note of the upgrade for you. 


If you're upgrading from the Live Streaming perk to the Livestream + Premium Tutorials Bundle, just repeat the steps above, but with $10 or more.

Is there an age limit for Cardistry-Con?
There is no age limit for Cardistry-Con. That being said, if you are a minor and are traveling to New York with a parent, rest assured that since the event is taking place at a single location, your parent(s) can drop you off at the venue during conference hours (11am—7pm) and there will be plenty of adult supervision throughout the day.

Unfortunately we are only able to offer 52 registration spots as the event venue size is limited. However, if you would like to be added to our waiting list in case any spots open up, then please contact us at cardistrycon@gmail.com with the subject title ‘Waiting List’ and we will keep you updated should places become available.

story:
(ENGLISH FOLLOWS)

DARE-DARE lance 3 DIS/LOCATIONs juste à temps pour ses 30 ans!


***

Profitez de la prévente de 3 DIS/LOCATIONs afin de rendre cette publication possible!

En effet, si 3 DIS/LOCATIONs bénéficie du soutien du CALQ, les fonds sont insuffisants à son impression. 

Votre soutien est indispensable pour que ce projet se concrétise!


Un reçu officiel sera émis pour tout don en argent  de 50 $ et plus (excluant les achats de contreparties).

***

DARE-DARE est un centre d'artistes autogéré qui, en 2004, lançait Dis/location : projet d'articulation urbaine et installait ses bureaux dans un abri mobile pour produire des événements artistiques dans l'espace public.


3 DIS/LOCATIONs

Ce dernier tome se penche sur les 3 derniers lieux d'amarrage de l'abri mobile de DARE-DARE, soit le square Cabot, le parc Walter-Stewart et le Quartier des spectacles, et propose les réflexions de cinq auteurs sur diverses réalités des pratiques artistiques dans l'espace public : instrumentalisation, (in)visibilité, anti-spectacle. (en français)


AUTEUR.ES

Martin Dufrasne, coordonnateur artistique à DARE-DARE, signe la préface et articule la réflexion qui sous-tend le projet Dis/location et, plus particulièrement, le fil conducteur qui a mené à cette publication.


Alain Deneault traite avec une ironie mordante des dérives du néolibéralisme, de la fascination de la société contemporaine pour l’économie et la rhétorique du management.


Julie Châteauvert, qui a été coordonnatrice des relations communautaires à DARE-DARE de 2007 à 2010, offre un témoignage vécu de l’intérieur, qui relate par flashes et décharges d’indignation les vives tensions qui ont caractérisé le séjour du Centre au square Cabot.


Suzanne Paquet aborde la question de l’invisibilité et du vide qui ont caractérisé le quatrième amarrage de DARE-DARE derrière l’usine de la JTI-MacDonald. Elle propose l’intéressante notion du point aveugle pour traduire cette zone et ce moment de transition.


Edith Brunette poursuit sa réflexion sur les formes de discours dominants et sur leur façon de représenter le monde en observant les politiques culturelles et leurs effets potentiellement insidieux sur les milieux de la création.


Manon Tourigny examine comment s’articulent les pratiques artistiques hors les murs des artistes sélectionnés par DARE-DARE alors qu’elle était commissaire, dans le cadre des éditions 2009, 2011 et 2013 du festival VIVA! art action.


Conception graphique : Design Denis Rioux

Comité de publication : Martin Dufrasne, Julie Fournier Lévesque, Frank Nobert, Valérie Perron, Denis Rioux et Manon Tourigny.


COFFRETS de SÉRIE LIMITÉE (de gauche à droite) : MONA SHARMA, DOMINIQUE PÉTRIN, FRANÇOIS LALUMIÈRE 

(crédits : Christian Bujold)


***

Unique trace tangible du passage de DARE-DARE sur chacun des sites investis, les publications approfondissent, appuient et assurent la pérennité de ses activités de recherche, de création et de diffusion artistique. Théoriciens, artistes et membres de DARE-DARE font part de leurs réflexions sur les infiltrations d’un organisme d’art actuel dans une structure telle que la Ville de Montréal, ainsi que des échos des pratiques spatiales dans des contextes urbains singuliers ailleurs dans le monde.


DIS/LOCATION 1 - Récipiendaire du Prix Grafika 2010

Le square Viger, lieu névralgique dans la géographie urbaine de Montréal, représente pour les auteurs de la publication – artistes, architectes, sociologues, journalistes – le point de départ d’une réflexion complexe sur les liens entre l’art et l’espace public envisagés dans leur dimension matérielle et symbolique. [En français avec extraits anglais. Auteur.es : Julie Boivin, Jean-Pierre Caissie, Jérôme Delgado, Raphaëlle de Groot, Marie-Suzanne Désilets, Louis Jacob, Fabien Loszach, Jean-François Prost, Armando Silva. Conception graphique : Design Denis Rioux.]


DIS/LOCATION 2

Sous la thématique « de la faillibilité et de l’échec », les expériences vécues au parc sans nom (terrain vague sous le viaduc Rosemont-Van Horne) et les projets mis de l'avant par DARE-DARE sont revisités, faisant valoir l'approche « en laboratoire » du centre d'artistes. [Français et anglais. Auteur.es : Clara Bonnes, Susanne Bosch, Jean-Pierre Caissie, J.R. Carpenter, Marie-Suzanne Désilets et César Saëz,Ève Dorais, Pascal Nicolas-Le Strat, Valérie Perron, Dan Pitera. Conception graphique : Sudio Tagteam.]



(crédits : Jean-Maxime Dufresne)


***

Avec Dis/location, DARE-DARE a établi un cadre de recherche et de diffusion artistique unique, dont le mandat est de promouvoir les interventions prenant place dans l'environnement urbain, par le biais d'œuvres performatives et installatives qui infiltrent l'espace public. Cette exploration urbaine s'effectue par amarrages successifs en des lieux de la ville de Montréal qui sont porteurs de riches questions sociales et politiques. Grâce à cette initiative, DARE-DARE s’est vu récompenser du Prix Orange (aménagement – urbanisme) par l'organisme Sauvons Montréal.


Lancement le 12 septembre 2015 sur le nouveau site de DARE-DARE, situé dans le triangle formé par les avenues Atwater, Greene et la rue Doré, à Montréal.


_____________________________________________________________________________

WE'RE NOT DARE YET!


DARE-DARE TURNS 30!!
Help support the publication of 3 DIS/LOCATIONs 


DARE-DARE will launch the 3rd volume of the Dis/location series: 3 DIS/LOCATIONs in time for its 30th anniversary celebrations!


***


Take advantage of the presale discount on 3 DIS/LOCATIONs and help this book materialize: Yes, 3 DIS/LOCATIONs is supported by the CALQ, but funds are insufficient to go to press. Your support is essential to make this project possible.

Official receipts provided for cash donations of $50 and above (purchases excluded).
***

An artist-run centre, DARE-DARE initiated in 2004 Dis/location : projet d'articulation urbaine and moved its offices in a mobile unit to present artistic interventions in the public space.


3 DIS/LOCATIONs (Translated from French by Nils Lövgren)

This new volume looks back on the 3 last locations of DARE-DARE’s mobile unit: Cabot Square, Walter-Stewart Park and the Quartier des spectacles. Five authors address various realities of artistic practices in public space, including instrumentalization, (in)visibility and the anti-spectacle. (in English)


AUTHORS

Martin Dufrasne, artistic coordinator for DARE-DARE, reflects in his preface on the philosophy that underpins the Dis/location project, and more specifically on the common thread that inspired this book.


Alain Deneault's caustically ironic text criticizes neoliberalism and contemporary society’s fascination with the economy and with business rhetoric.


Julie Châteauvert, community relations coordinator for DARE-DARE between 2007 and 2010, delivers a first-person account via flashbacks and spurts of indignation on how tension ran high while the Centre was stationed in Cabot Square.


Suzanne Paquet addresses the notions of invisibility and vacuum that characterized DARE-DARE’s fourth stay behind the JTI MacDonald factory. She puts forth the interesting concept of “blind spot” to characterize this area and time of transition.


Edith Brunette pursues her reflection upon forms of dominant discourse and the manner in which they represent the world by addressing cultural policies and their potentially insidious effect on creative environments.


Manon Tourigny, curator for the 2009, 2011 and 2013 editions of the VIVA! art action festival, examines the workings of artistic practices outside the gallery by artists selected by DARE-DARE.


Graphic Design : Design Denis Rioux

Publication Committee : Martin Dufrasne, Julie Fournier Lévesque, Frank Nobert, Valérie Perron, Denis Rioux and Manon Tourigny.


LIMITED EDITION BOX SET (left to right) : MONA SHARMA, DOMINIQUE PÉTRIN, FRANÇOIS LALUMIÈRE
(credits : Christian Bujold)
***

Sole physical keepsakes of DARE-DARE's run at each location, these books ensure the furtherance and perpetuity of its activities in research, creation and dissemination of art. Thinkers, artists and DARE-DARE members share their thoughts on a current-art centre’s infiltrations into a structure such as the city of Montréal, and report on spatial practices in unusual urban settings elsewhere in the world.


DIS/LOCATION 1 - Recipient of a Grafika Prize [2010]

The Viger Square, a sensitive spot in Montréal’s urban geography. For the authors of book 1 [artists, architects, sociologists, journalists], it was the starting point of a complex reflection on the connection between art and public space as they appear in their material and symbolic dimensions. [In French with English abstracts. Authors : Julie Boivin, Jean-Pierre Caissie, Jérôme Delgado, Raphaëlle de Groot, Marie-Suzanne Désilets, Louis Jacob, Fabien Loszach, Jean-François Prost, Armando Silva. Graphic Design: Design Denis Rioux.]


DIS/LOCATION 2

The theme “Of Fallibility and Failure” guided this reexamination of DARE-DARE’s experience and the projects presented at the park with no name (a piece of raw land under the Rosemont-Van Horne viaduct), highlighting the laboratory approach of the Centre. [French and English. Authors : Clara Bonnes, Susanne Bosch, Jean-Pierre Caissie, J.R. Carpenter, Marie-Suzanne Désilets and César Saëz, Ève Dorais, Pascal Nicolas-Le Strat, Valérie Perron, Dan Pitera. Graphic Design: Studio Tagteam.]



(credits : Jean-Maxime Dufresne)

***

Through Dis/location, DARE-DARE has established a unique framework for the research and dissemination of art, with a mandate to promote site-specific interventions and actions—performance and installation works that infiltrate public space. This urban exploration is achieved through consecutive medium-term stops around the city of Montréal, in spaces that elicit rich social and political, polemical enquiries. For this initiative, DARE-DARE was awarded and Orange Medal (environmental & urban planning) by Sauvons Montréal.


Book launch, September 12, 2015, at DARE-DARE's new location: the triangle bounded by Green and Atwater Avenues and Doré Street, in Montreal.

This new volume looks back on the 3 last locations of DARE-DARE’s mobile unit: Cabot Square, Walter-Stewart Park and the Quartier des spectacles. Five authors address various realities of artistic practices in public space, including instrumentalization, (in)visibility and the anti-spectacle. (in English)

AUTHORS
Martin Dufrasne, artistic coordinator for DARE-DARE, reflects in his preface on the philosophy that underpins the Dis/location project, and more specifically on the common thread that inspired this book.
Alain Deneault's caustically ironic text criticizes neoliberalism and contemporary society’s fascination with the economy and with business rhetoric.
Julie Châteauvert, community relations coordinator for DARE-DARE between 2007 and 2010, delivers a first-person account via flashbacks and spurts of indignation on how tension ran high while the Centre was stationed in Cabot Square.
Suzanne Paquet addresses the notions of invisibility and vacuum that characterized DARE-DARE’s fourth stay behind the JTI MacDonald factory. She puts forth the interesting concept of “blind spot” to characterize this area and time of transition. 
Edith Brunette pursues her reflection upon forms of dominant discourse and the manner in which they represent the world by addressing cultural policies and their potentially insidious effect on creative environments.
Manon Tourigny, curator for the 2009, 2011 and 2013 editions of the VIVA! art action festival, examines the workings of artistic practices outside the gallery by artists selected by DARE-DARE.

Graphic Design : Design Denis Rioux
Publication Committee : Martin Dufrasne, Julie Fournier Lévesque, Frank Nobert, Valérie Perron, Denis Rioux and Manon Tourigny.


LIMITED EDITION BOX SET (left to right) : MONA SHARMA, DOMINIQUE PÉTRIN, FRANÇOIS LALUMIÈRE

(credits : Christian Bujold)
***Sole physical keepsakes of DARE-DARE's run at each location, these books ensure the furtherance and perpetuity of its activities in research, creation and dissemination of art. Thinkers, artists and DARE-DARE members share their thoughts on a current-art centre’s infiltrations into a structure such as the city of Montréal, and report on spatial practices in unusual urban settings elsewhere in the world.
DIS/LOCATION 1 - Recipient of a Grafika Prize [2010]
The Viger Square, a sensitive spot in Montréal’s urban geography. For the authors of book 1 [artists, architects, sociologists, journalists], it was the starting point of a complex reflection on the connection between art and public space as they appear in their material and symbolic dimensions. [In
French with English abstracts. Authors :
Julie
Boivin, Jean-Pierre Caissie, Jérôme Delgado, Raphaëlle de Groot,
Marie-Suzanne Désilets, Louis Jacob, Fabien Loszach, Jean-François
Prost, Armando Silva. Graphic
Design:
Design Denis Rioux.]

DIS/LOCATION 2
The theme “Of Fallibility and Failure” guided this reexamination of DARE-DARE’s experience and the projects presented at the park with no name (a piece of raw land under the Rosemont-Van Horne viaduct), highlighting the laboratory approach of the Centre. [French and English. Authors :
Clara Bonnes, Susanne Bosch, Jean-Pierre Caissie, J.R. Carpenter, Marie-Suzanne Désilets and César Saëz, Ève Dorais, Pascal Nicolas-Le Strat, Valérie Perron, Dan Pitera. Graphic
Design: Studio Tagteam.]



(credits : Jean-Maxime Dufresne)

***Through Dis/location, DARE-DARE has established a unique framework for the research and dissemination of art, with a mandate to promote site-specific interventions and actions—performance and installation works that infiltrate public space. This urban exploration is achieved through consecutive medium-term stops around the city of Montréal, in spaces that elicit rich social and political, polemical enquiries. For this initiative, DARE-DARE was awarded and Orange Medal (environmental & urban planning) by Sauvons Montréal.


Book launch, September 12, 2015, at DARE-DARE's new location: the triangle bounded by Green and Atwater Avenues and Doré Street, in Montreal.

story:
The World's Largest Art Project for Charity Raising 10 million USD By Dec 2016


Hi we are Ashley & Filip from Peace Love & Photography. We are currently traveling around the World creating a documentary film and web series about the making of  "The World's Largest Art Project For Charity" with an aim of raising 10 million USD by Dec 2016.  We are not a charity rather are raising money for charity through selling art.  %100 of all money raised will go straight to charity. Our aim is to not only raise money for charity but to raise hope and to inspire our youth.  The project we need help fund is called ABCharity. 
 
ABCharity is the Alphabet made with thousands of children from around the World gathering together to form each letter shot from above. We will travel the World doing one letter per Country and will sell the letters as photo art in a limited edition. Companies and individuals will be able to buy their name when the whole production is complete and %100 of the money will go to straight to different charities. The first letter “A” took place in Cape Town on Blauberg Beach with 500 children and we have just completed the letter B in Namibia with 500 children on the Dunes. 
 
We are also producing a web series and documentary film about our journey called Peace Love & Photography where we have had over 30,000 + followers on facebook  and over 300,000 + views on our latest youtube clip. We produce all of the material you see on our site, including film, photos and editing with the exception of the day of our events when we have one extra photographer and cameraman on set. 
 
We have gained the support of Archbishop Desmond Tutu stating " Peace Love & Photography is a very important project and I hope they succeed." 

We have given up everything except two 30 kg backpacks to make this dream a reality. We are %100 self funding and need help so that we can continue completing the alphabet and raising 10 million USD. 

We need to raise money so that we may continue to Victoria Falls in Africa to do the letter "C" with hundres of children. Any Money left over will go to completing the remaining 26 letters of the Alphabet.

We need 5000 USD to create the next letter:

  • Transportation from Namibia to Victoria Falls
  • Transportation for 500 children to the Vic Falls from their Schools/Charity Organization
  • Giveaways for the children so that they have something that continues to inspire them from the day
  • Elevation to take the picture
  • Accommodation
  • 2 meals both Food & Drinks for 500 children for the one day event
  • Local entertainment for the children the day of the event
  • Food for Ashley & Filip
  • Medics on set for location 
  • Portable toilets if necessarry 
  • Toys (Beach Balls, Soccer Balls, Frisbees) for the children to play with 

You can see the video from the launch of the "A" on Blauberg Beach here : http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2ZGhTdYXi5I

The Impact

Our goal is to not only raise 10 million USD for charity by Dec 2016 but its to also raise hope and inspiration for todays youth. Our message to the youth as we travel is "Together we can make a difference"  and "We can our dreams come true" We have already seen great results from all of the children we have worked with. This is a project about kids helping kids to make a better future. 

Other Ways You Can Help

You can also help us by spreading the word, liking our facebook page, and following our journey. If you have a charity, a shool and would like to be involved please send us a message. We are always up for suggestion for significant locations in the World to visit please don't hesitate to contact us. 

Peace & Love & thank you so very much for your support

Ashley & Filip

story:
An Evolving Rainbow Project

Richart expresses; "To get any campaign going, you first have to get into action. Then everything starts coming together. Since I started this campaign to build a Rainbow Home, so many people have come to me wishing to be part of the project. Many people wish to support by offering their energy, time and use their skills and talents to make this dream come true! And so we now wish to build a Rainbow Community with Rainbow Homes."

Clear Vision

In October 2012, Richart had very clear and vivid detailed channelled visions of the Rainbow Homes and is now in the process of visualizing these 'dreams' so that they can be manifested into our co-creative shared reality on planet Earth.

Building Rainbow Homes

A Rainbow Home, is a way of life.  It is a consciousness that is spiritually fulfilling, socially just and environmentally sustainable. 

Why live in nature? 

In nature, we reconnect with the Universe, heal our energy faster and are naturally more open to other people. With a greater awareness of nature, we also become more conscious-minded about being responsible for this planet and our healing and happiness on it.  

Universally Co-Creating

The first Rainbow Home is going to be a showcase of what is possible when like-minded and open-hearted people work together on a global project. The final home will be powered by solar, wind and water energy. It will be made out of natural materials providing a safe, secure and comfortable place to rest and live.

Richart will be living in the Rainbow Home and be sharing his energy painting experience with you and basically being available to talk through ideas (online and face-to-face) about how to start building the Rainbow Community Homes. 

What We Wish For & What You Receive

The funds raised from this project will go towards purchasing the materials and renting the land to build the first Rainbow Home on the magical island of Ibiza in 2013. 

The cost of building and materials, plus taxes, insurance and delivery cost is USA Dollars 11,000. The price will also include 24/7, 365 days connection to the internet - Euro 56 per year. Plus Skype internal calling to landlines Euro 60 per year

Honestly, we have no idea how much this project will cost, but we certainly appreciate any funds that you wish to give us in support of building this new shared reality. 

In exchange for your valuable donations, you receive special perks only availble through this fund-raiser campaign, such a Guide for Living in a 5D Reality, or a personal hand-written 'Thank You' letter from Richart or get the opportunity to visit him at the Rainbow Home and learn more about the Rainbow Community and experience to joy of being touched by art. 

The Impact

By donating funds, You are giving more people the opportunity to experience the channelled visions of Richart and to live the eco-love-consciousness' dream in reality.

You also support in co-creating a permenant place where you can meet Richart and experience the blissful transformative experience of being touched by art. You are also ensuring that he has a secure and safe home, where he can interconnect with us all year either online, in-person or through meditative telepathy, supporting us in our spiritual awakening.

Because Richart is so appreciative of receiving financial support, any donation always brings in and enables so many more magical things to manifest in his life and all those in his environment. So your donation has a very powerful and positive effect immediately. 

People who receive his art therapy tend to laugh more! 

"Summer of Love" Film

In November 2012, the 'Summer of Love' movie trailer will be released to the world. This is a documentary, come movie, about the life and works of Richart and other like-minded heart people on the island of Ibiza. People who believe in the evolution of mankind for the betterment of humanity. So get ready, 2012 is just starting! 

And as Ghandi said, "Be the change, you want to see." 

Record of Achievement

http://www.healingibiza.com/therapists.html

http://www.touchedbyart.org/testimonials

http://www.mybesttreat.com/richartllover 

http://galacticawakeningandhealing.blogspot.com.es/2012/03/message-from-2022.html

http://www.ibiza-spotlight.com/news/2012/feel_more_than_fine_i.htm

http://www.interconnectedness111111.org/InterconnectednessFoundation.htm 

http://www.facebook.com/jossieavrats

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe you can help by providing the building materials for free or maybe you are an electrician, carpenter, illustrator or 3D designer and can support. Or as a loving person who wishes to support by offering a peace of land for free to support the building of this showcase home. Contributors will all have the opportunity to live in the home at different times.  

We appreciate your social skills too and if you are unable to make a financial contribution, then please feel free to support by spreading the word and sharing it with your close friends and family. Thank you. Your gift of love is very much appreciated.

story:
Preview of some of the gifts you will receive                                               

                                              Original paintings:

 
 

Prints:

 
Spoke Cards:

 

                                             Double your value now!

                           We have now 1:1 matching funds

                          from the East Bay Fund for Artists!!  


                 For every dollar you give here for the mural,

                                  La Peña will receive two! 

 

Our Story

In 1978, the Song of Unity mural was painted in the facade of our Berkeley building by a group of inimitable artists as the first 3D-collectively-painted mural in the Bay Area.  After years of exposure to the sun and weather, the original mural is in an unrepairable state. As a nonprofit organization, still committed to our mission of promoting peace, social justice and cultural understanding through the arts, education and community action, we have decided to invest in the future of La Peña by building a new mural with a new generation of politically conscious artists.

We have now a great opportunity to bring into the fold a new generation of leaders in their field. Trust Your Struggle (TYS) is an artist collective of visual artists, educators, and cultural workers dedicated to social justice and community activism through the medium of art. They have produced gallery installations, live paintings, murals and arts education workshops with youth and community organizations since 2003.  Some of the TYS muralists have been students of the original artists!

We need to raise $17,000 by July 1st so we can take down the old mural, purchase the materials, resurface the wall and pay artist fees and other related costs. Using new weatherproof and lighter materials and new special paints (Politech), Trust Your Struggle will create a 21st century mural that represents the concept that arts and culture can help cultivate social and political awareness and activism.

As for the original mural, it will be carefully dismantled and we are already exploring ideas for how it can be relocated to an interior space, preserving it as an historical East Bay landmark for future generations. We envision a day when you can visit La Peña and experience the transformation of our communities over a span of almost 40 years through the stories told within these two murals.   The murals are the different skins of our organization and they change as we change.

The Impact

Murals have the power to change communities:  once people see that they can change their visual environment, they see possibilities to change other things in their lives as well.  In this way, the legacy of La Peña, as a home and a hub for cultural activism continues with each new generation. Our new mural represents only one of the many recent changes.  Visit us online at La Peña to see what other changes we have undertaken (like renewing our lounge!).

What We Need & What You Get

We need to raise $17,000 for this to happen. The actual cost of removing and creating of a new mural is much higher, but we have matching seed funding from the Fleishhacker Foundation and the East Bay Fund for Artists.  These seed funds require that we raise matching dollars from many individuals like you. As a result, every dollar you give here is doubled in value!    We need to reach our funding goal by July 1st  so we can keep these seed funds and start working.   See the details of our budget in the PDF.

Other Ways You Can Help

Please help us getting the word out! Follow us on Twitter and like us on Facebook, check our Blog, tell your friends, spread the word!  La Peña needs yours and everybody’s help to write this new chapter of our history. This is also your personal story, the story of art and cultural activism in the Bay Area and beyond.

La Peña Cultural Center is a 501 c 3 charity.  If you do not have a PayPal account,  for tax-deductible donations of $500 or above, please contact us at (510) 849-2568 or email Nicolás Cabrera at: nico[at]lapena.org  so we can help you with your contribution.

story:
MudFaery Ménagerie

 

The grand opening is scheduled for 12/12/12 and I sincerely need funding for some key things to be in place!!

The new video is up and there is a more full write up of this project at

www.mudfaery.com 

under Mudfaery Ménagerie.

 Ménagerie:   A diverse or eclectic collection of wild animals, people or things.

I am Amira, collector of eclectic creations and this is my Ménagerie.

The work has begun to turn a lovely little shop in the middle of town into an enchanted forest of creativity and curosity and learning and such.  

The vision for Mudfaery Ménagerie is a creative, inspiring adventure.  

The shop is being converted into an enchanted forest.  

Imagine walking down a street full of shops.  All of a sudden, there is a forest coming out of a doorway.  

You walk inside and there are beautiful treasures from a diverse range of artists.  There is a faery playing a harp behind the counter.  Or sculpting.  Or painting.  Or felting.

You look around and on the walls you see forests full of creatures that you have never seen. And enchanting paintings.   And on beautiful driftwood displays, Sculpture, Pottery, Magical light boxes, Felt art, Painting, Leather art, Shamanic drums and other beautiful creations.  Hanging from tree branches, creatures and lights made of felt and paper.  At the counter, carvings from Kauri gum, beautiful jewelry, and glass art.  And on the shelf, Faery books and books about enchanted realms.

It is more than a gallery. It is an experience.

Mudfaery Ménagerie is the culmination of many dreams I have had for a long time.  I have permission to create whatever I like in this space.  And blessings to be there as long as I like.  Meaning, this Menagerie may be a fixture in town for decades.  There is also a beautiful back garden lawn space where I can install sculptures and a studio.  As well has hold events.

I plan to teach Felt classes, art lessons, and Vocal lessions from this space.  I plan to have storytelling sessions with my harp for the public.  As well as many other visions.

 

I have the space.  I have the vision.  I have the team to make it happen.  And the energy to make this flow.  I need help with the funding.  There are some key things that I need for opening.  

In New Zealand, we are nearing summer.  In Takaka, where I live, we have  over a hundred thousand people come through for a few months, as we have two of the most famous national park walks in our region.  I need to open in December to catch this summer crowd.  Please help me to do this!!

I greatly appreciate all support with this!  The faeries will send you many blessings! And so will I!

For the longer version of information on this project, go to www.mudfaery.com. And look for the posts about Mudfaery Menagerie.

 

   ****New offering...All pledges will also receive a surprise wee handmade gift with their pledge.  Regardless of amount of pledge.

I am Amira, collector of eclectic creations and this is my Ménagerie.
The work has begun to turn a lovely little shop in the middle of town into an enchanted forest of creativity and curosity and learning and such.  
The vision for Mudfaery Ménagerie is a creative, inspiring adventure.  
The shop is being converted into an enchanted forest.  
Imagine walking down a street full of shops.  All of a sudden, there is a forest coming out of a doorway.  
You walk inside and there are beautiful treasures from a diverse range of artists.  There is a faery playing a harp behind the counter.  Or sculpting.  Or painting.  Or felting.
You look around and on the walls you see forests full of creatures that you have never seen. And enchanting paintings.   And on beautiful driftwood displays, Sculpture, Pottery, Magical light boxes, Felt art, Painting, Leather art, Shamanic drums and other beautiful creations.  Hanging from tree branches, creatures and lights made of felt and paper.  At the counter, carvings from Kauri gum, beautiful jewelry, and glass art.  And on the shelf, Faery books and books about enchanted realms.
It is more than a gallery. It is an experience.
Mudfaery Ménagerie is the culmination of many dreams I have had for a long time.  I have permission to create whatever I like in this space.  And blessings to be there as long as I like.  Meaning, this Menagerie may be a fixture in town for decades.  There is also a beautiful back garden lawn space where I can install sculptures and a studio.  As well has hold events.
I plan to teach Felt classes, art lessons, and Vocal lessions from this space.  I plan to have storytelling sessions with my harp for the public.  As well as many other visions.
 
I have the space.  I have the vision.  I have the team to make it happen.  And the energy to make this flow.  I need help with the funding.  There are some key things that I need for opening.  
In New Zealand, we are nearing summer.  In Takaka, where I live, we have  over a hundred thousand people come through for a few months, as we have two of the most famous national park walks in our region.  I need to open in December to catch this summer crowd.  Please help me to do this!!
I greatly appreciate all support with this!  The faeries will send you many blessings! And so will I!
For the longer version of information on this project, go to www.mudfaery.com. And look for the posts about Mudfaery Menagerie.
 
   ****New offering...All pledges will also receive a surprise wee handmade gift with their pledge.  Regardless of amount of pledge.

story:
UPDATE:

 The RAW art show was a success!   ALL MONEY donated to Indiegogo is now going to "Art with Heart."  

If we meet the $600 before our fundraiser deadline, I'll increase the goal.  Let's see how much we can give to this great organization!

 

UPDATE #1:  ✔  The ticket requirements of the art show have been met. Anyone seeking to support me (the artist) are still welcome to buy tickets, but donations for Art with Heart are preferrable.  Please make donations here.

FOR ME AND FOR THEM

For the first time since graduating, I have the opportunity to do an art show with my photography.  My photography and film are what keep me going every day, so having an opportunity to share it is exciting...but expensive.

I will be showing at the RAW |Ensemble art show on Saturday, September 8th, at the Trinity Nightclub in Seattle, but I need help to cover the costs of the show.  Tickets are $11 in advance and $15 at the door.  There will be prints of my work at my booth.  Beyond that, I hope to raise money for Art with Heart, a group which provides resources for art therapy for kids with special health and emotional needs.

As much as I am excited to let the world see my work-- (well, Seattle, mostly)- I'd like to make it a valuable experience for more than just me.  Enter "Art With Heart."   They are an organization based here in Seattle, Washington that provide supplies and programs to high-risk children.

So any profit I make off this show, I want to give to them.  This is a group I could have benefited greatly from as a youth, so I want to help them endure now.

 

FROM THEIR WEBSITE:

"Art with Heart helps kids through the healing power of creativity.

We do that through the creation and distribution of our therapeutic books and supportive trainings for caregivers to help children dealing with the stress and strain of hardship.

Our books combine engaging art with therapies that help youth cope with overwhelming feelings even in the midst of a crisis. In this way, Art with Heart supports their emotional and social growth, paving the way for success in school and in life.

 


WHAT I NEED - MET ✔

I need to cover the costs of the show which is $600.  If we reach that, any additional money from tickets and prints will go to "Art With Heart," AND I can extend the goal to collect more money for "Art with Heart."

 

SHOW: - COMPLETE ✔

When: September 8th at 8pm to 10:30pm
Where:  Trinity Nightclub at 111 Yessler Way, Pioneer Square, Seattle, WA
Why:  To introduce artists of the Seattle area

Tickets are $11 in advance, $15 at the door.  Available here: http://www.rawartists.org/seattle/ensemble/?artist=71908

Any people outside of the Seattle area who cannot attend but would like to help can purchase tickets as a donation as well.  The cost of 20 tickets covers my booth fee, so any tickets over that go into the donation pool.  

As of August 27th the minimum ticket requirement is met! 

 

 

WHAT YOU GET!

You are not only going to be helping to support an independent artist so I can reach out and network to a larger group of people that can help me further my art...BUT, you are contributing to an organization that helps kids with special needs...the sort of special needs often overlooked...the needs of the heart and the mind.

Obviously, the more you can give the more you are helping the kids who benefit from the programs at "Art with Heart" and you'll get a thank you gift too.

 

THE IMPACT

Any tickets sold after the required minimum of 20 (twenty), purchased by people who cannot attend, plus profits from print sales will be donated to "Art With Heart."  (Their information is here: artwithheart.org)

I plan to make the donation to them by November 1st.  This way, people can continue to donate after the show.  It takes about 2 wks for Indiegogo to process donations and send money, so the deadline is Oct 15th.

 

 

OTHER WAYS YOU CAN HELP

If you can't afford to donate, can't attend the show, but would still like to help out please spread the word to others who might be in a financial position to help.

You could offer perks/give aways of your own, people love one-of-a-kind stuff!

Or you can skip me all together and just donate to "Art With Heart" directly.  I won't be offended, I swear.  

 

A blurb about who I am:

“Carissa Starr can weave an entire tale in a single still frame, bringing a cinematic eye and a gift for storytelling together in art that is at once dark, intense, whimsical and playful.  She captures images which both provoke the viewer and invite them to bring something of themselves to the slice of the story they see.  From portraiture to fantasy, from photojournalism to nothing less than visual poetry, her work challenges and inspires the viewer in ways they will remember long after leaving the gallery.” - Josef Stremick, American author and musician

 

 

 

*perk reward dates are approx.  Anything later than the stated date, you will be notified.  An email will be sent to those receiving perks with an option of print image within the week following the fundraiser deadline.

story:
Murals at Minnesota's Crossroads

Community engagement. Bridging cultural divides. Economic development. Beautiful art. These are the goals of Midway Murals, an exciting new project made possible late last year when Jonathan Oppenheimer, the project leader, was selected as one of the winners of the John S. and James L. Knight Foundation's Knight Arts Challenge Saint Paul. 

Our vision is to bring four remarkably talented public artists together with immigrant business owners and Hamline Midway neighborhood residents, gather their stories through community conversations, and then change the face of St. Paul through four incredible murals along Snelling Avenue.

Keep the contributions coming!

Midway Murals was awarded a $25,000 matching grant from the Knight Foundation, meaning we had to raise matching dollars to receive the full grant. We did it on April 1 with more than 50 hours to spare! But please keep the donations coming. This campaign was to match the grant, but we still have over $20,000 left to raise to complete the project, and your donations are still tax-deductible. Reaching this goal has set us on strong footing to raise the remaining funds – from individuals, foundations, businesses, and corporations – for the fourth and final mural.

Nearly all of the money we are raising will be used to buy high quality materials and to pay our artists the wages they deserve for the hundreds of hours required to produce murals of this scale.

The Artists

The theme of the murals is "starting anew," and the muralists -- Lori Greene, Yuya Negishi, Greta McLain, and Eric Mattheis -- will craft their designs by hearing from local residents and immigrant business owners and asking them the same guiding questions: 

  • Where are you from and what do you call home? 
  • Where are you going and what are your hopes and dreams for the future? 
  • How do you describe your culture, identity and community?

Each artist brings a different approach, aesthetic, and background to the project, but each is committed to the same goal of engaging with the community to make it stronger, more deeply connected, and more firmly rooted in the great city of Saint Paul and the wonderful Hamline Midway neighborhood.


Other Ways You Can Help

We recognize that giving money is not in the cards for many people, but this project is for everyone to share in its glory, regardless of whether or not you can make a monetary contribution. For everyone, we ask that you:

  • Continue to provide feedback and suggestions for how we can best carry out the project by visiting the "Contact" page on our website.
  • Share this page with your friends and family, tell them why you think it's a great project, and ask for their support.
  • Come out to our events if you're in town, say hi, and be a part of the project. Find all of the event information on our website.
The Midway Murals team thanks you all so much for your support.

If you have questions, please contact Jonathan Oppenheimer at jonathan@midwaymurals.com
