story:
Bonjour! (*English below*)

Moi c'est Caroline. Je dessine. Beaucoup. 

Je dessine depuis que je suis toute petite. Partout où je vais, je traîne mon cahier, ma plume et mes couleurs. Je dessine des gens, amis ou inconnus, dans des lieux publics.

Vous pouvez voir des exemples de mes dessins sur ce blogue et sur Instagram.

Je suis maintenant prête à passer aux choses sérieuses. 

Le projet: illustrer un livre à Istanbul

Tassia écrit. Beaucoup. 

Elle est l'auteure des oeuvres semi-autobiographiques Judas (Éd. Leméac, 2007, 142 p.) et Mère-Grand (Éd. Leméac, 2010, 134 p.; finaliste prix du Gouverneur général 2010). Elle est Montréalaise, mais habite depuis deux ans à Istanbul, où elle travaille à son troisième roman et vit avec l'homme qui est devenu son mari. 

Tassia et moi on s'était rencontrées il y a 6 ans chez des amis. On est devenues amies Facebook, et, petit à petit, admiratrices mutuelles. Moi de ses histoires, elle de mes dessins. On s'est dit, en riant, que je pourrais illustrer ses histoires. Et puis on a arrêté de rire et on s'est dit qu'en fait c'était une bonne idée pour vrai. On s'est même découvert une adoration commune pour les carnets de voyage de Joann Sfar. Les étoiles étaient alignées.

Tassia avait finalement trouvé son illustratrice pour le projet de livre qu'elle dorlotait depuis longtemps:

Un livre illustré, qui, inspiré de sa propre expérience d'écrivaine explorant la vie quotidienne de ses personnages, aurait pour arrière-plan sa nouvelle ville adorée: Istanbul. 

Le plan: grâce à votre soutien, je pars à Istanbul pour un mois, en novembre. Tassia me montre son Istanbul. On se promène, on observe. Elle écrit, je dessine.

Puis on met tout ça ensemble et on présente le projet à des éditeurs. 

Où ira votre argent et ce que je vous offre en échange 

En gros, ça coûte des sous se concentrer sur un projet de dessin pendant un mois. En commandant un dessin (voir options à droite), vous m'aiderez à mettre toutes mes énergies sur ce projet magnifique. Et vous contribuerez un peu aussi à me mettre de la pression pour faire les plus beaux dessins que je puisse faire.

Peu importe ce que vous choisirez, votre nom apparaîtra dans les remerciements du livre, et vous serez bien sûr invité(e) au lancement. 

Soutenir le projet en partageant

Pas d'argent? Pas de problème. Faites rouler les outils de partage que vous trouverez sous la vidéo : 

Partagez sur Facebook. Partagez sur Twitter. Parlez-en à vos amis et à votre famille.  

Ça peut sembler anodin, mais ça compte pour beaucoup : plus le projet gagnera en intérêt, plus il nous sera facile de convaincre les meilleures maisons d'édition que notre livre se mérite un espace de choix dans votre bibliothèque.  

-

Merci infiniment de votre soutien. Vraiment. C'est un projet qui me tient beaucoup à coeur et je suis heureuse que vous y participiez. J'ai hâte de vous inviter au lancement. 

Caroline


Caroline et Tassia


*ENGLISH*

Hi! I'm Caroline. I draw. A lot. 

Drawing is something I've always done. Everywhere I go, I take my sketchbook, my pen and my watercolour kit. I draw people, friends or strangers, usually in public places.

You can see examples of my work on this blog and on Instagram.

Now it's time to take it to the next level. 

The perfect opportunity: Illustrate a book about Istanbul

Tassia writes. A lot. 

She has published two semi-autobiographical works of fiction (Judas, Éd. Leméac, 2007, 142 p.; Mère-Grand, Éd. Leméac, 2010, 134 p. -- Governor General Award Finalist) and is now working on her third novel in Istanbul, living with the man who has become her husband. 

We met six years ago at a party (she's from Montreal). We became Facebook friends, and, little by little, mutual fans. She of my drawings, I of her stories. We got joking about me illustrating them. Then we stopped laughing and realizedit was actually a fantastic idea. So we plotted, Skyped, and it was decided. I would come join her in Istanbul and make this happen. 

She had been pondering an travelogue-type illustrated book project for some time. She has found her illustrator.

What we aim to do is present a series of illustrated snippets of daily life in Istanbul, as a backdrop for Tassia's own and experience as a Montreal writer exploring the lives of her characters.  

I've drawn-and-traveled quite a bit, but never been to Istanbul. I'm excited. 

The basic concept: thanks to your support, I get to Istanbul in November, and stay there for a month. Tassia writes, I draw.  

Then we present our book project to editors, and get it published. 

This is my chance to step up my game, and you can help me make it happen. 

What I need money for and what you get in exchange

In a nutshell, leaving for a month to concentrate on a drawing project requires a bit of resources. By ordering a drawing (see options on the right), you will be helping me focus all of my energies on making sure I am doing the absolute best I can. Hello, peer-pressure.  

And whatever you contribute, your name will appear on the special thanks of the book, and you will definitely be invited to the book launch.

Other ways you can help

No money? No problem. Use the link under the video: Share on Facebook. Share on Twitter. Tell your friends. 

Everything helps: the more you share, the easier it will be to convince the best editors that this book deserves a spot on your bookshelf. 

-

Thank you so much for your support. It really means a lot to me. And I can't wait to invite you all to the book launch.

Love, 

Caroline

story:
Van Art Project 

In 2012, The First Annual Van Art Project was designed to respond to the psychological needs of the local women and children after an earthquake hit the area hard. Working in close partnership with a local women's organization, VAKAD (Van Woman's Association), the Van Art Project offered daily directive based groups that focused on therapeutic art making and psycho-education throughout the week of July 2-6, 2012. 
Although the earthquake’s life altering consequences were evident in the area, another ongoing issue quickly surfaced during the Van Art Project: interfamilial and domestic violence. It appeared that the prior trauma prominent in the area resurfaced and became more apparent with the subsequent trauma of the earthquake. 
 
In July 2013, The Van Art Project is returning to Van and aims to promote resiliency, provide the participating women and children with sense of safety, self-efficacy, containment and stabilization to help them cope with their everyday lives. 
 
In light of the incidents taking place in Turkey right now the importance of our project as Van Art Project Team become much more evident:
 
We are going (back) to Van, Turkey to plant the seeds for raising a generation that will have an alternative language to violence.  CONTRIBUTE TO OUR PROJECT IN ANY WAY YOU CAN AND PLAY A CRUCIAL ROLE IN THE CHANGE ! 

 

Our Team 


Leyla Akca, MPS, Art Therapist, Project Organizer

Leyla was born and raised in İstanbul, Turkey. She pursued her undergraduate and graduate education in United States. Leyla has clinical and professional experience in working with children, adolescents and adults with myriad needs including but not limited to developmental disabilities, mental illness, substance abuse, and trauma.
Leyla is passionate to engage people in creative activities, thinking through art, and verbal therapy. A strong believer in the benefits of art therapy, she is hoping to utilize the art making process as a vehicle for healing, communication, self-expression and personal growth in Van for many more years to come.


Samantha Tomao, MPS, Art Therapist, Assistant Organizer

Samantha is an art therapist who has clinical experience in working with various populations, some of with include: children with developmental disabilities,, trauma, immigrant/families, chemical addiction and mental illness.
Along with international work, like The Van Art Project, Samantha has traveled to Costa Rica in 2011 as part of an art therapy project and worked with local children to help establish a sense of community, foster healthy interpersonal communication, and raise self-esteem.

 

Ashley Dorr, MA, ATR-BC, LCAT, Art Therapist, Project Supervisor

Ashley specializes in art therapy as a means to heal psychological trauma. She has worked with child refugees and amputees from Sierra Leone, children affected by the September 11th World Trade Center attacks and in Sri Lanka with children orphaned by ethnic war, poverty, and the 2005 Tsunami. She served as a faculty member for the ArtReach Foundation, a program that provides global training for teachers and caregivers in areas of war, poverty, and natural disaster, working in the Middle East and has facilitated workshops with Lebanese teachers in Greece and with Jordanian, Iraqi and Palestinian teachers and caretakers in Jordan. In 2010, as a United States Cultural Envoy, she facilitated art therapy workshops for women, children, and caretakers as part of a special project sponsored by the US Embassy in Amman, Jordan.

 

Zeynep Kocaoğlu, MA, Movement Specialist Psychologist, Assistant Organizer & Turkey Liaison

Zeynep was born and raised in İstanbul, Turkey. She pursued her undergraduate and graduate education in United States and returned to İstanbul in 2011. Zeynep is experienced in working with children with developmental disabilities and is currently working with adults with mental illness by providing dance movement therapy groups at İstanbul University Medical School (ÇAPA) Hospital, a major public and teaching hospitals in İstanbul. Zeynep is continuing her graduate level education for Clinical Child Psychology at İstanbul Bilgi University. 

 

What We Need & Where Your Contriburions Are Going:

The Van Art Project is a volunteer based project and is made possible through generous donations of many individuals and organizations. 

While we are most grateful for any and all donations that we receive, there are still several expenses that must be covered. With the great work that we are doing in Van also comes a huge task: To raise enough money to make the 2nd annual Van Art Project Workshop even more successful and sustainable than last year!

Times are difficult for all of us right now, especially the people of Van who are still recovering. If there is any amount of money you could donate to help this worthy cause, the Van Art Project and the people of Van would be extremely appreciative.

We are hoping to raise a grand total of $ 20,000 for the project some of these expeses are thankfully covered by our amazing donors such as Turkish Philanthropy Funds, we are hoping to get $5,000 through Indiegogo donations. Please note that donations are tax deductible thanks to our fiscal sponsor, Sanat Psikoterapileri Derneği (Art Psychotherapy Foundation). As you may know fiscalsponsorship does not provide us with funds, it only provides us with the means to receive the funds with a public interest and tax exemption status. The tax number for Sanat Psikoterapileri Derneği is 7430417432. Their website is http://www.sanatpsikoterapileridernegi.org

This is the small list of essential expenses that we are hoping to raise donations for:

Airfare to Van, Turkey for our team of Art Therapists and Psychologists: $ 5,000

Art supplies for the children and women of Van, including but not limited to markers, oil pastels, crayons, scissors, paper, glue, canvas bags, fabric markers, fabric, yarn : $ 2,500

Housing and Food for Van Art Project Team: $3,000


Again, we realize that you may not be in the position to donate to this cause. If that’s the case, words of encouragement will go a long way and are much appreciated! Also please don't forget to use the Indiegogo share tools and spread the word...

However, if you are able to donate even just $5, every little bit will help! (But it’s ok for you to donate more than $5, too!)

Our goal is to raise this money by June 24, as the Van Art Project team will be flying to Van, Turkey in early July, 2013.
story_txt:
Van Art Project 
In 2012, The First Annual Van Art Project was designed to respond to the psychological needs of the local women and children after an earthquake hit the area hard. Working in close partnership with a local women's organization, VAKAD (Van Woman's Association), the Van Art Project offered daily directive based groups that focused on therapeutic art making and psycho-education throughout the week of July 2-6, 2012. 
Although the earthquake’s life altering consequences were evident in the area, another ongoing issue quickly surfaced during the Van Art Project: interfamilial and domestic violence. It appeared that the prior trauma prominent in the area resurfaced and became more apparent with the subsequent trauma of the earthquake. 
 
In July 2013, The Van Art Project is returning to Van and aims to promote resiliency, provide the participating women and children with sense of safety, self-efficacy, containment and stabilization to help them cope with their everyday lives. 
 
In light of the incidents taking place in Turkey right now the importance of our project as Van Art Project Team become much more evident:
 

We are going (back) to Van, Turkey to plant the seeds for raising a generation that will have an alternative language to violence.  CONTRIBUTE TO OUR PROJECT IN ANY WAY YOU CAN AND PLAY A CRUCIAL ROLE IN THE CHANGE !

story:
Project Goal

What is it like when the soul is slammed out of the body and is incompletely returned?

My name is Paulina Borsook, and I'm a writer living in Santa Cruz, California. In 1968, when I was fourteen years old, I was shot in the head with a Colt .45 from a distance of six feet.

Almost two million people in the United States experience traumatic brain injury (TBI) every year, but not much is said or written about what it feels like from the inside to live ever after with some of the consequences of TBI.

My Life as a Ghost is an art project about certain aspects of TBI, encompassing film, installation, literature, and performance. The project was born from my own experience with TBI, triggered by a handgun left cocked and loaded in a kitchen drawer.

A month-long research residency at Stanford University in the fall of 2013 will help lay a foundation for the project and will include a performance and workshop.

The goal of this campaign is to raise $5,000 for the phase of the project that comes afterwards.

About This Project

My own TBI was one of those medical miracles, the kind where the person should not have survived, much less remained able to walk and talk. A .45 slug is as big as a someone's thumb—and all the bullet did was fracture my jaw, blow out a portion of my skull, go through two walls, and lodge in a brick fireplace.

Pasadena, the artist's home, before the world was shattered


The medical science of the time didn't understand that TBI can have all kinds of subtle emotional and cognitive consequences. That I was still alive and apparently just like the person I was before was all that anyone could see.

But there were long-term consequences and impairments. The strangest and most illuminating after-effect—the one that most profoundly raises questions about what it means to be human and alive—is this: that ever after that gunshot wound, I was never entirely sure if I should be here, on this earth, in this life.

The scene of the crime


I had to figure out this most profound of alienations from my own life on my own. At the time, there was no medical or cultural guidance to be had. I discovered from the inside out that this alienation was a neurological artifact and not a character flaw.

This permanent uncertainty about being in the world and in one's own body is not unique to me. Other people with TBI also live with this ghostliness every day of their post-injury lives. Yet unlike many people with TBI, I still have powers of articulation. This project therefore feels like something I have been uniquely called to do.

My Life as a Ghost will capture and make manifest this state of not-really-being-here-but-here. It will pose questions about what is brain and what is mind and what is spirit.


Portrait of the artist, 1968, painted by her friend, Billy Blakely


How the Money Will Be Spent

The most important element of My Life as a Ghost will be a walk-through installation rather like the pilgrim's way or the experience one has walking through a cathedral. As in a cathedral over here might be a lady chapel and over there a memorial to the dead of the Crimean War; so in My Life as a Ghost, there will be different stations that evoke different modes of TBI Ghostliness.  Stagecraft and visual art will be involved.

But My Life as a Ghost can't just be about me. The experiences of other TBI Ghosts need to be captured in interviews that will be filmed with great light, footage that will be theatrical rather than documentary. The filmed documentation of TBI Ghost gestures, anecdotes, and metaphors will shape and inform the project.

So with this campaign, I hope to fund the filming and editing of the initial round of interviews with TBI Ghosts and produce a short demo reel of these interviews. The demo reel will be used in subsequent phases of the project.

This campaign will also fund startup costs, such as IT infrastructure and printing. Any contributions raised beyond the campaign goal will be applied to subsequent phases of the project. 

All donors at every level will be listed on the project website.

Other Ways You Can Help


Another sketch by the artist's friend Billy, to cheer her up in the hospital


Many people are interested in TBI or know someone affected by TBI: parents of children who play sports; first responders; present or former members of the military or law enforcement; people interested in neuroscience; pastors, chaplains, and others interested in the inner life; people who cycle or dive or motocross or surf or skateboard or ski; healthcare professionals and therapists; people interested in mindfulness and mind-body problems; victims of gang-related or domestic violence; people who care for or about someone with TBI.

Let them know about the project.

More information can be found on the project website, www.mylifeasaghost.org.

Comments and updates can be found on the project's Facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/mylifeasaghost.


Affiche of some surviving ephemera. (The artist is third from left, top row)

Comments and updates can be found on the project's Facebook page, https://www.facebook.com/mylifeasaghost.

story:
Thank you indiegogo supporters!!!

Inspired by Chekhov's The Seagull with elements of Ginsberg's Kaddish, BirdShit is a multimedia performance piece that combines theater, dance, video, live and pre-recorded music, and a few surprise elements. 

BirdShit has been commandeered by artist and musician, Nina Ljeti, choreographer, Chloe Kernaghan, and NYU Graduate Film students Joshua Richards, Zach Kershberg and Tine Thomasen, under the guidance of James Franco.

Two performances will take place in New York City on April 7th. 

Your contributions have helped fund this spectacular collaboration.  Here are just a few things that your donations are being used for:

-THE PROJECTORS   In order to utilize our unique performance space, we need big, bright, beautiful projectors to do this. Those are expensive! Additionally, we need a switcher board and wonderful, specially trained operators to make it all work together.

-THE STAGE  Another special element to this performance is our stage. The stage will be made of plexiglass so that we can film our dancers and action from below. Additionally we have to transport the plexiglass to and from the performance space.

-CREW FEES  We cannot make this show happen without a lovely crew behind it--projectionists, wardrobe designers, lighting designers, sound designers.

We cannot thank you enough for your support and help spreading the word.  We look forward to updating you with our progress.

story:
CleverLand with DustFish Burning Man 2018

CleverLand is a multidimensional mutant vehicle featuring four levels composed of nine performance stages, a four-story viewing platform, and state of the art special effects including sound engineering, LED light shows, fire effects, vibrational healings, ziplines, and more! Additionally, CleverLand will shift into a connection platform contributing a superabundance of actors, musicians, performing artist, motivational speakers, and further civic applications to be experienced. This project will be a vehicle in sharing open source art, applied sciences, alternative energies, building practices, innovative engineering, and manufacturing techniques to share how self-sustaining communities may thrive in a new world!

 

Building Process

Design

The walls of the ship will consist of pop out panels for side seating and impromptu stages with a 3rd-floor electronic door opening system, an elevator platform, portal windows, overhead electric crane, and a rear porch deck. Once in place, the exterior will be finished with riveted armored cladding to embody a mutated vessel. The 1st-floor interior is a remodeled bus featuring lounge, wardrobe, shower. The 2nd-floor interior will feature stained-wood paneling draped in fabrics and upholstery to mimic the old time feel of a carriage or train car. The 3rd-floor interior will be glazed in a speckled polyurea to resemble the depth of a starfaux. Last but not least, the 4th-floor interior will be furnished as an illustrious penthouse with a viewing deck observatory fit for a cosmonaut of the highest caliber.

Construction

To create this innovation chamber, our team has fabricated modular galactic shield made up of steel frames, composite insulation, exterior metal cladding, and metal armoring. Autonomous functionality, electric winches, and wiring will be installed to each shield and then secured by stabilizer trussing and tensioning webbing.

Lighting & Sound

CleverLand will be illuminated with 250 meters of LEDs throughout the interior and exterior of the bus serving as full body running lights. DMX lighting will be rigged onto the roof to provide light effects to the main stage and surrounding area to create a captivating environment. Dustfish will be providing a seven thousand watt pro-audio sound system with a variety of live, high vibrational sound guaranteed to titillate participant’s ears throughout Black Rock City.

 

Inspiration and Message

The CleverLand engineers aim to push the limits of applied science to transform old world ideas with mental & mechanical properties and modern compositions to accelerate the incubation of next-generation technologies which hold potential to change the world! To cultivate this awakening our crew will sync science, art, connection, and self-expression as CleverLand to be shared both on and off playa.

 

How Would YOU Make an Impact

This project has been constructed to 65% completion, yet we need your help raising 45K for construction materials and transportation to make CleverLand a reality! We have a stretch goal of 60K to create additional special effects to be enjoyed at Burning Man and to assist with fees taken out by Indiegogo.

Your donations will help us secure the following resources for Burning Man 2018:

  • Marley flooring & roll up removable performance matting
  • Semi-trailer flatbed w/ air brakes
  • 12 sheets of expanded metal for stairs, catwalks, and control room
  • 50 sheets of  48”x 120” aluminum sheet metal
  • Structural stage trussing for lighting and ariel performances
  • 1” & 2” steel wall tubing for metal art garden and climbing points
  • UV treated Cordura and sail shading
  • 70 yards of fabric, tapestry, and curtains for interior and stage decor
  • 28 sheets of 48”x 96” of ¼ inch plywood for wood paneling in the bar and lounge area
  • 25 sheets of 48”x 96”1-inch plywood for exterior tongue in groove flooring
  • Steel hand railing for multiple floors
  • 250 meters of LED lighting strips with controllers
  • 210 lbs of 35mm Welding Wire
  • 1,800 cubic feet of CO2 argon gas
  • Hardware including bolts, rivets, and hinges
  • Equipment: Ground leveling stands & 10,000 lb electric hoist
  • Electricity for completing the CleverLand stage
  • Vehicle maintenance and improvements
  • Transportation for CleverLand to and from Burning Man

You can also help by sharing CleverLand and its campaign with others! If you would like to connect with our team, please reach out via our CleverLand Facebook page or our CleverLand Instagram profile.

 

Call for Participation

Want to find another way to support this project? Are you skilled in welding, fabrication, foam insulating, metal taping, lighting, sewing, agriculture, gardening, or cooking? Would you like to exercise and expand these gifts?!

On July 7th-8th, CleverLand will be hosting a build weekend in Dobbins, CA. Make and shake with us for Fourth of July weekend! For more details contact <cbronson@zygosys.com>.

 

Team

Lead Engineer: Maximus Willhammer

Contributors/Crew:

Chelsea Bronson - Fundraising & Communications

Erik Bleyle - Production Facilitator

Robert Leggoe - Logistics & Build Crew

Opal Essence - Elder of Dustfish

 

SEE YOU AT BURNING MAN 2018 and THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

For more details contact <cbronson@zygosys.com>. TeamLead Engineer: Maximus WillhammerContributors/Crew:Chelsea Bronson - Fundraising & CommunicationsErik Bleyle - Production FacilitatorRobert Leggoe - Logistics & Build CrewOpal Essence - Elder of Dustfish SEE YOU AT BURNING MAN 2018 and THANK YOU FOR YOUR SUPPORT!

story:
1.About me

Good day.

 I am GashibokA. I'm an old fan of Mlp:fim, and I have a cartoon called Recall the Time of No Return.

if you want to see my comic, click it.

2. About Everfree Tarot

<Everfree Tarot> is designed to satisfy both fans of traditional TV shows and tarot card collectors. So it was similar to the style of the TV show, but I added artistry by painting a little more antique. In addition, I took the concept of 'Unknown History' and put a completely new story on each card. This story is not an official history, but if you like conspiracy theories, you can enjoy new fun by reading the enclosed guidebooklet.

 

3. Is this a Official stories?

Absolutely no. just look at the Devil card. This is inadequate to become an official story.

 

4. there is so many races. why?

Policy Correctness? hah. kindding. I wanted to say that Equestria is not for ponies only. There are many tribes living in this land, each with its own story. It will make the world view more abundant.

 

4. I want to know the specifications of the thing.

​

70mm * 121mm

Indigo Snow White 250g/㎡

non-glossy coated surface

full color (CMYK)

 

5. what is the booklet?

If you visit my Deviatart site and see the card image, you will find that there is a sentence written in Korean under it. In the booklet, the Korean Description will be supplemented and translated with the image. It is essential for those who use this card for psychic purposes.

 

6. Did you consider making it include Main 6?

yes I was.

 but Hasbro is a copyright monster. I scared....

story:
The Zelart Scholarship

Hi, my name is James 'Grim' Desborough. I'm an author and roleplaying game designer from the UK, with my own small press publisher, Postmortem Studios. I run the Zelart Scholarship in memory of my friend and collaborator, 'Zel'.

Zel was an artist I worked with and helped through his education. We met through friends and formed a strong working relationship together. We made card games together and he provided illustrations for several of my gaming books. I got a great sense of satisfaction from helping a young, budding artist through school and watching his talent blossom.

Sadly, Zel was killed in an accident before I got to see him fully achieve his artistic potential or the success he so richly deserved.

Casting about for something I could do to commemorate him, I remembered how we had met, how the work I gave him had helped him so much and how good it had felt to nurture that talent. The best way to remember Zel, I felt, was to do the same for others.

In my day to day work I do what I can, deliberately seeking out young, marginalised, disabled, unemployed, homeless and other disadvantaged artists to give them a leg up, money and help in getting the attention of the RPG and publishing community to get them into more regular work.

The Zelart scholarship is a natural extension of this. A way to hunt out and promote new talent and to give them a lump sum of cash to smooth their way. 

What We Need & What You Get

We sell Zel's back catalogue of stock art, along with donated artworks and the artwork of past winners to raise funds over the year and supplement that with what we can raise via this fundraiser. This isn't about selling a product to you, but what you get out of it is more, reasonably priced stock art, a way to nurture new artists and a warm sense of self-satisfaction.

Whatever money we get will go to the scholarship winner, if we raise a great deal over and above our target we may institute second or third tier awards. Whatever we raise will go to artists.

Risks & Challenges

It can be challenging to find people both to sponsor and to enter into this scholarship. Previous years this has proven very challenging. Whatever you can do to spread the word to potential sponsors, donators and entrants is greatly appreciated.

Other Ways You Can Help

Besides a contribution, you can help out in many other ways.

Are you a young artist or an artist suffering from reduced circumstances? Then enter!

Are an artist who is doing OK for themselves and has some spare personal pieces they don't mind being sold to support this enterprise? You can donate art!

Do you know a young artist or an artist who needs the money due to disability, unemployment or other issues? Tell them about it!

story:
Drawing of the hero

 

We are incredibly passionate about telling the stories of the people who served and still serve in the Royal Navy. Our goal is to keep their memory alive and enable the generations of people to learn about them and be inspired by them.

As part of our preparations for the Battle of Jutland centenary commemorations next year, we purchased a very unique large charcoal drawing of boy hero Jack Cornwell, who was only 16-years-old when he died fighting for his country in the battle.

 

 

Image: NMRN Archives

Bearing mortal wounds and awaiting orders, Jack remained at his post on his ship HMS Chester. He died shortly after the battle but his courage was recognised when he was awarded a Victoria Cross medal posthumously for honourable conduct. 

His story touched the hearts of the nation, which demanded that he be re-buried with full naval honours.

 

 

 

Image: Jack Cornwell-Funeral, Courtesy of Newham Heritage Service

The drawing of Jack by Frank O.Salisbury is a 271 x 151.5 cm large preparatory charcoal and pastel sketch which is in a very poor and fragile state and in need of serious conservation.

We want Jack’s story to live on and to capture people’s hearts once more. Your contributions will help us to restore the drawing, which will form the centrepiece at the world’s largest Battle of Jutland exhibition in May 2016 at Portsmouth Historic Dockyard.

If, like us, you feel it is important to remember young heroes like Jack and want to be involved in ensuring his story is not forgotten, and inspire future generations, then please support our campaign.

 

Funding Goal and Perks

 

 

We need to raise £25,000 to cover the costs of the restoration, framing, transport and other campaign-related costs and fees.

To show our appreciation for your support we have prepared a very unique set of perks which include:

£5 -  A specially designed thank-you graphic with your name on our Twitter account @NatMuseumRN

£10-  A thank you video from the crowdfunding team and published on our Facebook page.

£25 - A ticket to the world's largest Battle of Jutland exhibition at Portsmouth Historic Dockyard, opening May 2016

£100 - A limited edition postcard featuring the Jack Cornwell charcoal and pastel sketch and a ticket to the world's  largest Battle of Jutland exhibition at Portsmouth Historic Dockyard, opening May 2016

£250 -  A replica of the Victoria Cross medal with the Naval Ribbon - the same style as Jack Cornwell was awarded, a ticket to the world's largest Battle of Jutland exhibition at the Portsmouth Historic Dockyard, opening May 2016 and a limited edition postcard featuring the Jack Cornwell charcoal and pastel sketch.

£500 - Your name on the Donor Wall in the world's largest Battle of Jutland exhibition at Portsmouth Historic Dockyard, opening May 2016, a limited edition postcard featuring the Jack Cornwell charcoal and pastel sketch and a ticket to the Battle of Jutland exhibition.

£1,000 - An invitation to the VIP launch of the Battle of Jutland exhibition in May 2016, a tour of the exhibition, 2 tickets to the exhibition and a limited edition postcard featuring the Jack Cornwell pastel and charcoal sketch, for two people.

£1,500 - An invitation to the VIP launch of the Battle of Jutland exhibition in May 2016, a tour of the exhibition, your name on the Donor Wall, 2 tickets to the exhibition and a limited edition postcard featuring the Jack Cornwell pastel and charcoal sketch, for two people.

 

 

The Impact

 

 

You only need look at our first crowdfunding campaign to get an idea of just how big an impact they can have. We raised £9,236 to help preserve First World War ship HMS M.33, the only remaining Royal Navy survivor of the Gallipoli Campaign. The money raised was crucial in contributing to the opening of this unique attraction, which has already been visited by more than 42,000 people.

Now, we want to make an even bigger impact with our Jack Cornwell campaign. 

  • Emotional and Inspirational

Jack’s story inspires people. It did in 1916 when the nation came together to demand his re-burial and when they raised money for a fund, established in his name, which in turn sponsored a ward for wounded and disabled sailors at the Star and Garter Home in Richmond.

 

 

Image: Courtesy of Grimsby Fishing Heritage Centre

The Scout Association has introduced a Jack Cornwell Badge which is awarded ‘in respect of pre-eminently high character and devotion to duty, together with great courage and endurance’.

Those who train to be in the Royal Navy at the HMS Raleigh training establishment in Plymouth know all about Jack Cornwell. Raleigh has a New Entry Division named after Cornwell and VIPs are taken to view the painting of him after Passing Out Parades every year – Jack’s story and its importance is explained by the Captain. The picture hangs in the Church of England Church, on view for everyone to see.

 

  • Historical

Jack’s courage is part of a bigger historical story – the Battle of Jutland, the largest naval battle in the First World War. Our centenary commemorations will help to bring alive the stories of those who fought.

  • Artistic

As a preparatory sketch, Salisbury’s drawing was not really meant to last a very long time. It is therefore very unique to have a piece of artwork that is nearly 100-years-old accessible for all to see.

 

 

More about Jack

 

The 16-year-old boy hero John Travers Cornwell VC, known as Jack Cornwell or Boy Cornwell, was one of the youngest people to take part in the Battle of Jutland in 1916. He was also the youngest to receive the Victoria Cross, a medal awarded for ‘most conspicuous bravery, or some daring or pre-eminent act of valour or self-sacrifice’.

 

 

 

Image: NMRN Archives

Standing alone in an exposed position on HMS Chester, with fatally-wounded crew members around him, Jack remained at his post until he received orders, despite steel splinters penetrating his chest shortly before he died.

 

 

 

 

Image: NMRN Archives

Jack was one of the youngest people to join the Royal Navy. His heroism and demeanour have touched many hearts and after an initial common burial, his body was exhumed and he was publicly re-buried with full naval honours.

School children from around the nation each donated a penny of their pocket money to The Jack Cornwell Memorial Fund, which was established to finance a ward for disabled sailors, the Star and Garter Home, at Richmond. An impressive amount of £18,000 was raised, which, based on an historic inflation calculator, is equivalent to £1,653,224.45 today.

 

 

Image: Courtesy of Marine Society and Sea Cadets

More About The Drawing 

 

To keep Jack's memory alive, in 1917, one of the great society artists of his time, Frank O. Salisbury (British, 1874-1962) painted a famous portrait of him called 'John Cornwell, V.C., on H.M.S. Chester’. 

We are very privileged to have acquired the very first large preparatory charcoal and pastel sketch  of this painting. Unfortunately, the 271 x 151.5 cm drawing is in a very poor and fragile state and cannot currently be shown to the public.

The famous Frank O. Salisbury painting of Jack Cornwell  is located at the Naval Training Establishment HMS Raleigh in Plymouth.

Other Ways You Can Help

 

Spread the word! You can make a big impact even without making a direct financial contribution. Every post or tweet about our campaign will allow more people to learn about it and possibly reach those who would like to support it as well!

You can find all the social media share buttons on the top left of this page.

In early 2016, we will be launching a new exciting app which will allow you to upload photos and information related to your Jutland ancestors to a huge online map, which will be available on our website and in our Battle of Jutland exhibition. The app will also allow you to browse the information on the people of the Battle of Jutland uploaded by other users, making it a big collaborative experience. To register for more information, and have the chance to be one of the first to try it out, please email webmaster@nmrn.org.uk

story:
Short Summary

Contributors fund ideas they can be passionate about and to people they trust. Here are some things to do in this section:

  • Introduce yourself and your background.
  • Briefly describe your campaign and why it's important to you.
  • Express the magnitude of what contributors will help you achieve.

Remember, keep it concise, yet personal. Ask yourself: if someone stopped reading here would they be ready to make a contribution?

What We Need & What You Get

Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know how the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!   And that's all there is to it.

story:
Poetry, electronic music and photography is my way of processing and sharing my personal challenges in my life so you may find you are not alone, and see hope even in the darkest of times. It takes a lot of courage to expose myself as openly and honestly as I do, and it helps me as well as others who face similar challenges.

The books and albums I have published are my way to share what I have been through and to move on in my life and to the next creative project I have envisioned.  The creative process from concept to release of something has been therapeutic for me in many ways.

I do this not for the money, but to share with the afflicted who still suffer, friends and family to better get to know me.  The money helps cover the basic costs to do what I could not finance myself.

More and more people are able to engage my work and I would love to share more than just a song or poem at a time, but the body of my work covering the span of a lifetime with all the ups and downs along the way.  It’s about broad strokes, seasons, and chapters.  It about so many different pieces coming together in a life shared over time to chronicle recovery.

The purpose is to carry my message to people who can can benefit from my personal life struggles and achievements; to install hope in the hopeless.  This much content is certainly a challenge to share in traditional ways.

Here is an idea about how to make it possible and I would love your help!

I want to create custom USB drives with my website logo on them and preload my books and albums.  This way people will gain access to my Life’s Work and can follow up on my website and blog as I continue to share my journey www.tavius.org.

Will you help support my vision and help fund the purchase of a minimum order 100 custom USB drives?

Each and every donation is truly appreciated : )

A donation of $20 buys three custom USB drives! 

For donating $20, I will receive one of the USB drives. You not only have access to all my work, but also a cool USB drive for extra storage! 

For donating $30, you could choose a custom Tavius.org tee shirt, some of which are in the gallery images on this page (others can be seen at Tavius.org).

If you are able to contribute $50 or more, you will also receive a custom Tavius.org tee-shirt of your choice (see some on the gallery images of this page) as well as a fully loaded USB drive!

Thank you for your support in sharing and donating for this campaign.

This is an experiment in new ways of sharing art and exploration about how art can affect our lives.  I think it is important to support artists, especially trying new things to advance art as we know it : )

about how art can affect our lives.  I
think it is important to support artists, especially trying new things to
advance art as we know it : )

story:
Hey there folks, my name is Arielle Hill. I’m the heart and art behind Peach Seas.
I’ve been passionate about creativity all my life.  As I grew, I traded in my sketchbooks for digital art and my beloved tablet. This creative drive and a healthy fondness for video games lead me to attend Full Sail University pursuing Computer Animation.  Degree in-hand I returned home with hopes of one day utilizing my artistic skill set as a profession.  However for all my budding knowledge fresh out of college, I still lacked enough personal confidence to enter the gaming industry.

Instead I found myself working a job in the shipping (and later marketing) department of a local online retailer.  I had experienced everything from order fulfillment to manufacturing in the three years I worked there which sparked a new personal aspiration… With the generous support of my mother, Julie, along with my personal savings I would launch my own brand as a platform to satisfy my creative needs and provide myself a sustainable income in the process.  I began simply with the brand’s name, landing on a phrase that combined two things I love - Peach (my favorite color) + Seas (representing my adoration of ocean life after growing up near the beaches and estuaries of Southwest Florida).  This trend of blending two themes became the blueprint for our Peach Seas boutiques and soon the Drellie Garden was established!



Drellies are dragons born with the appearance of their favorite food, sort of a fun nod to camouflage in the natural world.  These creatures are the merging of my love for dragons and interest in plant life, as they are modeled after fruit.  Since 2013 the Garden has steadily grown to include 24 Fruit Drellie characters featured in a range of products including my favorite, PLUSH!  **Fun Fact, the term Drellie came from fusing the word Dragon with my name.
Considering our limited capacity for funding and storage along with my desire for variety, I developed the following practical Plush Plan to bring each of these 24 Drellies to life :

Drellie Jumbo Plush
I wanted these to be BIG and crazy huggable, therefore we could only produce a few due to limited space and costly production.  We chose the following 4 characters based on popularity to feature as Jumbos : Dragonfruit, Avocado, Watermelon, and Pineapple.

Drellie Belly Plush
These would be smaller, still cuddly, but more expressive; featuring an array of eye styles to convey emotion.  We chose the following 8 characters to feature as Bellies : Cantaloupe, Cherry, Peach, Mango, Lychee, Coconut, Strawberry, and Pineberry.

Drellie Bite Plush
This miniature style would allow us to feasibly produce the remainder of our Fruit Drellie hoard.  And thus the final 12 characters were paired up according to their best buddies to be featured as Bites : Banana & Blackberry, Orange & Blueberry, Raspberry & Kiwi, Lime & Lemon, Red & Green Apple, and White & Purple Grape.



Over the years we’ve done our best to save up and personally fund each new endeavor, plush or otherwise, for Peach Seas.  The downside to this method is the sluggish pace we must trudge to breathe life into new and exciting merchandise.  It can take well over a year to save up the kind of dough it takes to finance a project as expensive as plush manufacturing.  Although slow and steady progress coincides with our easy going approach to life and business we’ve begun to turn things up a notch, releasing 4 new plush this year alone!  This recent change of pace has been exhilarating and we’re eager to keep up the momentum.  This is where you come in!  We need your help to keep the ball rollin’ as we focus efforts on our next plush project, the Drellie Bites.

“GIVE US THE DEETS ON THOSE PRECIOUS PLUSH!”
Our Drellie Bites are made of a super soft minky fabric filled with plastic pellets giving the plush a weighted and satisfying texture to fidget with in your fingers.  These little plush are approximately 3” long, 2” wide, 1.75” tall, and suspended from a 3” elastic chord.  The Egg Capsule (only available through the Drellie Bite Dozen perk) is made of plastic approximately 7” tall and 5” wide with a removable clear top and solid white bottom.  The Drellie Bites are wonderful accessories for your backpack, office desk, suitcase, ball-jointed doll, purse, fruit basket, mobile game-console case, and even your car rear-view mirror!  They would also make an impressive and unique stocking stuffer this holiday season ;)

“OK, I’M SOLD!  WHAT’S THE SKINNY ON THIS CAMPAIGN?”
As you may have noticed, we’ve finalized the prototypes for these plush.  Now all that’s left is to fund production.  As you may not know, we’ve already accumulated enough money on our own to fund half the Drellie Bites!  Our savings will fund the designs from Batch #1 ( Orange, Blueberry, Raspberry, Kiwi, Banana, & Blackberry ) which will go into production on July 15th.  The $15,000 goal we need your help to raise here on IndieGoGo will fund the remaining 6 Drellie Bite designs from Batch #2 ( Lemon, Lime, Purple Grape, White Grape, Red Apple, & Green Apple ) as well as the Egg Capsules that will hold a full set of Drellie Bites.

EARLY BIRD BITES  •  $ 11 + Shipping

First come first serve adoption rate of 26% OFF for a pair of Drellie Bites.  6 pairs of best friends to choose from ( more info on Drellie selection below ) !
LIMITED QUANTITY

DRELLIE BITES  •  $ 14 + Shipping

Adopt a pair of Drellie Bites at this IndieGoGo exclusive rate.  6 pairs of best friends to choose from ( more info on Drellie selection below ) !
*IndieGoGo Exclusive Rate - A pair of Drellie Bites will be sold at their standard rate of $15 after this campaign.

DRELLIE BITES 1/2 DOZEN  •  $ 40 + Shipping

Won’t be satisfied with 2 Drellies?  Then how about 6!?  Kickstart your collection and save $5 by adopting 3 pairs of Drellie Bites.  6 pairs of best friends to choose from ( more info on Drellie selection below ) !

DRELLIE BITE DOZEN  •  $ 60 + Shipping

Satisfy your crazy cravings for cuteness with the ultimate fruit-loving dragon bundle, our Drellie Bite Dozen.  Adopt the full set of 12 Drellie Bites at this IndieGoGo exclusive rate and receive the irresistible Egg Capsule to showcase these designer treasures!  *IndieGoGo Exclusive Rate - The Drellie Bite Dozen will be sold at it’s standard rate of $70 after this campaign.  NOTE : Purchasing this perk is the only way to access the charming Egg Capsule!

DRELLIE BITES WHOLESALE  •  $ 600

Attention indie lovin’ shop owners - Now’s your chance to help support a fellow entrepreneur and reserve our Drellie Bites for resale in your booth or boutique!  Perk includes 15 sets of our 6 Drellie Bite pairs.  Contact me at Arielle@PeachSeas.com if you’re interested in carrying these charming plush as Drellie Bite Dozens within the Egg Capsule.  LIMITED QUANTITY

“I CAN ONLY SELECT BATCH 1 OR 2, BUT NOT THE SPECIFIC PAIR I DESIRE.”
Due to IndieGoGo's 5 option limit ( where we need 6 ) in the item creation for perks, we decided the best workaround would be to have you choose from the Batches for now.  Once the campaign has ended we'll contact you directly to verify which Drellie Bite pairs you're adopting.  My sincerest apologies for this inconvenience  >__<

“SWEET, SO WHY THE FLEXIBLE GOAL?”
It’s all about the momentum!  We want to release these plush altogether, not staggered over the agonizing course of years while we slowly build the funds ourselves - as we’ve had to do with past plush projects.  No matter the result of this campaign, we WILL be producing all 12 of the Drellie Bites.  If we can reach our goal with your support then we can have the full Drellie Bite clutch ready and shipped to you by the end of October, skyrocketing our YTD plush releases to 16!  IndieGoGo’s Flexible Goal option will allow us to keep all funds raised and put them directly towards production of the Batch #2 designs and Egg Capsule should we fail to reach our $15,000 goal.

“BUT WHAT IF I ORDERED FROM BATCH #2 OR THE FULL SET AND WE DON’T REACH THE GOAL?”
Not to worry folks, as stated above, we WILL be adding all 12 Drellie Bites to our catalog eventually, it’s only a matter of time.  If we are unable to reach the goal we’ll be putting all funds raised here towards production of Batch #2 and the Egg Capsule, while slowly saving up additional funds from our online and conventions sales until we can cover the remainder of the $15,000 goal.  However, this process could take up to an additional year before we can finish funding and get your order shipped, depending of course upon how much more funding is needed once the campaign has ended.  Please keep this in mind while contributing to the Drellie Bite Plush campaign.  If you want your order to arrive by the estimated October 2018 delivery date, you must only order from the Batch #1 options of either the “Early Bird Bites”, “Drellie Bites”, or “Drellie Bites 1/2 Dozen” perks, as those are the only guaranteed designs, regardless of the outcome for this campaign.  Otherwise if you’re dedicated enough to wait if need be, then your contribution serves as a reservation for the perks you’ve ordered.  We’ll be in close contact with you throughout the entire process and your Drellie Bites will ship to you as soon as they’re available :)

“WHY NOT FUND NEW JUMBOS OR BELLIES INSTEAD?”
We felt the Drellie Bites were the best fit from our Drellie Garden Plush Plan for a crowd funding campaign.  The size of our Bite design means lower production and shipping costs, even though the need to produce 12 variations collectively increases those costs beyond what a few Drellie Belly or single Drellie Jumbo plush campaign would require.  We believe the combination of affordable perks and plush variety that only the Drellie Bites can facilitate will help motivate enough support for this campaign to succeed.  Additionally the Drellie Belly and Drellie Jumbo plush are already represented in our catalog, so we’d like to focus on releasing a new style first.  Having greater variety in plush and price points for our Drellie Garden boutique on the website and at our booth should help us save money faster to put back into funding the remaining Belly and Jumbo designs.

“WAIT, I CAN'T ORDER THE BITES INDIVIDUALLY - WHY ARE THEY PAIRED?”
Life’s always better with a friend.  Spend less time fretting over which adorable dragon to adopt and more time fawning over twice the Drellie goodness!



We’ve successfully manufactured 11 plush designs since launching Peach Seas.  So as far as the plush production aspect of this campaign is concerned, we’re beyond confident in our ability to bring you the high quality, one-of-a-kind products you’re salivating over.  As long as you’ve fully read through this campaign and pledge responsibly, understanding the meaning of our Flexible Goal, then there is no risk to you.  The only foreseeable challenge of this campaign will be the time and hard work we’ll be putting into action when it comes time for order fulfillment.  However rest assured we’ll be in close communication with you during and after the campaign.  We got this guys, and if worse comes to worse, we’ll do everything in our power to make it right by you.  You are our heroes!  We appreciate your support to the ends of the universe and would never take advantage of your generosity.

Thank you for your time and consideration.

 

Cheers,
Arielle Hill

Creator / Artist / Dingus of Peach Seas

story:
What is The Kalon Project?

Kalon by definition means “beauty that is more than skin deep.” That idea is exactly what we want to portray with this audio and visual art exhibition.

We have discovered 22 amazing stories of people from around our community that has given us hope, admiration, and love. We now feel compelled to share those stories with the world.

The Kalon Project will dive deep and share the struggles and darkness that these people have gone through and how it has made these beautiful souls who they are today.

We want to present an art exhibit, like no other. One that showcases these 22 inspirational stories in a new light! At the end of 22 weeks, we will share 22 stories in a large art exhibition. Our community will come together and be able to view this compilation of all these very different and painful journeys that all end with perseverance. They’ll share their story with you on how they overcame these difficulties in life to only become stronger in the end.

The topics that people will share their stories on include: overcoming depression, the life of a cancer survivor, attempted suicide, life after rape, divorce, battling a drug and alcohol addiction, having a miscarriage, dealing with anxiety and self love, bullying, homosexuality, domestic abuse, being a parent to a transgender child, living with a life-altering disease, life with an eating disorder, growing up with a parent that’s different than other parents, raising a child with disability, guiding a body positive movement, life as a veteran, and the loss of a loved one including, a parent losing their child to cancer, a fiancé tragically passing away two-months before their wedding, a sister losing her brother to suicide, and a daughter losing her parent at a young and influential age.

Did you know that from ages 10-24 the second leading cause of death is suicide? And that 20 veterans commit suicide EVERY day? It breaks our hearts to report 15-20 percent of all women with a verified pregnancy will end up having a miscarriage. And that 1.3 million women are raped in the U.S. each year.

We want our community to come together to view and share the experiences of these very different and painful journeys that all end with perseverance and how they became stronger in the end.

Founder of The Kalon Project, Jillian Gunlicks is mom to 8-year-old, Rylin, and a Sioux Falls native who is an advocate for change.

As of late, Jillian has felt extremely compelled to do something greater that will have a profound impact on those within the Sioux Falls community, and hopefully one day, beyond. Enter the initial idea of The Kalon Project. Jillian is someone who has triumphed over her own hardships and felt compelled to share her story, along with the other 21 amazing stories, in hopes to help others see they are not alone with whatever they are dealing with. 

Being a local artist, it was obvious that she would use art as a medium to share these stories. Jillian had the inspiration, but was unsure where to start. She describes that she had this perpetual intuition to reach out to co-founder of The Kalon Project, Chelsea Tracy.

Chelsea Tracy is a young Sioux Falls entrepreneur. Owner of Chelsea’s Boutique, Style by Chelsea, and co-owner of Conversation Piece, Chelsea has a passion for empowering women and making a difference within the community. Also feeling called to do something bigger, Chelsea and Jillian got together where Jillian shared the idea of The Kalon Project and Chelsea was immediately on board.

Wondering why 22 stories? The angel number for 22 says it reminds you to listen to your intuition and to follow your heart. Both of which will guide you in the direction of your life purpose and your highest possible path. Intuition is ultimately what led Jillian and Chelsea to one another so it only made sense to them that they choose the number 22.

Both women hope this project will make a heartfelt difference in the lives of men and women of all ages, races and religions. Our hope is to inspire and bring to fruition the light that is in each and every one of us.

What We Need & What You Get

We are looking to raise a minimum of $15,000 for The Kalon Project. However, the more we raise, the more we can do with this project. We have dreams of taking this project to high schools, coffee shops, businesses or any other place across the country that this type of inspiration needs to be seen. Inspiration that is filled with love, light and hope

 

What the minimum of $15,000 is going towards:

 

Audio

  • We want you to be completely immersed into each of these 22 stories. Along with viewing each of these beautiful souls portraits, (photograph, paint or charcoal) you’ll plug in and be able to hear each amazing story told in their own voice, a song that resonated with them during their trials, or a poem or song they have written on their own.
  • To allow you to listen to this, we will need to create an app that everyone who attends can download on their phone the night of the event. Part of your donation will go towards the development of creating this app as well the cost to provide headphones to everyone attending the exhibit.

Print/Visual

  • Just like the audio piece of this project, the visual component of The Kalon Project is of utter importance. Jillian will be doing a charcoal print or portrait painting, or we will have a local photographer capture each of the 22 people after they have shared their story, which will be displayed and revealed the night of the exhibit. To ensure we present this to you in the most beautiful way possible, part of your donation will help fund the cost of materials for creating and framing these pieces of art. Items such as canvases, brushes, paints as well as covering the cost of the artists time to create the artwork.

Venue

  • We want the space we share these impactful 22 stories and display the final artwork that goes along with them be in a place where we feel as if they can be received in a profound way. In a place where people can feel comfortable, and get the full Kalon Project experience. The Museum Of Visual Materials in Sioux Falls will allow us to do just that. Part of your donation will go towards covering the cost of the renting out this beautiful space.

Behind the Scenes

  • The Kalon Project is something that we hope to take beyond the South Dakota state lines and we want to capture the essence of this project and all the work is going to be put into it. Part of your donation will allow us to hire a professional videographer to capture all the moments leading up to the final project, as well as the night of the reveal. We want to capture interviews and the small moments during those interviews as well as the live paintings and the reactions of the storytellers hearing their story and seeing their artwork for the first time. Moments like these will allow us to show what The Kalon Project truly is.

 

These are the things that $15,000 will allow us to do.

 

We see The Kalon Project becoming a traveling exhibition. We want to bring this project to high schools, middle schools, colleges, businesses, coffee shops and even one day, sold out stadiums. We also see this project turning into an interactive book. A book of the end product complete with stories, images, and an audiobook of the raw interview recordings. We would also love to see The Kalon Project inspiring people around the country by having inspiration filled billboards, bus stop seats, and any other type of medium that will spread inspiration in a moment where someone may truly need it.

We would LOVE to see The Kalon Project be so much bigger and anything over $15,000 will help us to move towards the end goal of having this be a project that takes off worldwide.

And we need you along for the ride.

And of course, we don’t want you to be the only one giving! To say thank you for believing in our project,  we want to give back to YOU! - Be sure to check out our amazing perks! 

The Impact

I think we can all agree that what the world needs now is LOVE. We need the people in this community and across the world to know that they are not alone with anything they may be going through. We want this to be an inspiring exhibit that is filled with love, light, and hope. We want these 22 stories to be the voices for anyone out there who feel voiceless.

With your help, we can do just that.

Other Ways You Can Help

Maybe The Kalon Project isn’t something you are financially able to support right now, but there are still plenty of other ways you can help!

Help us spread the word about The Kalon Project!

Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thekalonproject22/

Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thekalonproject/

Share our Kalon Project video: https://youtu.be/C7fPYcRCWSw​

Share our website: TheKalonProject.com

Share our Indiegogo page

Our community will come together and be able to view this compilation of all these very different and painful journeys that all end with perseverance. They’ll share their story with you on how they overcame these difficulties in life to only become stronger in the end.
The topics that people will share their stories on include: overcoming depression, the life of a cancer survivor, attempted suicide, life after rape, divorce, battling a drug and alcohol addiction, having a miscarriage, dealing with anxiety and self love, bullying, homosexuality, domestic abuse, being a parent to a transgender child, living with a life-altering disease, life with an eating disorder, growing up with a parent that’s different than other parents, raising a child with disability, guiding a body positive movement, life as a veteran, and the loss of a loved one including, a parent losing their child to cancer, a fiancé tragically passing away two-months before their wedding, a sister losing her brother to suicide, and a daughter losing her parent at a young and influential age.
Did you know that from ages 10-24 the second leading cause of death is suicide? And that 20 veterans commit suicide EVERY day? It breaks our hearts to report 15-20 percent of all women with a verified pregnancy will end up having a miscarriage. And that 1.3 million women are raped in the U.S. each year.
We want our community to come together to view and share the experiences of these very different and painful journeys that all end with perseverance and how they became stronger in the end.

Founder of The Kalon Project, Jillian Gunlicks is mom to 8-year-old, Rylin, and a Sioux Falls native who is an advocate for change.
As of late, Jillian has felt extremely compelled to do something greater that will have a profound impact on those within the Sioux Falls community, and hopefully one day, beyond. Enter the initial idea of The Kalon Project. Jillian is someone who has triumphed over her own hardships and felt compelled to share her story, along with the other 21 amazing stories, in hopes to help others see they are not alone with whatever they are dealing with. 

Being a local artist, it was obvious that she would use art as a medium to share these stories. Jillian had the inspiration, but was unsure where to start. She describes that she had this perpetual intuition to reach out to co-founder of The Kalon Project, Chelsea Tracy.
Chelsea Tracy is a young Sioux Falls entrepreneur. Owner of Chelsea’s Boutique, Style by Chelsea, and co-owner of Conversation Piece, Chelsea has a passion for empowering women and making a difference within the community. Also feeling called to do something bigger, Chelsea and Jillian got together where Jillian shared the idea of The Kalon Project and Chelsea was immediately on board.
Wondering why 22 stories? The angel number for 22 says it reminds you to listen to your intuition and to follow your heart. Both of which will guide you in the direction of your life purpose and your highest possible path. Intuition is ultimately what led Jillian and Chelsea to one another so it only made sense to them that they choose the number 22.
Both women hope this project will make a heartfelt difference in the lives of men and women of all ages, races and religions. Our hope is to inspire and bring to fruition the light that is in each and every one of us.
What We Need & What You Get
We are looking to raise a minimum of $15,000 for The Kalon Project. However, the more we raise, the more we can do with this project. We have dreams of taking this project to high schools, coffee shops, businesses or any other place across the country that this type of inspiration needs to be seen. Inspiration that is filled with love, light and hope
 
What the minimum of $15,000 is going towards:
 
Audio

We want you to be completely immersed into each of these 22 stories. Along with viewing each of these beautiful souls portraits, (photograph, paint or charcoal) you’ll plug in and be able to hear each amazing story told in their own voice, a song that resonated with them during their trials, or a poem or song they have written on their own.
To allow you to listen to this, we will need to create an app that everyone who attends can download on their phone the night of the event. Part of your donation will go towards the development of creating this app as well the cost to provide headphones to everyone attending the exhibit.

Print/Visual
Just like the audio piece of this project, the visual component of The Kalon Project is of utter importance. Jillian will be doing a charcoal print or portrait painting, or we will have a local photographer capture each of the 22 people after they have shared their story, which will be displayed and revealed the night of the exhibit. To ensure we present this to you in the most beautiful way possible, part of your donation will help fund the cost of materials for creating and framing these pieces of art. Items such as canvases, brushes, paints as well as covering the cost of the artists time to create the artwork.
Venue
We want the space we share these impactful 22 stories and display the final artwork that goes along with them be in a place where we feel as if they can be received in a profound way. In a place where people can feel comfortable, and get the full Kalon Project experience. The Museum Of Visual Materials in Sioux Falls will allow us to do just that. Part of your donation will go towards covering the cost of the renting out this beautiful space.
Behind the Scenes

The Kalon Project is something that we hope to take beyond the South Dakota state lines and we want to capture the essence of this project and all the work is going to be put into it. Part of your donation will allow us to hire a professional videographer to capture all the moments leading up to the final project, as well as the night of the reveal. We want to capture interviews and the small moments during those interviews as well as the live paintings and the reactions of the storytellers hearing their story and seeing their artwork for the first time. Moments like these will allow us to show what The Kalon Project truly is.
 
These are the things that $15,000 will allow us to do.
 
We see The Kalon Project becoming a traveling exhibition. We want to bring this project to high schools, middle schools, colleges, businesses, coffee shops and even one day, sold out stadiums. We also see this project turning into an interactive book. A book of the end product complete with stories, images, and an audiobook of the raw interview recordings. We would also love to see The Kalon Project inspiring people around the country by having inspiration filled billboards, bus stop seats, and any other type of medium that will spread inspiration in a moment where someone may truly need it.
We would LOVE to see The Kalon Project be so much bigger and anything over $15,000 will help us to move towards the end goal of having this be a project that takes off worldwide.
And we need you along for the ride.
And of course, we don’t want you to be the only one giving! To say thank you for believing in our project,  we want to give back to YOU! - Be sure to check out our amazing perks! 
The Impact
I think we can all agree that what the world needs now is LOVE. We need the people in this community and across the world to know that they are not alone with anything they may be going through. We want this to be an inspiring exhibit that is filled with love, light, and hope. We want these 22 stories to be the voices for anyone out there who feel voiceless.
With your help, we can do just that.
Other Ways You Can Help
Maybe The Kalon Project isn’t something you are financially able to support right now, but there are still plenty of other ways you can help!
Help us spread the word about The Kalon Project!
Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/thekalonproject22/
Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/thekalonproject/
Share our Kalon Project video: https://youtu.be/C7fPYcRCWSw​
Share our website: TheKalonProject.com
Share our Indiegogo page

story:
Hi everyone!

Thanks for coming to support me

To make a 2021 calendar will be a lot of work but im more than happy to do it for my fans!

Sorry its taken so long to have gotten this up and going but im finally on the mend from my breast augmentation and am ready to be in front of the camera again.  Ive reached out to a lot of my past photographers and layout artists and ive gotten the total I need to hire them so we can make a wonderful 2021 compendium for you to keep you company all year with high quality photos and amazing layouts.  

If I dont hit the goal, it wont happen as I only work with the best people for any project, but once its reached anything over that is pretty much just a direct order really.  your "perks" are really just your preorder of the item(s). 

I really appreciate all of you wanting to see this from me and I hope to not disappoint.  

Everything in there will be 100% artistic and all my style.

story:
In Eﬀort Group we are touched by the spirit of Christmas all year round. That is why, on this occasion, we want to do something big and very special. We are going to launch a campaign to connect people. People seeking employment, people who provide it, people who, in a disinterested way, want you to get it. In conclusion, people who love each other.

With everybody’s effort, we have created a channel to make your dreams come true. The dreams of those who want to give the best of themselves on the job, the dreams of those who want to discover people who take their companies to the top, the dreams of those who want to do something good for others and are looking for something unique.

 PARTICIPATE!

With you we will finance 15 jobs for 15 people. Opening the doors of their future together, it will also serve as momentum for companies that need these people to grow. Take part!!!

The best speech of your life will be the example of your actions. I know that even at times you wonder what kind of person you are or what kind of person you can become. Well, I can tell that you are the kind of person that the world needs and I want to thank you, in advance, for being a positive inﬂuence to the world.
Javier Iriondo, Where your Dreams Take you.

Objective

Our goal is to cover the 15 jobs we will put at the disposal of SMEs for free, we hope to reach our goal, what is certain is that fundraising total will be allocated to this end.

Other ways in which you can help

Your collaboration is essential, if you want to get in touch with us 

tequieromequieres@grupoeffort.com


En Grupo Eﬀort  estamos tocados por el espíritu de la Navidad todo el año. Por eso, en esta ocasión, queremos hacer algo grande y muy especial. Vamos a poner en marcha una campaña para conectar personas. Personas que buscan empleo, personas que lo ofrecen, personas que, de manera desinteresada, quieren que lo consigas. En deﬁnitiva, personas que se quieren.


Con el esfuerzo de todos creamos un canal para hacer realidad tus sueños. Los sueños de los que quieren dar lo mejor de sí mismos en el trabajo, los sueños de los que desean descubrir a las personas que llevarán a sus empresas a lo más alto, los sueños de los que quieren hacer algo bueno por los demás y andan buscando algo único.

PARTICIPA!!!

Contigo financiaremos 15 puestos de trabajo para 15 personas. Abriendo juntos las puertas de su futuro, servirá también como impulso para las empresas que necesitan a estas personas para crecer. Participa¡¡¡

"El mejor discurso de tu vida será el ejemplo de tus acciones. Yo sé que aún a veces te preguntas qué clase de persona eres o qué clase de persona puedes llegar  a ser. Bien, te puedo decir que eres la clase de persona que el mundo necesita y quiero darte las gracias, de antemano, por ser una inﬂuencia positiva para el mundo".
– Javier Iriondo "Donde tus sueños te lleven"



5 Pixeles

10 Pixeles

20 Pixeles

50 Pixeles

100 Pixeles

200 Pixeles

500 Pixeles

1000 Pixeles

5000 Pixeles

1000 Pixeles

20000 Pixeles


Objetivo

Nuestra meta es cubrir los 15 puestos de trabajo que pondremos a disposición de PYMES de manera gratuita, esperamos alcanzar nuestro objetivo, lo que es seguro es que el total de la recaudación se destinará a este fin. 


Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar

Tú colaboración es imprescindible, si lo deseas ponte en contacto con nosotros tequieromequieres@grupoeffort.com

story:
Silicone Meadow is an interactive light art installation - one of the Honorarium Art projects selected for Burning Man Caravansary 2014.

My name is Ieva Marija Dautartaitė (Eve). I'm a graphics designer from Lithuania. For the last few years I've been the lead artist behind several Art projects in the Burning Man and European Regional event - Nowhere. Last year I was the art lead for Lituanica Birds - Lithuania CORE project. This year I need your help to bring another project to the Playa.


Silicone Meadow is a tactile light and sound oasis consisting of 16 sq. m. double plywood platform with 1024 silicone tubes ("the weeds"), softly lit from within by 1024 programmable RGB LEDs. Anyone can step out of the desert and enter the Meadow, to sit or lie down in its soft glow.

I've always been fascinated by the possibilities offered by silicone and how tactile it is. Together with a crew of young but skilled people from the Technarium hackerspace we want to bring the Silicone Meadow to the Black Rock Desert for the Burning Man Caravansary 2014 and let all the participants discover this interactive installation during their journeys at the Deep and Open Playa.


The Silicone Meadow project received an art grant that covered a significant fraction of the material costs. However, in addition to that we need financial support to transport the Silicone Meadow installation parts (around half a ton) from Lithuania, Europe to "The Generator" in Reno, Nevada (U.S.) before Burning Man ($3800) and then later transport it to the Playa. We also have to buy a proper power generator with a box and safety light to provide the electricity for the installation at Burning Man ($1000), we need a bit more silicone tubes ($400) and LEDs ($150). Furthermore, we would like to install a shining tree in the middle of the meadow ($400 in material costs) and an integrated audio system ($300). Finally, we need some power tools, cables, lights and other materials for building and maintaining our Art installation structure on the Playa ($600).



We had already bought 800 meters of silicone tubes ($3700 with shipping and taxes), LEDs, wire and other hardware ($1200) and spent 500 hours making parts and writing code for the Silicone Meadow. Me and our crew had manually soldered the LEDs and 3D-printed the plastic holders for the tubes ($350).


Then we have built a segmented double plywood platform ($900), attached the holders with screws, connected and installed the programmable LEDs and other electronic components to the lower layer of plywood. Finally we cut the tubes and started "growing" the meadow - adding the silicone tubes on the upper layer.



We had already finished  first 9 square meters (3x3m) section of the installation (see the technical description here) and it was presented with huge success at the Culture Night festival in Vilnius, Lithuania. Hundreds of people walked, slept, sat, partied in the Meadow. The design and technical solutions proved to be reliable and scalable. Now we want to increase its area to 16 square meters, install an audio system and add a glowing silicone tree in the center. 

We need your help to improve our Silicone Meadow and then transport it to Nevada from Vilnius, Lithuania. Please support our vision or encourage others to do so - any help is very appreciated!


We have prepared the following perks which are designed or made by our crew members:

A Silicone meadow postcard

Chirp - the plant watering alarm which emits a grasshopper-like sound when your plant dries out!

Anti-mosq - a mosquito-repellent wristband made from soft material and moistened with organic lemongrass oil

Silicone Meadow Notebook - a notebook with silicone meadow on the cover.


The she-wolf of Technarium - a handmade stoneware figure of the cyborg mascot representing the Technarium space. Each will be different, roughly 10-15 cm tall.


Silicone Meadow pillow - check out the image gallery and have a colorful silicone dream!

A segment of the Silicone Meadow - get your own piece of the meadow!
