story:
Who we are:

We are a group of nine emerging artists working in various media, from video to performance to painting to sculpture and beyond. We will be graduating from the MFA program at SUNY Purchase College this May.

Your generous donations would help us with:

  • Our opening reception costs on May 9th at The Highline Loft, 508 W 26th St., 5th Floor, in Chelsea, New York, NY.
  • Advertising to get the word out there!
  • Transportation and production costs.

Perks!:

You will receive a work of art from one of the Purchase MFAs based on your donation level, along with a very very big THANK YOU!

While the perks begin at the 25 dollar donation level, this is by no means the minimum amount that can be donated. Every little bit counts, and we would be grateful for any kind of donation, no matter how small. 

Your donations will go towards actively supporting this group of emerging talents about to set foot into the professional art world.


Check out our work here:

Miyuki Ansari: cargocollective.com/miyukia

Lindsay Garcia: www.lindsaygarcia.com

Samantha Harmon: www.samharmon.com

Christina Healy: www.christina-healy.com

Juwon Lee: www.juwon-lee.com

Karen Lee: www.karenmlee.com

Elizabeth Meyer: https://www.youtube.com/user/phelpsmeyer/videos?view_as=public

Julia Norton: www.julia-norton.com

Ryann Slauson: www.ryannslauson.com

story:
PROJECT

Hi, my name is Annika Kappner, I am a visual artist based in Amsterdam. Latent Colours of the Future Mind II investigates how our desires for control and connection determine our thoughts and actions in daily life and shape our evolution as a species.

Throughout the research I will be looking at the holistic cosmology of the Shipibo and contemporary fantasies of Artificial Intelligence as omnipotent, all connecting and all controlling force. The Shipibo experience the universe as a connected whole, living with and learning from nature. This relationship with life is very different from the often exploitative Western approach.

In September I will attend a residency at Centro Selva Arte y Sciencia in the Peruvian Amazon to learn more about the Shipibo culture, their craft and tradition. Back in Europe I will integrate this new knowledge into my research and produce a multi sensory installation and a publication throughout 2019.

 

YOUR SUPPORT

I am fundraising to sponsor the residency, travel, material and workshop costs for the field research in Peru.

In the last year I have already done part of the theoretical and material research, workshops and consulted with experts. To realize the full potential of the project additional 7500 € are needed.

I need your contribution to pay for travel costs to and in Peru (1900€), 20 day residency (1500€), materials (900€) and a further series of workshops when back in Amsterdam (800€). The remaining part is needed to produce the perks (1800€) and for campaign fees (600€). Any excess funding will go into the exhibitions/publication related to the project.

 

COLLECTION

For the campaign I have designed a limited edition series of high quality printed silk scarves and caps, and made a series of sculptural works based on the research.

The design of the silk pieces intertwines layers of geometric patterns, digital renders, plant and human imagery. The Baseball Cap is embroidered with a Flower of Life symbol that represents perfect form, proportion and harmony. Together with Juliana Gomez from No Water for Whales we made a photo story about the collection.

 

 

ME & THE PROJECT

My practice investigates our experiential relationship with our immediate surroundings and larger structural systems.

www.annikakappner.com

I combine painting, installation, sculpture, sound and performance with other sensory stimuli (e.g. taste, smell, touch) in order to create multi sensory paintings that emphasize the physicality of how we perceive and relate. My work is interested in the evolution of consciousness in relation to mental patterns and their manifestation in visual arts, technology and science.

 

WHY

LCFM II evolves out of field research and an exhibition on Pre-Inca cultures in Lima (2014), based on which I was invited by the Museum of Contemporary Art Lima to present a follow up project. It will explore the unconscious feelings that create existing power structures to imagine emancipation through sensing, rather than thinking and seeing.

I will be truly grateful for your support!

THANK YOU!

Love,

Annika

The Baseball Cap is embroidered with a Flower of Life symbol that represents perfect form, proportion and harmony. Together with Juliana Gomez from No Water for Whales we made a photo story about the collection. 

 ME & THE PROJECTMy practice investigates our experiential relationship with our immediate surroundings and larger structural systems.www.annikakappner.comI combine painting, installation, sculpture, sound and performance with other sensory stimuli (e.g. taste, smell, touch) in order to create multi sensory paintings that emphasize the physicality of how we perceive and relate. My work is interested in the evolution of consciousness in relation to mental patterns and their manifestation in visual arts, technology and science. WHYLCFM II evolves out of field research and an exhibition on Pre-Inca cultures in Lima (2014), based on which I was invited by the Museum of Contemporary Art Lima to present a follow up project. It will explore the unconscious feelings that create existing power structures to imagine emancipation through sensing, rather than thinking and seeing.I will be truly grateful for your support!THANK YOU!Love,Annika

story:
Who we are  

MiXER is organised by D'CLINIC; an independent artists run space, founded in January 2012. We are at home in Lendava, a small historical city in the northeast of Slovenia.

The initiative was started as a platform to support artists by their creative research, fostering creative boldness, risk and experimentation within the contemporary art production.

While located in a predominantly rural area it is furthermore our overall goal to make contemporary art and culture accessible to all regardless of their social status and/or prior artistic knowledge. 

The Story Behind 

"The mobile technology helps us to have our love ones always and everywhere at hand... still, somewhere down the line in spite of these nationwide mass-connections, we loosed our sense of others. Our relationships are turning to became plastic and distillate, a sort of virtual illusion that does not require direct eye-to-eye confrontation. 

We need a new work model.”K.P.

DO YOU HAVE ENOUGH COURAGE TO BACK TEAMWORK?

MiXER is an experiment. Its a cross-disciplinary collaboration between 2 artists who have never met before. This way they are given the opportunity to stimulate their own creativity, exchange and develop as artists and as humans. 

MiXER was created as a method to raise awareness of both the necessity of a face-to-face communication and creativity that is resulting from this (beyond the comfort of one’s studio).  

With a focus on active dialogue, provocative interchange and experimental research we hope to promote an innovative interplay in the working process of creative thinkers and art professionals.

How it works?

Each MiXER slot is organised as a 4 weeks residency based programme with a structured outcome. The invited artists (selected via an open call for artists) from diverse artistic disciplines are paired up to work collaboratively on a new body of work. Furthermore their task is to assemble an ARTISTS’ BOOK covering the leading aspects of their cooperation.

Each residency slot ends with a PUBLIC PRESENTATION of the completed project & the designed ARTIST’S BOOK is published as a limited edition artefact. 

+ to open the idea of co-operation and tolerance to the widest possible number of people we also travel a group exhibition of the published artists’ books to festivals, organise artist’s talks, critique evenings, interactive workshops...

MiXER takes place from March to November each year

What We Need & What You Get 

For the past years MiXER has been providing non-traditional learning opportunities, delivering some most innovative artistic adventures, woven many friendships, been an inspiration to similar initiatives around the globe, but now we need your help to keep this project alive and make it accessible to the broadest possible audience. 

Our overall goal is to make the project free of any additional residency fee that needs to be covered by the participants, and enable attendance also to those artists who do not have the chance or resources to cover a residency fee.

Achieving the set funding goal will make MiXER fee free. And open our door to pure talent rather than “wealth”.

+ Your contribution will enable 16 international talents (selected through an open call to artists) from diverse artistic disciplines to join in this unusual creative journey; between March and November 2015.

This inter alia includes:
+ studio rental & costs,
+ artists accommodation,
+ art materials,
+ artists’ book print,
+ exhibitions set up,
+ documentation,
+ publicity (printed media & other),
+ technical assistance,
+ the organization of the final MiXER group exhibition somewhere abroad (place yet to be selected). 
+ everything else necessary for a productive collaboration 

+ Each contribution counts! Every cent we’ll get will go toward making this collaboration experience to the selected artists as productive and revealing as possible. Giving even just 1 euro will get your name recognition on the D’CLINIC webpage, while supporters who give larger gifts may take advantage of perks exclusive to this campaign. 

+ + +FOR EXAMPLE+ + +

 a hand printed MiXER tee



 a hand printed MiXER cotton bag of your choice



Other Ways You Can Help

If you are unable to donate, that doesn’t mean you can’t help. Spread the word and encourage those who can share their generosity. 

+ Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign

+ Use the indiegogo share tools on facebook and twitter

We look forward to MiXER 2015 and updating you with its progress.
